story:
About the Madonna Foundation

The Franciscan Sisters of Chicago started the Madonna Foundation in 2001 when they had to close Madonna High School due to financial hardships. To continue their ministry of providing quality, all-girl Catholic education to low-income families, the Sisters now provide partial tuition scholarships to well deserving girls to local Catholic High Schools. 

We have a yearly fundraising goal of $20,000

  • The funding will go to general operating expenses - keeping the lights on, paying our one staff member, and scholarships
  • The Madonna Foundation annual awards $150,000 to 60 scholars- an average scholarship of $2,500 per student per school year
  • Scholars in our program have access to additional academic resources, self esteem and leadership workshop, college tours, and spiritual retreats

We make a difference

  • The average Madonna Scholar comes from a family with an income of $8,000 or less per person. Catholic Schools in the area cost $4,500-$11,000/year.
  • Girls who have access to quality education are more likely to become self-sufficient and end cycles of domestic violence 
  • Over the past 5 years, 100% of our scholars have graduated high school and gone on to further education
  • You can invest in the future of a young, bright woman! Raising $20,000 would help us offset the cost of 8 Madonna Scholars for next year

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word!
  • See if your employeer will match gifts
  • Donate items for our silent auction
  • Volunteer!

Contact Information:

Madonna Foundation
1055 W. 175th St. Suite 202
Homewood, IL 60430
Federal Tax ID number: 36-4454351
Annie Ginzkey, Foundation Manager
Cell: (708)269-3149
Email: aginzkey@franciscanservices.com

story:
How do some actors get a break while others are doomed to fail?
Are you sincerely looking for ways to take your acting career to the next level?

Warning: There are very few certainties in life but one thing's for sure...
if you fail to take action now things will never change.

Who am I?

Gemma Kaye. Working Actress. Presenter. Voice-artist. "Voice of" Foxtel Channel Nat Geo People 2014. Psychology nut and former Counsellor (B.Psych.Hons). Elite Performance Coach and Founder of Actor X. #1 Amazon Kindle Best-selling Author.


The Mentorship Gap!

In other industries (law, banking, teaching, hospitality... everywhere!) there is structured education, and then on-the-job training and mentorship, all while being paid. Not so for actors!

We have high competition. No structure. No mentorship or on-the-job training. Large periods of unemployment. And lots of rejection. It creates a heart-breaking gap!

Why Get A Coach?

It is the #1 success strategy of successful people. You would never see an athlete train for the Olympics without a coach! Elite Performance Coaching is for people who are seeking real success, seeking "an edge".


Why Crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding allows us to offer this Elite Performance Coaching and Mentorship package at a drastically reduced price. ie. By having a few people start at the same time, it keeps costs down.


What Will You Get?

10 months of Elite Performance Coaching and Mentorship.
ie. 10 x 1 hour 1:1 coaching and mentoring sessions (in person or Skype)
NB: Coaching tailored to the actors situation, strengths and needs.

Topics may include -

  • how to quit your day job
  • how to get auditions for lead roles
  • how to maximise your "Star Quality"
  • how to get an agent (or a better one)
  • authentic confidence and self-belief
  • goal-setting, planning, networking, marketing
  • the elite performance mindset
  • how to use your intuition to maximise creativity
  • how to create career breakthroughs
  • how to create "personal best" results consistently
  • how to expand every opportunity to the fullest... eg. how I turned an audition for a small one-scene unpaid role, into a paid supporting role in a feature film, opposite a star.

Cost?

Only $575 (instead of $1500).
That's approx 60% off.
NB: Only 12 spots available.

Client Testimonials...


"I have spent the last 5 months [doing coaching] with Gemma. The changes and shifts I have had in my life, both personal and acting related, during this time have been extraordinary. The focus, clarity and drive I have gained is amazing. Thank you Gemma :)" --- Jenelle Altinier, Actress

"When I need advice, Gemma is who I call upon. Her extensive experience obtaining regular work as an actor is so valuable for anyone looking to have a consistent career in the film industry. Gemma's coaching has made a profound difference my career." --- Brinley Meyer, Actress

"Gemma is a gifted and generous leader.  Her psychology background, insight into human behaviour and experience as an actor makes her the perfect mentor in this mercurial industry." --- Anna Cheney, Actress


Only 12 spots available.

    Take action now -

    To secure your spot - Scroll back up. Select the "perk" on the right, click through and follow the Indiegogo instructions. You can pay by credit card, or Paypal. (NB: If you pay via Paypal just a heads up the confirmation comes through in my legal name "Gillian Emmett", Gemma Kaye is my stage name.)

    Happy to chat if you have any questions - info@gemmakaye.com

    It takes a community to create a career :)

    #GoTeam

    Gem xx

story:
Help Us Restore a Future

for Indigenous Families,

United Through Responsible Nurturing.

Contribute & Assist Us in Raising $3600

To Train Two Facilitators

Summary & Intro

We are raising money to participate in Native American Fatherhood & Families Association training/certification Dec 3rd-5th in Mesa, AZ so we may offer this much needed program to the community we live in and surrounding Native communities. Thirty miles in any direction of where we live contains 7 jurisdictions of the 37 Federally Recognized Tribes of Oklahoma. These tribes include Absentee Shawnee, Citizen Potawatomi, Iowa, Kickapoo, Muscogee (Creek), Sac and Fox and Seminole Tribes. This program and its philosophy is something that we are very passionate about and believe will bring a positive change to the future of these communities and their quality of life.

Hello, we are Tosawi Saddler (Chippewa/Cree/Salish/Kootenai/Pend d'Oreille) and Alecia Onzahwah (Absentee Shawnee/Kickapoo/Prairie Band Potawatomi). Tosawi is currently a full time student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science. Alecia has 16 years combined experience in tribal social services, employment and training, along with tribal child support. She is currently a case worker and a student completing her associates’ degree in Liberal Arts with plans to pursue her Bachelors in Public Administration.

While attending a function in the community for children, we noticed that there were few men present to support the children. We discussed this dilemma and tried our best to understand why. We were never able to come to a conclusion that explained the lack of involvement. That is until shortly after, Alecia was fortunate enough to attend a conference where NAFFA was presented in workshops and it was explained; that little attention has been paid to the unique needs of Native men as they struggle to become valuable family participants. Most services and programs focus primarily on the needs of women and children.

Native Americans are feeling the impact of the erosion and breakup of the family along with its great effects in our society. There is an immediate need to bring Native American men back to strengthening families by understanding that they are not the problem but rather the solution through innate leadership abilities and recognizing the sacredness of families. The Fatherhood is Sacred program is designed to strengthen individuals and families by laying a strong foundation of direction and purpose in life. By filling life with Hope, Gratitude and Understanding there is a powerful effect in attitude and behavior change. It inspires and ignites self-motivation to bring that change in a person.

At the request of many of the men in the Fatherhood is Sacred Program, and their desire for the mothers to learn the same principles they were learning, Motherhood is Sacred was developed. By sharing this vision between men and women, they work together to bring happiness and safety to their families.

What We Need & What You Get

Our intent is to help our communities and families by offering this much needed program to any willing to accept it. Facilitator training is $1800 per facilitator and it is necessary for a Fatherhood facilitator along with a Motherhood facilitator to be certified to offer the complete program. This training will cost $3600 for two facilitators one for the Fatherhood and one for the Motherhood program. Facilitator training/certification provides the facilitator the use of copyrighted curriculum, tool kits and certifies the facilitator to implement the Fatherhood/Motherhood is Sacred Programs. Once trained we will do whatever it takes to initiate this program and offer it to the community. There will be some expense in finding a facility to meet with participants, along with materials necessary to provide the education. We believe a suitable location will present itself once the community understands what we are trying to accomplish. We are prepared to provide the materials necessary for the program at our own expense if no support is found or provided through donations. If the goal is not reached to pay for the training we will be providing the difference at our own expense (it is that important to us!). Any additional monies collected over the goal will be used for travel expenses to Mesa, AZ for the training and to assist in implementation of the program.

We have seen many broken families and witnessed too many of our young Native men growing up without a male authority figure or a healthy example of what a Native father should and could be. Fatherhood is leadership; one who leads and prepares the way for family and others by guiding, directing and motivating. Native fathers are the greatest untapped resource for their families and communities. With correct information and support they can find their true potential. Desperation can be transformed into hope and discouragement into self-worth and purpose. We are a great people and come from greatness, a great heritage, history and culture. Greatness must start and be taught and cultivated in the home! Parents must encourage their children to learn about their forefathers and heritage. When we learn about our ancestors, what they stood for, what they valued and what was important to them, we realize that we have much in common. To honor the past we must improve upon the present.

We believe this is a much needed solution to the damage and trauma caused by forced assimilation and attendance in residential boarding schools. Native children that were forced to attend residential boarding schools were never taught healthy parenting or nurturing. They in turn raised their own children as best they could with the example that had been offered to them. That example being the way they had been treated in the residential boarding schools. This is a very personal issue for both of us as we were both raised by survivors of residential Indian boarding schools. It is our dream and goal to curb the cycle initiated by residential boarding schools and help create models of healthy parenting for happy and safe Native families.

The Impact

Program effectiveness will be evident as participants:

  • Understand the Sacredness of Fatherhood / Motherhood
  • Build Character & Integrity
  • Understand the power of wise choices
  • Serve others and contribute to society
  • Gain practical skills in parenting, relationships and social judgment
  • Develop Skills to be responsible and nurturing parents
  • Strengthen identity through understanding Native American heritage


Fatherhood/Motherhood Is Sacred program results:

  • Greater parental involvement
  • Stronger marriages and families
  • Improved ability to find employment and provide financially
  • Reduced recidivism - (the tendency to relapse into a previous condition or mode of behavior)
  • Promotes unity within community to help families and individuals face life’s challenges

The programs have been embraced by Native people, recommended by community and government agencies, utilized by tribal programs and is recognized by the White House as a leading resource for their fatherhood initiatives. This is a great accomplishment; to date this has all been done without any support of federal or state dollars.

  • 100% of participants agree the program is useful in their everyday parenting.
  • 98% of men agree the Fatherhood is Sacred program helped them grow not only as a father, but as a person as well.
  • 99% agree the program helps them manage personal behavior in a responsible way.
  • 98% after completion of program felt motivated to be a good father and understood a child’s need for love and security.

Evaluation conducted August 2005 by Joseph White, PhD and Sean Brotherson, PhD from Dakota Fatherhood Evaluation Services.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to assist with a donation we understand. We ask that you share our cause with everyone and anyone you know that may help. Even if it is just spreading this message through networking you will be contributing to our Native mothers and fathers getting the support they need to be the best parents they can for our children.

story:
Help to send a deserving Vanguard 
to the SkillsUSA State Conference

I am the advisor for the El Modena High School SkillsUSA Chapter.  This is the first year that El Modena High School has a Computer Science Program.  We are just getting started with 5 laptops and 5 tablets but we have learned about maintaining computers and troublshooting problems with them.  We also learn about problem solving, HTML, programming using Scratch and JavaScript, robotics, and data gathering and analysis.  As a part of the new program we formed a chapter of SkillsUSA.  We started with 15 members, elected officers, and set goals.

Our goals for this school year are to compete at the SkillsUSA Regional and State levels, and complete a community service project -- an electronics recycling day. Please help us to reach our goal.

SkillsUSA is a Career and Technical Student Organization that prepared students for the world of work.  The organization builds leadership and technical skills.  

Our chapter went to the SkillsUSA Region 3 conference at the LA Trade and Technical College on January 24 and returned with a gold medal for Computer Technical Applications and a finalist in Electronics Technology.  Both of these winners qualified to compete on the state level. The California State Conference will be held in San Diego from April 9 to 12, 2015.

We can pay for the registration fee but are trying to raise some funds to assist the students with the hotel costs and to have the necessary supplies for competition.  The SkillsUSA uniforms and a regulation tool kit.  

We are trying to raise $750 to help the students go to the conference to compete. If you have ever been involved in a Career and Technical Student Organization, you understand the importance of going to the conferences and the excitement of the competition.  SkillsUSA is a new name for VICA-Vocational and Industrial Clubs of America. There are other Career and Technical Student Organizations such as FBLA-Future Business Leaders of America and DECA-Distributive Education Clubs of America.

story:
Our Story

Panama Project

            Welcome to Kennesaw State University SIFE teamâ€™s Panama Project! We have teamed up with the IPT David High Schoolâ€”a technical school based in David, Panama, whose students are studying the professions of electricians, auto mechanics, carpenters, and metal workers. Unfortunately, the school does not have a training program that teaches the student body business principles or entrepreneurship; it would be greatly beneficial for the students and the future of Panama to be educated in these principles.

With your help, these students will have the means to participate in a three month long, one day a week web seminar in Spanish, which has been designed by the Kennesaw State University SIFE team. The seminars will include discussion sessions and the aid of a teacher and Peace Corps volunteer to ensure understanding of the material.

Along with these web seminars, the students will receive advice and inside knowledge from actual small business owners in Panama, giving them a culturally appropriate perspective on business.

Thank You from the KSU SIFE team and the students of IPT David High School!


What the Contributions are Going Towards?

KSU SIFE is fortunately backing 50% of the funds needed. This page is to help raise the rest.

Internet Service to connect the classroom with our web seminars ~ $111

Hardware, laptop and projector (including a backup) to run the courses ~ $1029.93

Snacks and drinks for students ~ $384

Reserve if hardware breaks or damages ~ $700

Guest speaker fee and field trip for the students ~ $165

Recognition to student for completion or course ~ $110

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our video and help Promote our project!

story:
Short Summary

Zane has been tested and accepted into The Liberty School.  This school focuses on children with dyslexia and also children who are gifted and talented.  It has been a hard last three years getting Zane to want to read or do math.  He could tell you the history about anything you would ever want to know, but unfortunately he isn't reading at grade level.  Now, going into 4th grade, we face an uphill battle. Teachers have told me several times that Zane does better in small groups and at Liberty there are only 22 students. Liberty will truly be the "freedom" Zane needs to move on and become confident and proficient in math and reading; two of the most important skills to have.  By going to The Liberty School, Zane can attain the skills and tools he needs to learn despite of his dyslexia. He can then overcome his learning challenges and have those coping skills for the rest of his life.  I am committed to seeing my son become the best person he can be so that he may bring great things to our community and our world.

Liberty School has given Zane a 50% scholarship but we need to raise money for the rest. Any funds we receive that go beyond our goal will be given to The Liberty School for future tuition for Zane and other children in need of scholarships.

It's simple, the public school system isn't helping students or teachers.  Teachers want to give more attention to each individual student but can't because of large class sizes and lack of resources.  Students are not able to learn at their own pace and in their own way because they are being forced to do what everyone else is doing.  This type of learning doesn't work for those who are falling behind or for those who are way ahead. All families should have the option to give their children education in a way they enjoy and can understand. 

 Thank you for your love and support!!!

Here is a little about Liberty...

http://www.thelibertyschool.org/

The Mission of Liberty School is three fold:

I.To provide optimum educational opportunities for dyslexic, twice-exceptional, and highly academically gifted students to help them realize their intellectual, social, and emotional potential. 

II.To be a resource for parents, educators and other professionals in the 4-corners area. 

III.To offer an outreach to the community by way of informational meetings, guest speakers, workshops, teacher training, and a biyearly conference.

"Our goal and effort is to nurture our students as whole human beings. We value strength of character and self-confidence along with creativity and intellectual prowess. As they grow, students will be reinforced for their intellectual curiosity, the strength of their problem-solving, and their quest for excellence. They also will be encouraged to develop personal flexibility, empathy for others, integrity and kindness. We seek to develop scholarly minds, and as importantly, we seek to develop fine human beings."

What We Need & What You Get

  • Pledge $5 or more

    A hand written thank you letter from Zane AND a visit to The Liberty School with a tour lead by Zane.

    Est. delivery: Sep 2013
     

  • Pledge $50 or more

    Reward #1 AND a hand written letter at the end of the school year showing his progress!

    Est. delivery: Sep 2013
     

  • Pledge $100 or more

    Reward #2 plus a cool T-shirt with Zane's awesome artwork print on it and stating you're a Indiegogo contributor!

    Est. delivery: Sep 2013

The Impact

I feel any investment in education will create a great and positive impact.  Zane is already an amazing person, and with the right education and the ability to boost his reading and math and confidence, we will only feel the upmost amazing things as a community both locally and around the world.  All children should have the opportunity to give back to our society.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, consider sharing this project with others or if you are local, spending time helping at The Liberty School.  There are so many ways to help and they don't always have to be financial.

 

Thank you and much love!

story:
My name is Morgane Rae and I’m a visual artist. I enjoy expressing myself through painting and sculpture. I currently attend Cornish College of the Arts in Seattle Washington http://www.cornish.edu/ and am working on my Bachelors of Fine Arts final art show. With your help I hope to raise $1500 for materials for the final pieces of my exhibit.

ABOUT ME

Since I can remember, I’ve always had an interest in art. I remember spending time with my grandmother, a fine artist herself, to glean techniques and theories. My mother, a talented floral designer, also taught me about the process of work, repetition and composition from her incredible floral designs. Art truly became a crucial component of my life during high school; I started experimenting with painting and drawing and I realized my desire to deepen my knowledge. During my Sophomore year, I decided to transfer to Renaissance High School for the Arts, a visual and performing arts school, because I knew that was where my creativity would be supported and nourished. On registration day, I walked in with my transcripts and portfolio knowing they had already surpassed their attendance capacity for the year. I was convinced that this was where I was supposed to be. The principle recognized my eagerness to learn and saw my budding talent and welcome me to my new school.  I knew he was making an exception for me to attend so I was even more motivated to excel.


My determination was tested every morning! I didn't live locally so it took two trains and a bus to get to school. During those daily two hour trips I learned about my endurance and resilience. My love for the arts was pushed, encouraged, and solidified and in this space I flourished. I learned to trust in my abilities. At Renaissance, I painted my first mural, inspired by Degas, and this is when I knew I could do anything I set my mind to. The Degas mural I painted was larger than life and very representative of his style. I was proud. I discovered in these two immersive years that I was very much in love with art and there was truly no other path I wanted to take. I knew my next step was to further my education by getting a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree.


In my search for art schools, I found Cornish College of the Arts in Seattle. Cornish specializes in visual and performing arts with a challenging program that stresses both concept and craft. When I was accepted my heart soared with excitement for the next adventure. I found myself at Cornish,18 years old, on my own, and 1,000 miles away from home. I was pushed more intensely than ever before and stretched emotionally and creatively far beyond my suspected boundaries/abilities. During this time of growth I discovered my love of sculpture and my intense compatibility with working three dimensionally. I worked with enthusiasm and created pieces that I’m excited to share with others!


My primary inspiration for my work stems from the metaphor and poetry I see in nature. In my time at Cornish I learned to explore fascinations as a way of tapping into my creativity. My fascinations began with patterns, then transitioned to honeycomb, then focused on the life of bees. All of these interests can be found reflected in my work.


My art is riddled with labor intensive processes that involve repetition and time. I’m fixated with the creation process and using my hands physically in my work. My work greatly deals with the emotions of one's journey through life. I speak much about death, pain and suffering, and the way in which processing through these trials can help us grow. But, also about the beauty and intricacies one can find by just slowing down, observing, and savoring.  I dialogue about meditation and silence as means of finding peace.  My recent pieces, “Tension” http://vimeo.com/78384076 and “Release” http://vimeo.com/78384401 illustrate the resistance of pain and trials and finding peace release through letting go.


I’m now in my fourth and final year at Cornish. Quickly approaching is the Cornish Bachelor of Fine Arts (BFA) show. This career launching show is intended to be a reflection of all the knowledge I have gained throughout my Fine Arts education. It is important that the work I create is not only strong but representative of that. I feel that I’m ready to embark on this next journey with the skills that I have gained from my talented professors and classmates, but also with your help! I’m asking for your support to fund my final pieces for my BFA show.


WHAT I NEED


The materials that go into a work of art are expensive! I’m asking for $1500 for the materials and additional expenses towards my final pieces in my BFA.


Expenses include:


  • $200-$500 for materials for each piece materials include things like wood, metal, paper stalk, resin and natural materials like tree branches, stumps, honey, honeycomb, beeswax, metal powders, and clay. I hope to have between 3-5  works in my show.


  • $300 for expenses for framing, postcards, and business cards and documentation.


WHAT YOU GET


If you contribute to my campaign there will be awesome perks!


  • $25 - I’ll send you a postcard of a piece of my work!


  • $50 - I’ll send you weekly photos and email updates on my work in progress as well of sneak peaks of my studio/creation space!


  • $100 - I'll send you a 11x14 high quality signed and dated photo print of a sculptural work! As well as weekly photos and email updates on my work progress!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


If you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help in other ways:


  • You can share this with your friends, family, and co-workers who might be able to donate.


  • Post my link on your social media sites (please!)


  • Send lots of moral support my way during my last semester!


My ability to attend Cornish College of the Arts has been nothing short of miraculous and a direct result of the generosity, love, and support of those who believe in me. Thank you for taking the time to read this and for your support. It really means so much to me!


My work is available to view here: http://morganerae-arts.tumblr.com/

story:
Back By Popular Demand Future Leaders for Israel is hosting TWO conferences this year in Florida and Pennsylvania to network and engage hundreds of students!


Why FLI?

Future Leaders for Israel (FLI) is a registered non-profit with a pending 501(c)3 status that exists to cultivate the next generation of leaders for Israel on college campuses. FLI originated as a grass roots student initiative and after incredible success, evolved into a national entity. FLI is made up of and run by undergraduate, graduate, and recently graduated college students, who recognize and seek to fix 3 major problems that plague the pro-Israel community: 

  • There is no national network of pro-Israel organizations, students, and student organizations
  • Pro-Israel student organizations are isolated within their campuses 
  • Anti-Israel activity is becoming more organized and growing rapidly on college campuses

*Students at the second FLI conference!

Our goal is to create a stronger network of activists for Israel through student and professional unification. We believe that unless our voices are united, fighting for Israel on college campuses is going to continue to be an up-hill battle. We plan to change that! The year of 2014 is going to be a game-changing year in improving the way Israel is perceived on college campuses because of the fact that students will be leading the charge to rally everybody together and be acting pro-actively for Israel. 

*Student organizers of the first FLI conference with Consulate General of Israel to Florida and Puerto Rico, Chaim Shacham. 

Future Leaders for Israel (FLI) originated as the Florida Loves Israel conference (FLI). It was founded by Florida State University students in 2011 in an effort to unite and educate pro-Israel students from around the state of Florida. The conference is designed to operate on a yearly rotating basis, which allows a different university to host FLI each year with new students developing key leadership skills, such as planning and management, not found anywhere else.

WHAT WE HAVE ACCOMPLISHED SO FAR:

  • FLI was ranked the #1 Israel event for visibility, support and impact by the Israel on Campus Coalition between 2010-2012 amongst over 2,300 events on 180 campuses nationwide: Read the article!
  • The inaugural student led grassroots FLI conference took place at FSU on February 2-5, 2012 and was attended by over 130 students from 7 major universities across Florida. The conference also included 14 national and international co-sponsors, which resulted in local, regional, national and international impact. 
  • The University of Florida’s student pro-Israel delegation was selected to host the second annual FLI conference, which took place April 12-14, 2013. It welcomed over 150 students from 9 major Florida Universities and garnered a doubled national and international co-sponsorship from 32 different organizations. 
  • Recognized as one of 2013's pro-Israel highlights on U.S. campuses in the Jewish Press: Read the article!

WHAT WE NEED, WHAT WE'VE GIVEN,

 AND WHAT YOU GET:

  • Right now we need to raise sufficient funds for our 2 upcoming state wide student run conferences. The Florida FLI Conference is being held at Florida Atlantic University and is hosted by the pro-Israel student organization Owls for Israel and the FAU Hillel of Broward and Palm Beach County on March 28th-30th. The Pennsylvania FLI Conference is being held at Hillel JUC of Pittsburgh, hosted by the Hillel and pro-Israel student delegations of the University of Pittsburgh and Carnegie Mellon University on April 6th-8th. Every dollar donated goes directly to the event and makes a huge difference. 
  • ALL of the money raised will go to our conferences and administrative expenses.
  • Depending on how much contributed, you will have the exciting opportunity to be included as main sponsors from our fundraising campaign which will appear on our t-shirts, website, and print materials! 
  • Up until this point many of the student organizers have put up to $8,000 of their own money to get the ball rolling on some of the urgent elements that simply needed to get done. We believe in FLI and are doing whatever it takes to be successful, knowing that at some point down the road the money we invested will make a difference for Israel!

*Students at the first FLI conference showing off their school pride!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We appreciate and need every dollar to make these conferences happen. If you are wondering why should I contribute or What Can One Person Do? Remember, one person can make a world of a difference! You can also further your involvement and promote our goal by:

  • Get the word out about FLI and make some noise about our campaign.
  • LIKE us on Facebook and SHARE all of our exciting updates about the students and conferences
  • Make sure to share this Indiegogo account with friends and encourage them to support our cause
  • SIGN UP and come to one of our amazing conferences
  • Know a student who would make a great leader for this initiative in your state? Encourage them to contact us, so we can make this possible every where!
  • Check out our website and share it with your friends: www.fli.org
  • Lastly, stay informed and always know the FACTS!

Thanks again for viewing our campaign and I hope you can help us make this vision come true! If you would like to donate to a particular conference please specify in your contribution.

story:
Caffeine On Demand is a compelling and energetic new approach to online business training for entrepreneurs everywhere

We are The Caffeine Partnership - we help organisations of all sizes grow their brands, businesses and people, fast. Our consultancy and training practice has generated millions of pounds worth of ROI to our clients.

We’re experts who have worked for many years in large multinational businesses in the fields of business development, branding, marketing and advertising. We have written bestselling books on subjects ranging from Pitching to Win to Building a Brand (see the links below), We’ve worked with clients as diverse as Nissan, BNP Paribas, Orange, McLaren, Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide and Haymarket Media.

Our mission is to stimulate business for everyone, everywhere. But for many people business advice and training is too expensive or too time consuming or not stimulating.  So we are now bringing all our accumulated knowledge and experience together in an online platform of effective training and compelling business advice.  Caffeine On Demand offers a series of affordable video based courses with a host of downloadable support materials so that now you can receive the best of Caffeine in a short, sharp shot, whenever it suits you.

Our online courses should help everyone, from graduates to entrepreneurs, from individuals to teams, from people thinking about starting a business to people whose business is well established, in any sector, anywhere in the world, to accelerate growth for themselves and their businesses.

We plan to launch Caffeine On Demand in September 2014 with six courses covering topics such as How to Win a Pitch, How to Sell Effectively, How to Deliver a Compelling Presentation, How to Be a Brilliant Negotiator, Personality Profiling and Winning More Business from Existing Clients.  Throughout 2015, we plan regularly to add more courses to Caffeine On Demand.  Future topics include How to Build a Brand, Fast Strategy, How to Best Use Social Media and many others.

Clients will be able to choose whether to pay on a course-by-course basis or opt to take out a yearly subscription.  Either way, our courses will be very affordable. 

What we need and what you will get

We’re looking for funding to get this project off the ground and your investment can make this happen (And if you do, we’ve got some fabulous Perks!).

We’re looking to achieve a £65k funding target to pay for both the build of the e-commerce platform and for the implementation of the first six courses and a further six throughout the following year.

If we don’t reach our desired funding targets we’ll use any funds raised to help us subsidise the build of the site.  All Perks will still be redeemable even if our target is not met.

The impact

Your investment will help us offer our expertise to people and businesses in a variety of different sectors globally who may currently not be able to afford this kind of training and business support due to the prohibitive cost of training fees or the lack of HR support.

What our clients say about us...

“Invaluable” – Global CEO – Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide

“The advice and coaching is very practical and based upon real world experience. It is said that ‘those who can, do, and those who cannot, teach.’ This is not the case with Caffeine, they stand up and give a convincing demonstration.” Senior VP – Nissan Europe

“Caffeine – the most merciless critic of flabby presentations”  Editor, British Airways Business Life

Our books...  Brand it like Beckham; BOLD - how to be brave in business & win; Pitching to Win; Uncommon Practice; How to Win Friends & Influence Profits; Don't Mess with the Logo,; See, Think, Feel, Do

 Our website...www.thecaffeinepartnership.com

Other ways you can help

Thank you very much for reading this.  If you choose not to invest, then we wish you the best of luck with whatever you do choose to invest in. If you can think of anyone that might be interested in contributing to our project, then please recommend this page to others; your help will be greatly appreciated.

Caffeine On Demand is all about democratising business training and mentoring and offers a series of affordable video based courses with a host of downloadable support materials to receive the best of Caffeine in a short, sharp shot
story_txt:
Caffeine On Demand is a compelling and energetic new
approach to online business training for entrepreneurs everywhere
We are The Caffeine Partnership - we help organisations
of all sizes grow their brands, businesses and people, fast. Our consultancy
and training practice has generated millions of pounds worth of ROI to our
clients.
We’re experts who have worked for many years in large
multinational businesses in the fields of business development, branding, marketing
and advertising. We have written bestselling books on subjects ranging from
Pitching to Win to Building a Brand (see the links below), We’ve worked with
clients as diverse as Nissan, BNP Paribas, Orange, McLaren, Ogilvy & Mather
Worldwide and Haymarket Media.
Our mission is to stimulate business for everyone,
everywhere. But for many people business advice and training is too expensive
or too time consuming or not stimulating. 
So we are now bringing all our accumulated knowledge and experience
together in an online platform of effective training and compelling
business advice.  Caffeine On Demand offers
a series of affordable video based courses with a host of downloadable support
materials so that now you can receive the best of Caffeine in a short, sharp
shot, whenever it suits you.
Our online courses should help everyone, from graduates to entrepreneurs, from
individuals to teams, from people thinking about starting a business to people
whose business is well established, in any sector, anywhere in the world, to
accelerate growth for themselves and their businesses. 
We plan to launch Caffeine On Demand in September 2014 with six
courses covering topics such as How to Win a Pitch, How to Sell Effectively,
How to Deliver a Compelling Presentation, How to Be a Brilliant Negotiator,
Personality Profiling and Winning More Business from Existing Clients.  Throughout 2015, we plan regularly to add more
courses to Caffeine On Demand.  Future
topics include How to Build a Brand, Fast Strategy, How to Best Use Social
Media and many others.
Clients will be able to choose whether to pay on a
course-by-course basis or opt to take out a yearly subscription.  Either way, our courses will be very
affordable.  
What we need and what you will get
We’re looking for funding to get this project off the ground and your
investment can make this happen (And if you do, we’ve got some fabulous Perks!).
We’re looking to achieve a £65k funding target to pay for
both the build of the e-commerce platform and for the implementation of the
first six courses and a further six throughout the following year.
If we don’t reach our desired funding targets we’ll use any
funds raised to help us subsidise the build of the site.  All Perks will still be redeemable even if our
target is not met.The impact
Your investment will help us offer our expertise to people
and businesses in a variety of different sectors globally who may currently not
be able to afford this kind of training and business support due to the prohibitive
cost of training fees or the lack of HR support.
What our clients say about us...
“Invaluable” – Global CEO – Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide
“The advice and coaching is very practical and based upon
real world experience. It is said that ‘those who can, do, and those who
cannot, teach.’ This is not the case with Caffeine, they stand up and give a
convincing demonstration.” Senior VP – Nissan Europe
“Caffeine – the most merciless critic of flabby
presentations”  Editor, British Airways
Business Life
Our books...  Brand it like Beckham; BOLD - how to be brave in business
& win; Pitching to Win; Uncommon Practice; How to Win Friends &
Influence Profits; Don't Mess with the Logo,; See, Think, Feel, Do
 Our website...www.thecaffeinepartnership.com
Other ways you can help
Thank you very much for reading this.  If
you choose not to invest, then we wish you the best of luck with whatever you
do choose to invest in. If you can think of anyone that might be interested in
contributing to our project, then please recommend this page to others; your
help will be greatly appreciated.
Caffeine On Demand is all about democratising
business training and mentoring and offers a series of affordable video
based courses with a host of downloadable support materials to receive the best
of Caffeine in a short, sharp shot

story:
Green SuperCamp

This is the story…help us make it a reality

Who: A young Kiwi ambassador with a passion and vision for a green future will learn about sustainability in Green Supercamp along with other international representatives.

What: Green Supercamp is the partnership of Supercamp and Green School:

Green school: Self sufficient in principles and practice it teaches green living to youth

Supercamp: Focuses on enhancing academic, leadership, communication and relationship skills in an environment of engaged, successful learning.

Where: At the Green School Bali, Denpasar.

When: Run’s from the 17th to the 23rd of December, 2011

How you can help: We need to raise the money for the flight and ½ the course fees.

Life changing, future changing

This project will result in a young mind becoming aware of the issues of today and the consequences they will have on the future of this planet. Our candidate will educate and spread the word to his/her peers about these issues and what can be done to help.

Help ring the change: Let’s talk logistics

- Flight: NZ$ 1,400-1,800

- Course: NZ $1600 negotiated down to NZ$800

- Total: NZ$ 2,400.

Donations will be banked directly into the Rotaract Club of Wellingtons account.

Bank account number: 38-9011-0518367-00

Name: Rotaract Wellington (reference GSC)

Rotaract is a nonprofit organization by youth for youth; all funds will be explicitly used to aid our young New Zealand ambassador.

Our ambassador will be interviewed by Rotaract and Rotary members, we want someone who contribute back to NZ!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word…our future needs to become a sustainable one, let’s make it happen!

story:
20UNDER40: Re-Inventing the Arts and Arts Education for the 21st Century is an anthology of critical discourse that addresses the impending generational shift in arts leadership by publishing twenty essays about the future of the arts and arts education written by young and emerging arts professionals under the age of forty. In the process of doing so, 20UNDER40 brings the voices of young arts leaders out of the margins and into the forefront of our cultural dialogue.

 

20UNDER40 Needs You!

True to the DIY ethos of the times (and the renegade spirit of the project) on December 1, 2010 20UNDER40 is due to be self-released as a 400 page hardcover book (ISBN: 978-1-4520-6739-1) and ebook (ISBN: 978-1-4520-6740-7). Now in its final stages of production, 20UNDER40 needs your support in procuring the resources necessary to reach the broadest audience, inspire the richest dialogue, and have the greatest impact on the field. A grassroots project to its core, 20UNDER40 is now seeking $15,000.00 to:

  • Fund a marketing/publicity campaign designed to reach all corners of the arts and cultural sector—as well as the broader non-arts public;


  • Support the authors represented within the anthology with the resources necessary for them to engage audiences by participating in public appearances;


  • Redesign the 20UNDER40 website to act as a hub of dialogue concerning the future of the arts and arts education—including an interactive discussion platform for each chapter within the printed anthology, and;


  • Coordinate a publication launch that will bring together the 20UNDER40 community through workshops, author readings, panel discussions, and a celebratory launch party/performance.


 

Join the 20UNDER40 Editor’s Circle:

Don’t just sit there—put your money where your mind is by joining the 20UNDER40 Editor's Circle. Now’s your chance to actively engage in the process of redefining the future of the arts—all you have to do is click on one of the links to the right. Remember, membership has its privileges. For more information regarding Editor’s Circle benefits, please visit the 20UNDER40 website. 

 

More About 20UNDER40:

Now a decade into the 21st Century the way we make, teach, understand, experience, and support the arts is in constant flux. As the arts continue to change in the decades ahead, it will become increasingly more important for the field to tap the ingenuity of its youngest professionals. Ironically, due to low pay, unreliable career paths, frustrating glass ceilings, and a lack of agency and autonomy, the arts sector is currently experiencing an exodus of Gen Xers and Millennials just when it needs the 21st Century insights of these talented young leaders the most. 

 

Inspiring a New Discussion:

Over 300 young arts professionals under the age of forty submitted their ideas for the future of the field in response to 20UNDER40's initial call for chapter proposals. The twenty chapters selected for the anthology represent the most innovative ideas about the future of the arts articulated by a devoted cadre of authors from all corners of the field. The chapters these authors have written intelligently tackle the challenges we now face in the arts while offering bold solutions and renewed hope for the future.

 

Buy a Book, Become an Ambassador, Spread the Word!

The power of 20UNDER40 lies in the critical mass of people it has engaged in dialogue about the future of the arts. In addition to financially backing this project, we encourage you to help us spread the word about 20UNDER40 with your friends and colleagues. To become more involved with 20UNDER40 (and receive additional perks!), please see our website for information regarding our Ambassadors’ Club. To be one of the first people to have a copy of this groundbreaking text—and receive 1/3 off the cover price—be sure to pre-order a copy before November 1, 2010!

story:
*** Thank you , thank you to all of our contributors!  Because of you, we've been able to support six students this month as they've advanced research and development around learning technologies.  We look forward to dolling out Perks--please make sure you've given us your address.  ***
The goal of this one-month project is to generate discoveries and designs that will radically change technology in service of learners from all quarters. We are inviting the most extraordinary students from anywhere in the world to throw themselves into this mission for the month of January. 
Weâ€™ve already handpicked a few students from 4 countries who represent some of our worldâ€™s leading young computer scientists and designers. We need to fund them and to fund as many additional talented students as we can find. We will house selected students in the San Francisco Bay Area for as many days in January as they can stay. Theyâ€™ll work together in Palo Alto. Help Panafold make ELEM:ENT possible.
What will happen:
1. The ELEM:ENT crew will develop new technologies that engage people from all quarters in amazing learning experiences.
2. The new learning technology will be inspired by edge learning communities, and edge factors: art, emotion, attention, and motivation. 
3. If successful, the designs will be folded into eye-opening products that are accessible to broader segments of the globe. 
If we meet our goal, we will create extraordinary designs. If we surpass it, we will invite as many additional students into the process as we can. They are waiting! The students will learn from each other and from thought-leaders in the area.
What You Can Do:
1. Support us at any level. It really matters.
2. Pass the word to a student or to faculty. (Quick, please!)
3. If you are rethinking human learning, please get in contact: element.meg@gmail.com.
Some of our inspirations include: Edgeperspectives by John Seely Brown and John Hagel and A New Culture of Learning by Douglas Thomas and JSB, this TEDx talkand work by Scott Snibbe and this one by Sir Ken Robinson as well as work by Clayton M. Christensen and collaborators, and the vision of Sal Khan.
Who We're Looking For:
 
Students should have a strong desire to
*build technologies that make people's lives better 
*connect with others across the globe 
*be inspired by actual human behavior, imperfect as it is
*remember how to be playful and use computer science, engineering or design skills to invent the future
Thanks for reading, and please join us!

story:
My sister and her family are missionaries in Malawi. They are partnering with a local school to provide Christmas gifts to the most vulnerable children in the area. Malawi has an estimated 1,000,000 orphans and has few resources or facilities to care for so many children. According to UNICEF, nearly 13% of children have lost their parents or caregivers and 17% are living without their biological parents.

For just $10, a child can have a resourceful and fun Christmas gift! Our goal is to get 50 children in Mulanje, Malawi Christmas presents ...

         

 

What does each $10 gift include?

10 liter bucket  (** necessary for transporting well water, bathing, and laundry)

Evangelistic booklet in Chichewa

Bar of soap

Toothpaste

Toothbrush

Children’s book

Educational toy (puzzles, ...

                            


Who is it for?

These gifts are going to children who attend Aifane Sukulu Preschool, a school made up of orphans and vulnerable children under the age of seven. The school is led by four great volunteer teachers. Here are some of the kids at the school.

  


Where will the gifts be purchased?

The money you donate will be used to purchase the supplies listed above from stores in the Mulanje area, so that not only are shipping costs avoided, but also local Mulanje businesses are supported!

What if we raise more than our goal?

If we are able to raise enough money to fund Christmas gifts for these 50 children, we'd like to continue the project to fund Christmas gifts for an additional local orphanage.

What will you get if you participate?

Updates and pictures will be sent out to anyone who is a part of this process.

What if we don't reach our goal?

If we are unable to reach our goal, we will still use the money we have to acquire gifts for all 50 children, though we won't be able to include everything in the package!


Please help us spread the word on facebook and twitter, and Merry Christmas!

story:
Did you know that 1 out of 100 of all Americans are in prison, most for a non-violent crime? If they are African-American males, the number is 1 in 4. Guess who they will meet when they get there? Experienced Criminals. Guess what they will learn from them?

What if they went to a different kind of prison? A place where they learned to respect themselves, to read, to think and solve problems, to work effectively, to learn life skills that lead to success, to be proud of themselves and their accomplishments? What if they graduated from this place and 89% of them never went back to prison again?

Such a program exists. It works. Take a look.

“Help stop the waste of human beings.  Make this film come alive. Help bring this program to other prisons across America.” – Filmmaker James Redmond

In 2004, the New York State Department of Correctional Services (NYSDOCS) documented that the Shock Incarceration Program, directed by Dr. Cheryl Clark, had saved the state of New York an estimated $1.18 billion dollars in cost savings. Presently four Correctional Facilities in New York State operate from the Shock Incarceration model.  

By the end of 2012, almost 46,000 had graduated from the program, with a cost savings of over 1.375 Billion Dollars by the end of 2010 for the State of New York!  In less than 1/4 of the time spent in traditional academic programs, Shock Incarceration participants passed the GED at twice the rate of other academic programs.

Until her retirement in 2010, Dr. Clark was the Director of Shock Incarceration and the Willard Drug Treatment Campus (DTC) for the New York State Department of Correctional Services (NYS DOCS), two of the innovative programs she designed and developed for the Department.

Shock Incarceration is internationally recognized as the leading program of its type in the world. As of reporting for 2007, NYS DOCS research documented the Shock program contributing more than $1.35 billion in cost savings to the taxpayers of New York State for the institutional phase alone!

Your contribution will help us ensure that this important documentary is completed and by doing so, bringing awareness and Dr. Clark’s highly successful program to other prisons across America.

Warehousing people, building expensive prisons, and not working to train and prepare people for life outside will only make matters worse. 

Dr. Clark has devoted her life to creating transformative learning opportunities in prisons, and training staff working in the system to teach prisoners life skills that translate to unprecedented success in society. Filmmaker James Redmond brought his magic and skill to making a powerful film about Dr. Clark’s work and the powerful impact of the program.  This film needs funding to be completed and promoted.

 “Definitely Shock was a very intricate part of me getting on track……getting my life together.  If my mother is there somewhere, looking….she can see and be proud, because I’m not going back to that life and it’s been over 20 years.”
Joshua Brown - Shock Graduate 1991
 “The world is a safer place now with me…..believe me….living the life I am living.  I absolutely know I am rehabilitated – I don’t even think the way I used to think.”
Ruthanne Carpenter – Shock Graduate 2004

If we pay attention to this remarkable work, 

we will all benefit.

story:
Latest Perk:

 

-

------------------------------------------------------------------

Short Summary:

Save school libraries from upcoming budget cuts. Help pay for an 80' billboard that will be mounted AROUND MY ENTIRE RV! Money also needed for banners & signs.

About Me:

  • When I was a boy I hated to read and struggled terribly in school.
  • I'm now a successful Teacher-Librarian who LOVES to read and is passionate about education
  • I spent 10 years at the elem level & I’m about to start my 8th year at alternative HS w/ 650+ at-risk teens
  • I'm dedicated to save our school libraries from budget cuts

 

About Our Movement:

  • We launched a huge Facebook page and attracted over 2,000 fans in less than 6 weeks - 
  • We created a web site and received over 75 articles from our community - www.SupportSchoolLibraries.com
  • We packed a school board meeting with over 600 people and presented to avoid cutting libraries from the budget -


 

 

Examples of My Banners:

 

CONVERTING MY RV:

Click the Tab (Above) for Video Updates:

 

PLEASE SHARE: 

Aside from donating, please share with your Facebook friends, family, and local businesses.

Aside from donating, please share with your Facebook friends, family, and local businesses.

story:
"A society grows great when old men plant trees whose shade they know they shall never sit in."

                                                      - Greek Proverb

"This is great! It provides all the right incentives for students to WANT to succeed in college, and for philanthropists of all levels to support education and alleviate the student debt crisis in which so many Americans are entangled."

                                                      - Valentin Sierra

 

[ email us if you have ANY questions. jasonsummers@altrubanc.com or brianmansell@altrubanc.com ]

What We're Facing

There is a problem, in the United States, that is quickly growing into a crisis. Student loan debt is an issue that could cripple our economy. Outstanding student loan debt is estimated to be between $900 billion and $1 trillion. The average outstanding college debt is over $26,600 and the average time to pay back a student loan is over 10 years. While new graduates are trying to establish themselves they are never fully engaged in the economy until they've paid back their student loans.

Our Solution

altrubanc was formed by a small group of friends and professionals. We have created a new way for students to connect with those that would like to help them succeed. We are a service, and an environment, in which students can get help from sponsors in order to pay for college. For a small annual fee students may exhibit their qualities, academic and other achievements, and plans in order to solicit help from sponsors. A student's profile may contain whatever information that student would like to include. That profile is available at all times and may be changed or updated whenever the student would like to do so.

How it Works

Sponsors do not pay to use altrubanc. A sponsor may have as much, or as little, to do with choosing beneficiaries of their altruism as they'd like. And every sponsor has our guarantee that 100% of support coming through altrubanc goes toward repayment of the chosen students' loans. A sponsor's support helps to alleviate the fear of financial debt of tomorrow as students see the support they're receiving today, allowing them to focus on their education. In the altrubanc system the student decides what information is included in her/his profile. There is space for profile photographs, school information, a biography, documents, letters, photographs- anything the student wants to share. This information is used to build a searchable database that a sponsor can use to find the right students. A sponsor can use any criteria at all to choose students. Maybe a sponsor doesn't want to consider grade point averages. Maybe a sponsor only wants to consider students in a particular field of study. altrubanc makes it easy for sponsors to find those students that they'd like to support. And sponsors don't have to worry about their money going toward individuals that have decided to misrepresent themselves academically. Student accounts are subject to verification.

Another feature of the altrubanc system is that we allow donations of any size from $20 to the entire total of a student's loan/s. Corporations can use altrubanc in addition to, or in place of, the traditional scholarship. Friends can give whenever they feel like helping a little. Grandparents, community groups, anybody can use altrubanc and any student using altrubanc can benefit from sponsors' altruistic spirit.

And we can't think of a better resource for companies to use when recruiting talent.

Here's the Kicker

We think that the previously mentioned features of our system make altrubanc a unique and valuable tool, but here are the ones that make it exceptional. Support cannot be mismanaged because neither the schools, nor the students ever touch the support. And in order for a student to benefit from sponors' support that student must fulfill two very basic requirements: the student must have provided truthful information, and the student must graduate. altrubanc pays directly to loan-holders after graduation. In the case that a student does not fulfill the basic requirements all the support associated with that student goes back to sponsors' accounts to be reallocated to other students. These features set altrubanc apart from any other method of paying for higher education.

The Campaign and Your Impact

The donations we receive today will create a healthier economic environment tomorrow.

Please keep in mind that we can receive any amount as a donation. At most donation levels we offer, as perks, one-year memberships that can be given to students.

We, very much, appreciate any support you can give- including spreading the word about our campaign. If you think that what we're doing is a good idea, then please use whatever means you have availble to let people know what we're doing. Tell students. Tell parents of students of any age. Tell corporations, foundations and student societies. Tell everybody. And please 'Like' us on facebook. Thank you.

 

 

Patent pending

If you think that what we're doing is a good idea, then please use whatever means you have availble to let people know what we're doing. Tell students. Tell parents of students of any age. Tell corporations, foundations and student societies. Tell everybody. And please 'Like' us on facebook. Thank you.

story:
Trollhiem LLC is a new company dedicated to teaching traditional crafts, experimental archeology and having a place to hold living history events for all time frames and cultures. To this end the plan is for Trollhiem LLC to use a site in EarlyCountyGeorgia as a school for traditional crafts and a living history campground.  This is our first step to developing the school and campground.

 The company was founded by Jim Revells, who has been actively involved in living history for almost thirty years, and his daughter Sonja Revells, a professional photographer. 

Jim is known in the Society for Creative Anachronism as Baron Olaf of Trollhiemsfjord.  Within the SCA he has received awards for serving of authentic, but tasty, period meals and for his work in metalsmithing (the Maunche). One of the events he started, "A Market Day at Birka" has been run for over twenty years (See: http://birka.org/) another event he started, "Metalsmiths Symposium" has been run over nine times. (See: http://ekmg.eastkingdom.org/mss/). He has also participated in many Fur Trade era events and Renaissance Faires around the eastern US.  Jim is also a modern jeweler and metalsmith.

Sonja is an award winning news and fine art photographer who has traveled extensively.  During a four month backpacking trek she visited China, Tibet, (where she visited Mount Everest) Nepal, Thailand, Japan and Israel.  She has also visited England, France, Italy, Spain, Canada, Mexico and Puerto Rico on other trips. You can find out more about us on our Facebook pages: Trollhiem LLC or Sonja Revells Photography or Olaf Trollhiemsfjord

We are seeking funds to get our business “on the road” quite literally. We will buy a used school bus and convert it into a camper for traveling all through the United States and Canada. Along with the bus we need some tents, to hold classes in; funds to travel with; tools and camp equipment; a lap top computer; funds to help Jim relocate from New Hampshire to Georgia and finally to install electricity and data communications at our workshops in Georgia.  The bus will be a means of generating interest in our school and campground, as well as generating income by sales of items made in our workshops.  The travel will also allow Sonja to take all sorts of interesting photos.  We will be on the road from one to three weeks each month.

This is not a project that banks or venture capitalists are interested in funding, so we are seeking our funding from people who like our idea.  Jim will attend living history events demonstrating and teaching Viking Age metalsmithing.  We will also be looking for schools that want to have classes on low tech metal casting.  More detailed schedule information is available on the Trollhiem LLC Facebook page.

If we don’t manage to get full funding for this attempt we will put whatever we receive into getting the bus and equipment then try another campaign to raise additional funds.  All the funds will be used to move our plans forward.

Many of the premiums will feature the images that Sonja captures along the road as we go from historic sites to activities at living history events.  The tee shirts, mouse pad and bumper stickers will feature designs by Jim.   The monthly news letter will include photos from the road, commentary by both Jim and Sonja about out trips and what is going on at the workshops as well as commentary by guest and interviews with people along the way.  My granddaughters (seven year old Dalayna and eleven year old Daryan) may even give their opinion on events from time to time.

Most of our premiums are fairly standard, but since Jim is an old Submariner, how does being a "Plank Owner" sound? It is an old Navy tradition, if you are a member of the first crew aboard a Boat/Ship you are a "Plank Owner”. Since anyone that supports us this early in the game is truly helping us get the "Boat" underway. There is a limit of 500 "Plank Owners" who will have their name carved into the wood paneling of the bus and receive a certificate that they are a "Plank Owner" with a photo map of where it is placed.

story:
Updatesof the biggest Contributions


Hosthouse Web Services, a hosting company at Agrinio, Greece.

Matt Mullenweg, the WordPress Founder.

WooThemes, a premium themes business.

Short Summary


ShcoolPress is a project inspired by the need to educate kids around WordPress. There are many things that kids and their parents can learn, while starting to blog, code or even build their business,around WordPress.

SchoolPress will be both an online and an offline project.

We will try to cover every area around Europe ( Hey, it was Greece first and now we are on track to cover all Europe! ), where we will educate Kids ( and based on their Age their parents will be together ) about WordPress and the use of it.

Also, there will be a community web site running, where we will document every trip and all the details around it. At the web site we will suply

1. Documentary of every trip, with the video of the lessons, questions asked and every stuff around the trip.

2. A Different area for every school, so kids or their Parents can login there and ask any questions and solve problems that might appear, from our support team.

3. An online " follow us " area, where we will report where our next trip easy, and a suggestion of where we should go.

4. A suggestion of " where we go next ", will be available. We have planned our trip, but we sure want to go to areas that they actually want us to!

5. Access to premium content ( that will be under subscription, when our trip ends ), where we will publish more than 200 videos of premium tutorials.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We actually need to gather the resources that will cover our expenses. And hey, what are these expenses?

1. We need to create and print a powerful reference guide for the kids. It is important for us to leave something behind, so they can take a look and reference to it, if they need to.

2. We want to cover our traveling expenses. Of course the money are not enough to cover all of cost, but they will be enough to cover a part of it. We will cover the rest by our self. In the end, we do something because we want to offer on a good cause.

3. We need to pay for the VideoGraphy of the trip. It is something which is a bit expensive, but having all that down, will let us create an incredible library of content, which will be available to everyone.


So, we need 6.000€ for our project, and we have already explained to you, what we will cover with that money. We do not wnt you to help us for free. We offer some stuff that we think it will be good to own!

  • An amazing Tshirt, ready to be delivered!
  • A printed reference guide for the kids, which you will love to have at your hands also
  • A huge thank you note at the SchoolPress web site
  • A " thank you for making it true " note at any printed material we will provide.

 

The Impact

What we will offer to the kids and their parents? WordPress is a product that gets most popular every day. Having kids know how to use it, and what they can create, might bring up the opportunity to learn and come up with some ideas for their feature.


We want to educate. We want to offer the knowledge to kids that there are some other things they could learn and help them choose the best for their feature.

We want to learn. Passing time with kids helps everyone to learn more & grab inspiration from them.

We want to practice. Practice for the best WordPress Coding Practices out there!


Who we are?

We are the same people who Organized WordCamp for 2 years in Greece, the same people who have spoken to virus events about WordPress ( Aristoteles Univercity of Thessaloniki, 22o School of Malakopis, TEI of Thessaloniki ) and who have organized WordPress Sessions with success at Loft2Work Thessalonikis.


Other Ways You Can Help Us

So, you do not want to spend just 10 euros to fund our project? There are some other ways also!

    • Please share our campaign to social media networks. Your Impact might help us find the people that are interesting on helping us reach our goal!
    • Write and blog about us. The faster we reach our goal, the faster we will be in a school near you!

Please, take a look on some of the material that we have ready and we will share to ALL THE KIDS!

story:
The students from Shelter Island School have sailed with the students from Block Island and Fisher's Island for a dozen years.

However, due to decreases in education funding, this long standing schooner trip that promotes independence, teamwork and self-esteem along with instruction in maritime history, literature, conservation, navigation, seamanship and cultural studies needs your help.  

In seventh grade, 23 students from the three geographically isolated islands board the ship to connect with new people face-to-face; a rare thing in this day of texting and cellphones.  Kids who have participated in the past refer to it as a life-changing adventure and as a unique opportunity to make new friends and share experiences with others who also live on small island communities accessible only by boat or ferry.  Friendships made on the boat last a long time...many students who first sailed twelve years ago still keep in touch with each other as the years go by.

Students who embark on this journey experience life as it was hundreds of years ago on a two-masted, gaff-rigged schooner.  No cell phones, no i-pods, no showers!  The Black Dog is based on the traditional design of the old whaling and fishing vessels that plied the waters of the Northeastern Atlantic and whose presence was so important to the history and economy of these islands on which the students live.

We are raisng money to offset the out-of-pocket cost for this year's trip and to insure that the tradition will continue in years to come.

The first goal of our fund-raising will be to lower the out-of-pocket costs for the children participating from the Shelter Island School District.  Additional funds will be donated directly to the Shelter Island Education Foundation (a local 401C non-profit) and be earmarked for future schooner trips in years to come.  Any donation is appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, we appreciate your time and consideration.  But perhaps you know someone who is a sailor that might be interested in contributing or an alumnus of any number of educational sailing programs like SEAmester, Ocean Classroom, Soundwaters, Mystic Whaler, etc. and could pass this opportunity on to them.

Thank you!

story:
Who We Are

We are students at The Art Institute of Tampa.  Our Editorial Photography class is running a blog called ISOLoveFlorida that will showcase interesting places to visit in Florida.  We are hoping to raise the funds needed to publish some of our best works from the quarter into a 40-page magazine.  This magazine will be a physical culmination of the quarter, and serve to showcase what we've accomplished during our class.   Due to the high cost of publishing and the low income of college students, the only way we can achieve this goal is through donations from people like you.

What We Need & What You Get

To have 150 copies of our magazine made, we were quoted a price of $800.  The entirety of this money would go to the publishing costs we were quoted.  The additional $50 is for IndieGogo fees.

As incentives for donations, we will be offering signed copies of the magazine, printed thank you's and much more!

If we do not reach our goal, the funds will still go entirely to publishing costs.  The students of the class will be splitting the costs of any funds not obtained.

Why Donate

Throughout the quarter, we will be learning Editorial Photography and showcasing that work on our blog.  You can look through the blog, periodically, to get an idea of the type of work that will make the magazine.  Your contributions will be helping us distribute our work, as well as showcasing interesting places in Florida.

Risks & Challenges

As of right now, our class of 10 students will have to come up with $100 each to cover publishing costs.  That is quite the task for college students, so we made the collective decision to reach out to the public.  Every dollar donated to our campaign helps to alleviate the costs we need for publishing.

If we are unable to reach our goal, then we still use the funds for publishing and that will help us to diminish our out of pocket expenses for publishing.

If we are able to reach more than our goal, then we will be able to publish more copies to spread our work further!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are like us and don't have the funds to donate directly, then simply sharing this with your friends and family can help make an impact!  If you can help us get the word out to people who can donate to our cause, then its like donating indirectly!  Thank you for your time and consideration!

  Why Donate
Throughout the quarter, we will be learning Editorial Photography and showcasing that work on our blog.  You can look through the blog, periodically, to get an idea of the type of work that will make the magazine.  Your contributions will be helping us distribute our work, as well as showcasing interesting places in Florida.
  Risks & Challenges As of right now, our class of 10 students will have to come up with $100 each to cover publishing costs.  That is quite the task for college students, so we made the collective decision to reach out to the public.  Every dollar donated to our campaign helps to alleviate the costs we need for publishing.
If we are unable to reach our goal, then we still use the funds for publishing and that will help us to diminish our out of pocket expenses for publishing.
If we are able to reach more than our goal, then we will be able to publish more copies to spread our work further!
  Other Ways You Can Help If you are like us and don't have the funds to donate directly, then simply sharing this with your friends and family can help make an impact!  If you can help us get the word out to people who can donate to our cause, then its like donating indirectly!  Thank you for your time and consideration!

story: Hi, I am a student and I have been working to fund my school’s service learning projects including speakers and trips. To do my part, I have been trying to raise $500 for this project. Our school goes on trips to places like Windsong, Kitt Peak, The 4 H High Ropes Course, and many others. Your donation of $5 or $10 will earn you a perk, the knowledge that you have enhanced student experiences at my middle school, and finally my gratitude.

story:
For the first time, Classen SAS has 3 teams that won both regional and state competitions and has earned the right to send 20 students to the Odyssey of the Mind WORLD competition. 

Odyssey of the Mind is an international organization dedicated to the task of challenging students to think creatively, to use innovation and to recognize the power of teamwork. On May 22-27, our students will travel to the Iowa State University to represent Oklahoma along side other schools, states and nations to showcase their talents in art, engineering, science and performance with some 14 countries and 16,000 participants giving each student opportunity to meet new friends and learn about other countries as well as complete their solution in an international arena.

In order to provide our students this lifetime opportunity, we need your help in raising funds. Expenses including registration, room and board and transportation are just over $1,000 per student. We need sponsors from business as well as the community.

The students are in a broad range of fund raising activities including food sales, an art auction, a middle school dance, but it will not be enough.
Please help these incredible students reach their goals and get to the world competition that they have already earned.
