About Louis:
* Born, raised and still lives in the same town: Warwick,NY
* Was top runner in high school  - several records including Nike Outdoor National Champion
* Went to college and studied Architecture.  (he’s no dummy and very handy)
* NCAA Conference Champion in college
* He is a vegetarian. 
* With the love and support of his parents, he lives at home.  In return he must take care of the house and is volunteered for family stuff like remodeling his Grandmother’s kitchen is his spare time!
* Is moving to Colorado end of May to train with other Olympic hopefuls and be closer to his coach.
 

                              Visualizing Success

story:
Rays of Grace believes in a life that is filled with loads of joy, tangible love, meaningful relationships and meeting people where they are.  For the past four years, this love has taken us thousands of miles across the ocean and deep into the jungle to a little place called Kirugu, Uganda.  We spent time immersing ourselves into a culture and a way of life that was and is nothing short of beautiful.  It was no longer "us" and "them", but rather, "we are all family".  

Rays of Grace spent time listening to our community in Kirugu, asking them what they need rather than telling them what we have to offer them.  Time and again, we heard a resounding answer: education.  When given the proper tools, the feelings of empowerment and self-worth sets a fire in the human soul.  With incredible teamwork and a united front of Ugandans and Americans, we began to dream big dreams and pray HUGE prayers, knowing that we could not do this alone.

Our brave and courageous Ugandan Founder, Muwuliza Jackson, established Mountain of Olives Nursery and Primary school and so graciously allowed Rays of Grace to partner with him in the sustainable development of the community of Kirugu through education.  

Mountain of Olives now serves a little under 500 children and their families.  The future holds hope and excitement as we plan for a new school structure, agriculture projects, clean water projects and micro finance businesses.  

As we focus on developing the grounds of our new school, Jackson grins from ear to ear at the thought of a proper playground and soccer field.  To bless not only our immediate students, but the community as well with an area to get out and be active, will bring endless amounts of fun, games and a space for the community to gather.

Thank you for joining the journey, you are impacting so many beautiful souls an ocean away!
story_txt:
Rays of Grace believes in a life that is
filled with loads of joy, tangible love, meaningful relationships and meeting
people where they are.  For the past four years, this love has taken us
thousands of miles across the ocean and deep into the jungle to a little place
called Kirugu, Uganda.  We spent time immersing ourselves into a culture
and a way of life that was and is nothing short of beautiful.  It was no
longer "us" and "them", but rather, "we are all family".
 
Rays of Grace spent time listening to
our community in Kirugu, asking them what they need rather than telling them
what we have to offer them.  Time and again, we heard a resounding answer:
education.  When given the proper tools, the feelings of empowerment and
self-worth sets a fire in the human soul.  With incredible teamwork and a
united front of Ugandans and Americans, we began to dream big dreams and pray
HUGE prayers, knowing that we could not do this alone.
Our brave and courageous Ugandan
Founder, Muwuliza Jackson, established Mountain of Olives Nursery and Primary
school and so graciously allowed Rays of Grace to partner with him in the
sustainable development of the community of Kirugu through education.  
Mountain of Olives now serves a
little under 500 children and their families.  The future holds hope and
excitement as we plan for a new school structure, agriculture projects, clean
water projects and micro finance businesses.  
As we focus on developing the
grounds of our new school, Jackson grins from ear to ear at the thought of a
proper playground and soccer field.  To bless not only our immediate
students, but the community as well with an area to get out and be active, will
bring endless amounts of fun, games and a space for the community to gather.
Thank you for joining the journey,
you are impacting so many beautiful souls an ocean away!

Each year members of the faith community and the our families and friends raise funds to assist families that need heat.

This year we want to help 100 families with their heating needs.

story:
Hey There!

Thanks for clicking on the Proudli  campaign! 

Proudli is a social commerce app, designed to unify commerce of the global African diaspora by facilitating multiple internet based black owned  businesses.

  Proudli is  a combination of all the features of Facebook and Amazon. Why not just go to Facebook or Amazon you say? Well sparky,commerce only makes up 2% of Facebook's revenue because users do not go to Facebook for business and black consumers have been scratching their heads as to how and where to spend their 1.3 Trillion dollars USD with black owned businesses. Proudli is US patent pending and is  available in the Apple store and on Google Play to serve this need.

ABOUT PROUDLI

ABOUT THE DEVELOPER

My name is Renae Bruce-Miller, the Developer of the Proudli App. 

I first learned to invest in tech stocks when I was 21 years old and spent a great deal of time watching and learning the evolution of the internet developments. While waiting on the sidelines, I worked for top fortune 500 Companies in the United States for several years and became passionate about entrepreneurism, business development and business consulting. In the meantime, I learned from other startup failures and successes and business models, before entering the internet space. I developed 6 predecessors to Proudli, before I got it right and entered the social commerce space at its emergence to benefit from future projection and exponential growth of this business model.


WHY BLACK BUSINESSES FAIL 


THE NEED FOR PROUDLI


Black owned businesses are failing globally as they are dispersed far and wide in the United States Great Britain and Canada and in the Caribbean they are struggling with imported goods instead of locally manufactured goods.  Proudli solves this problem by bringing together the powerful tools of Social Networking and Online Commerce. Blacks also do not own and control their own media and are challenged in being able to afford advertising on main stream media to reach their consumers. Proudli addresses this need as well through low cost affordable but powerful advertising.


THIS CAMPAIGN

I have worked really hard over the past year to develop this project and have received a lot of media exposure but Proudli needs consistent advertising in certain markets to build a steady stream of users. 

This campaign is designed to raise funds for advertising, hiring a web master  and  to assist me  as the work is far beyond the grasp of one girl and her HP laptop.

Contributors will help me to achieve growth and development of not only my business, but other black owned businesses across the world to reach new customers and make an impact in their lives and communities. 


What Proudli Needs & What You Get

  • Proudli needs approximately 250,000 USD that will go towards advertising in the United States, the Caribbean, Canada and the United Kingdom as well as web development and hiring tech assistants to expand the project.  
  • If I do not reach my entire campaign goal, depending on how much is raised the funds will be used for site improvement, technical developments, maintenance  advertising and to send you a snazzy thank you gift. (who says snazzy anyway? lol)

Our Impact

The difference between the current global failure of black owned businesses and the successful growth of opportunities for black business owners and strong community development is US. 

WE  are a part of the equation, you see the poor black communities and the failure of black owned businesses with your own eyes. 

You see the correlation between poor economic power and political power. You see black owned businesses struggling, failing and folding right along with their communities as our money is leaked into the hands of others who are not interested in funding our private schools or building our businesses. 

 I have done all that  I could do within my power and now I need your help.

There is a place for black owned businesses, a place to dream, to try and to succeed. That place is called Proudli.

  •  Now is the time to act, social commerce for the global African diaspora to practice group economics is the way in which black owned businesses from around the world will built relationships and find new customers.
  • Black Consumers are the largest online shoppers but very little is being spent with black owned businesses.
  •  Your contributions are a part of a movement that is sorely needed to build our communities I have come a long way by myself but I need your help. 
  • This project is more than my company, this project is about every black owned company in the world and the future of our children. 


Risks & Challenges

As the sole developer/Owner/CEO and head dreamer of this project, I have  faced many challenges and I understand that there are future challenges to come but I have the foresight, experience, grit and the tenacity to stay the course and captain the ship through whatever the storm. I am not a quitter and it is proven through these events below.

  • I believe the hardest part about this project is behind me because this project is an idea that has been circling in my head since 2005 and it took a brain tumor to bring me to my senses in 2013 to actually bring it to life. I was so afraid of dying with my gifts, that I used this project to get myself better. I have overcome many physical and personal challenges to see this business realized and will continue to make necessary sacrifices in the future.
  •  I have invested everything I own and sold all my furniture and my car on Craigslist and presently living on the charity of friends in Jamaica where I moved to Jamaica to heal myself.
  • I currently  work pro bono  at a radio station producing and hosting a high value content show about entrepreneurism to spread the word about Proudli. I have been hungry, exhausted and emotionally drained but this idea is much bigger than I am and I refuse to let it die. In fact it is no longer an idea but a right to exist.
  • On December 02, 2014-Proudli was  selected by Oasis500,one of the top tech funding accelerators in the world located in Amman Jordan to receive investments and mentorship, but I  was unable to make the trip because I couldn't afford the airfare. It was  very disheartening,devastating  and demoralizing to know that only a few thousand dollars came between so much hard work and the opportunity to grow this company, but I am a fighter and decided to take the fact that Proudli beat out other tech start ups for such a coveted spot as a sign of encouragement and not defeat. Being selected by Oasis500  proves to me that Proudli is ready by all measures and all I need is a little financial assistance. I will use your funds to fight for this company,grow this company, hire people and develop it no matter what happens because the future of black business development depends on it. 
Other Ways You Can Help

Join Proudli today, invite friends and upload positive information useful to the needs of the global African diaspora. Use Proudli everyday because as it grows, I will be able to hire more, grow more and build our foot print in the tech world.

  • Bring your groups, your pages and your music and your stores to Proudli.com.
  • Import your images from Instagram, Picassa, Facebook and Flicker.
  • Keep a pinboard of your favorite things or your business and share with friends.
  • Get the word out, share this Indiegogo campaign, tweet, blog, facebook and twitter as frequently as possible.

Click the blue link below for more information on Proudli Thank You!

Proudli Research and Development


SITE SCREENSHOTS

story:
Attention! Si vous désirez une contrepartie, il suffit de cliquer dessus et vous serez redirigés, les autres contributions sont des dons sans contrepartie.

Vous n'aimez pas Paypal?

Si vous préférez faire un don via un virement, notre numéro de compte est le : 

BE58 6511 5555 6579

Spécifiez votre nom que l'on puisse vous remercier!


Le projet Mission to Mars UCL:

Cette année encore, une équipe de sept étudiants de l’Université Catholique de Louvain (UCL, Louvain-la-Neuve) participe au projet Mission to Mars UCL développé par la Mars Society américaine. Ce projet consiste en une simulation réaliste d’une mission scientifique sur la planète Mars, dans une base implantée dans le désert de l’Utah, la Mars Desert Research Station (MDRS).

Ce projet à également soutenu par Frank De Winne, L'astronaute belge et le premier commandant européen de la station internationale (ISS).

La simulation dans la base durera du 19 mars au 3 avril 2016.


L'équipage:

L’équipage 166 est le quatrième équipage à partir sous le nom de Mission to Mars UCL. L’équipe se compose d’une bio-ingénieure, cinq ingénieurs et un astrophysicien.

Six des sept étudiants constituant l’équipage 166 devront conduire une série d’expériences afin de tester à la fois l’équipement mais aussi des protocoles d’expériences en conditions rappelant celles de l’exploration martienne. Le but premier de ce projet est d’identifier les difficultés que les scientifiques devraient surmonter en réalisant leurs expériences sur la planète rouge.

Le dernier sera un support “terrestre” et aidera à l’analyse des résultats, ainsi qu’à la transmission d’informations vers le monde extérieur.


L'impact de votre contribution:

Les fonds obtenus seront utilisés pour financer notre expédition. 

Budget:
  • Billet d'avion : 3324€
  • Location de la base : 3000€
  • Location de voitures : 300€
  • Expériences: 2000€
  • Combinaisons et vestes: 800€
  • Beps : 270€
Si la limite des 1.500€ n'est pas atteinte, l'argent récolté financera, dans un premier temps, nos expériences.
En participant à cette récolte de fonds, vous vous trouverez associés à cet ambitieux projet mené par notre équipe d'étudiants. Vous témoignerez ainsi de votre intérêt pour la découverte scientifique et les challenges humains et techniques. 
Un humble geste dans ce grand projet qu'est de mettre le pied sur Mars.


Nos expériences:

  • Astronomie

Spectroscopie d’étoiles et de planètes. Le but de cette expérience est de déterminer la composition d’étoiles brillantes et des planètes visibles grâce à la lumière qui nous parvient d’elles. Sur Terre l'atmosphère nui à ce type de mesure mais sur Mars l’atmosphère plus faible interfère moins.

  • Microbiologie

Notre projet consisterait à découvrir des traces de vie bactérienne sur des roches provenant du désert entourant la base, de les mettre en culture et de les caractériser d'un point de vue phénotypique et/ou biochimique grâce à une batterie de tests qui seraient applicables en conditions martiennes. 

  • Carte 3D

Ce projet consiste en l’élaboration d’une carte 3D représentant le relief du terrain autour de la base. Cela permettrait aux équipages sur place de mieux connaître le terrain et donc de pouvoir planifier les itinéraires pour leurs éventuelles sorties à l’avance. De plus, la carte comprendrait les principales caractéristiques du terrain, ce qui permettrait notamment d’identifier les zones dangereuses.

  • Localisation des zones de danger
Cette expérience concerne les zones de dangers, en utilisant de petits émetteurs zigbee placés près de zones dangereuses (ravins, trous,...) et des processeurs Arduino, l’objectif est d’être capable de prévenir les membres en sortie quand ils s’approchent d’une de ces zones.
  • Relais radio
Cette expérience porte sur l’utilisation de relais de communication, composé de deux radios portables et d’un répéteur reliant les deux, entre la base et les membres de l’équipage en sortie. En effet, le terrain peut rendre les radiocommunications difficiles et un  relais radio permettrait aux équipes en sortie extra-véhiculaires de bénéficier d’une meilleure couverture radio.

Parlez-en autour de vous!

story:
Project Introduction


Escondido Charter High School, founded in 1996, is a top-performing and highly acclaimed high school dedicated to academic excellence and character. It promotes a close-knit culture between students, teachers, parents, and the community, and it has been an amazing place for students to grow and thrive since its creation.

For years, however, our small high school's senior lawn has sat empty and unusable. With the current drought, it is both difficult to maintain and expensive to water, and as such, this project was created to renovate it and make it both usable and beautiful.



 It needs tables, shade, and other important elements to make it a usable and water-wise space which can be enjoyed for years to come. We are raising funds to purchase these items, and coupled with donations from local businesses, we will be able to re-make the space over the course of 3 phases.

The first phase will be to remove the first area of lawn and replace it with water-wise materials and plants. This will begin to save the school money and will be the foundation for the project's progress.



At the second phase, fundraising will be completed and we will proceed to purchase the items as we also plant new bushes to fill out the landscape and prepare to install all of the furnishings. 


For the final phase, we will remove one more small area for the tables and replace it, also installing the purchased items to complete the project. The furnishings are as follows: 4 tables, 4 umbrellas, 3 benches, 2 outdoor activities, and 3 area shades. When this is done, the senior lawn will be a vibrant and usable area that will leave a legacy and allow current and future students to enjoy the reward of our efforts.



Through this process, we will create the new senior lawn that can be used and enjoyed well into the future. This will require a group effort of our current attendees, our alumni, and our community, but we believe that we can come together and accomplish this goal. We have the plan all set and ready to go, but we just need your support to get this project going. Please help us achieve this dream and make a difference at Charter. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5500 dollars total, all of which will go straight back to the school and the project. We need these funds to purchase the necessary tables, umbrellas, shades, benches, and other items we need to make the space usable and enjoyable. 

If you choose to support us, we have a variety of perks available, ranging from a "Thank you" email with a digital photo to a bundle with a premium recognition plaque, a ECHS T-shirt, Stickers, a thank you note signed from the whole senior class, and more. Please check them out to the side. 

If we don't quite reach our goal, we'll simplify the project to its bare bones so it can be used. However, it won't be as enjoyable, so we really hope that we as a community can come together and support this project. 

The Impact

This project would leave a lasting legacy at our school and in Escondido. It gives back to the teachers and the community in a special way that will allow everyone to enjoy the space for years to come. 



Risks & Challenges

With this being an El Nino year in California, the possibility of work delays may lead to an impossibility of completion of the project during this school year. If this is the case, then we will complete as much of the project as possible and continue over the course of the next school year to finish the project. If we are not able to get as many donations as hoped, then we will scale down the plan to what is absolutely essential. Finally, if we are unable to get enough volunteer support to implement the project, the school's National Honor Society club and other clubs will be asked to step in.

Overall, however, we view the risks as only potential obstacles and are very optimistic about this project. Please join us and help bring life to our senior lawn and make a positive difference in our community.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help directly, please get the word out to other Charterers and community members!

Through this process, we will create the new senior lawn that can be used and enjoyed well into the future. This will require a group effort of our current attendees, our alumni, and our community, but we believe that we can come together and accomplish this goal. We have the plan all set and ready to go, but we just need your support to get this project going. Please help us achieve this dream and make a difference at Charter. 





   What We Need & What You Get We need $5500 dollars total, all of which will go straight back to the school and the project. We need these funds to purchase the necessary tables, umbrellas, shades, benches, and other items we need to make the space usable and enjoyable. 
If you choose to support us, we have a variety of perks available, ranging from a "Thank you" email with a digital photo to a bundle with a premium recognition plaque, a ECHS T-shirt, Stickers, a thank you note signed from the whole senior class, and more. Please check them out to the side. 
If we don't quite reach our goal, we'll simplify the project to its bare bones so it can be used. However, it won't be as enjoyable, so we really hope that we as a community can come together and support this project. 
   The Impact This project would leave a lasting legacy at our school and in Escondido. It gives back to the teachers and the community in a special way that will allow everyone to enjoy the space for years to come. 



   Risks & Challenges

With this being an El Nino year in California, the possibility of work delays may lead to an impossibility of completion of the project during this school year. If this is the case, then we will complete as much of the project as possible and continue over the course of the next school year to finish the project. If we are not able to get as many donations as hoped, then we will scale down the plan to what is absolutely essential. Finally, if we are unable to get enough volunteer support to implement the project, the school's National Honor Society club and other clubs will be asked to step in.
Overall, however, we view the risks as only potential obstacles and are very optimistic about this project. Please join us and help bring life to our senior lawn and make a positive difference in our community.


    Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to help directly, please get the word out to other Charterers and community members!

story:
↓ ENGLISH   FRANÇAIS   ČESKY   ITALIANO  ↓

 

 

Experimental International Project “Migrating Art Historians”

 
 

The project Migrating Art Historians proposes a new look on the Middle Ages. We will walk 1,500 km on medieval pilgrimage routes and collect material which we will then share with you. We will prepare online courses, 12 short films, a collective monograph, dozens of lectures accessible online, wonderful photographs and more.

This project joins in students and professors from universities in France, Italy, Germany, Switzerland, the USA and the Czech Republic. They want to open the question of arts and pilgrimage in the Middle Ages to the general public. Our aim is also to change the way the university is perceived. It should no longer be an exclusively theoretical institution, but should become an actual experience. The project is a unique experiment that could change the history of art.

To achieve it, we need your support.

Migrating Art Historians is a unique project based on our aim to study artworks through the physical experience of a body.

We will leave the classrooms of the university to walk for the entire semester, in order to approach artworks personally and study them in their natural environment.

Among our biggest supporters are, in addition to Hans Belting, Balzan prize winner, such authorities as Bissera Pentcheva from Stanford University and Herbert L. Kessler from Johns Hopkins University.

Institutionally, we are supported by Masaryk University, which covers this project and partially supports us financially. Moreover, the University has also approved a special study plan for the students taking part in the project. Yet, there are still other important supporters - the cloisters, which have agreed to host us and allow us to study and rest within their facilities.

This project will also include the participation of scholars such as Michele Bacci from the University of Fribourg; Stefano D'Ovidio, Bibliotheca Hertziana, Max-Planck-Institut für Kunstgeschichte; Daniela Mondini, Università della Svizzera italiana; Éric Palazzo from the University of Poitiers.

This project is experimental and exceptional in many aspects. Following the example of medieval pilgrims, we will travel on foot. After weeks of walking, sleeping without shelter and without the help of most modern conveniences, we will be tired and will have to overcome physical obstacles and pain. By renouncing modern means of transport, we will experience a slowing of time.

All of this will change our perception of the artworks.

That said, we are absolutely aware that we cannot re-live the medieval person’s experience and feelings. On the other hand, we do believe it is possible, in many aspects, to get closer to the pre-modern reception of the art works. In modern times, we are used to looking at the objects quickly and from a close perspective. The pilgrimage, following the rhythm of human pace, offers a new point of view, as we already experienced during our summer walks in the last five years.

Thus Migrating Art Historians presents an innovative approach to education. After theoretical preparation, students will study the objects personally in situ with all the above-mentioned aspects. Their task will be to present their results not only within the frame of the university program but also to communicate them to the general public. 

Although experimental and innovative, the project Migrating Art Historians is grounded on already acquired experiences. It has risen from observations collected on French and Italian medieval pilgrimage routes during the past five years. These five summer walks have completely changed our point of view on medieval objects. That is why a group of twelve art historians decided to broaden their experience as well as to put it into a specific scientific framework and – with the help of modern technology – to transmit it to a wider audience.

 

That is why we need you!

We have invited specialists to give courses and write contributions to the final monograph. We will ourselves write about the artworks we encounter. Our team includes graphic designers experienced in producing books as well as filmmakers, well-trained in the preparation of study materials, working for the e-learning platform of Masaryk University.

 

We need enthusiastic supporters.

We want to share this whole experience with you. To open the seemingly closed field of art history. We want to transmit our experience to the general public.

For this reason, we need funding.

 

 

With the amount of €6.300 that the Department of Art History of Masaryk University in Brno has given to the project, the costs involved for the organization of the lectures in the cloisters are partially covered. From private sponsors, we have already collected €3.000 for the same purpose.  

To to be able to transmit the results of our journey to you, we need your help to cover the expenses connected to filming and postproduction. That amount, including technical equipment, is estimated at 15 965. The production of our second output – final monograph gathering information on the artworks studied – is estimated at 6000

Despite the fact that we will live in a low-cost way, some support to pay living costs during the walk will be necessary. The estimation of living costs has been pushed to its lowest level possible, being €7/day/person, for a total of €10.080.

Some of our students are already earning a living. For this reason, we need to support their basic necessities during the walk since they are interrupting their employment activity to dedicate themselves entirely to the project.

Since we have already undertaken five walking pilgrimages during the past years, we do not need to buy the basic equipment. However, this time we will start at the end of winter, and for this reason we will need to complete our gear. The estimated expenses per person are €550 – an amount that is difficult to raise for some students.  

 

We would be very grateful if you decide to support us.

If you like our project but can not support us financially, please pass this message along to any person who might be interested.

 

The Itinerary

 

From Lausanne to Mont-Saint-Michel, we will travel 1,500 kilometers on foot in 4 months (from 1st March to the end of June), following and crossing three main medieval pilgrimage roads (Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis).

We will go through the cities where important monuments, subjects of our research are located, such as Geneva, Lyon, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours and Rennes. We will walk three weeks, which will be followed by three-week breaks spent within the monasteries (Conques, Saint Benoît sur Loire, Mont Saint Michel).

These are the places, where significant scholars in our field will meet us. Through a series of lectures and discussions, these scholars will help us to move forward in our research resulting in our master theses as well as in the final monograph. These are also places from where we will prepare movies for you, and from where we will stream the lectures online, on the Masaryk University e-learning platform.

 

More About Us

Most of the participants of the project belong to the Center for Early Medieval Studies at Masaryk University in Brno (CZ), founded in 2012 by Ivan Foletti. The project is one of the Center's many activities.

Since its foundation, the Center has organized many international conferences, invited the most significant scholars of the field, founded the prestigious international journal Convivium and published several books. With its regular lectures entitled StredoveC JinaX, the Center also seeks contact with a non-academic audience.

These activities of the Center have attracted attention of one of the most important living art historians, Hans Belting, who, together with Christa Belting-Ihm, donated their collection of literature on medieval art to the Center. With the quality of the collection acquired, the Center has risen to the level of the best European institutions.

Other members of the project responsible for filmmaking and technical support are based at the E-learning Office, Faculty of Arts, Masaryk University.

If you want to learn more about the participants see our web site.

 

***

 

Projet international et expérimental « Historiens de l'art migrateurs »

 

 

Le projet « Historiens de l’art migrateur » propose un regard nouveau sur le Moyen Âge. Nous allons marcher 1500 km le long des routes de pèlerinage médiévales et recueillir des expériences que nous allons partager avec vous. Nous allons préparer des cours online pour vous, 12 court-métrages, une monographie collective, des dizaines de conférences accessibles online, des photos merveilleuses et bien plus encore.

Au sein du projet des étudiants avec des professeurs d’universités de France, d’Italie, d’Allemagne, de Suisse, des Etats-Unis et de la République tchèque vont participer. Ils souhaitent ouvrir la question des arts et du pèlerinage au Moyen Âge au grand public.

Notre but est de changer la manière dont l’université est perçue. Elle ne doit plus être simplement une institution théorique, mais devenir une véritable expérimentation. Le projet est une expérience unique qui pourrait changer l’histoire de l’art.

Pour le réaliser nous avons besoin de votre aide.

« Historiens de l’art migrateurs » est un projet unique, basé sur notre but d’étudier les œuvres d’art à travers l’expérience physique de notre corps.

Nous allons quitter les salles de cours de notre université pour marcher pendant tout un semestre, afin d’approcher les œuvres d’art personnellement et de les étudier dans leur contexte naturel.

Parmi nos grands supporteurs il y a, en dehors de Hans Belting, gagnant du prix Balzan ; des autorités telles que Bissera Pentcheva de l’université de Stanford ; Herbert L. Kessler de l’université John Hopkins.

Nous sommes soutenus par l’université Masaryk de Brno, qui couvre ce projet et nous supporte en partie financièrement. De plus, l’université a approuvé d’un plan d’étude spécial pour les étudiants qui participeront à ce projet.

Mais il y a aussi nos autres supporteurs importants – les monastères, qui ont accepté de nous accueillir et de nous permettre d’étudier et de nous reposer dans leurs complexes.

À ce projet vont participer également des chercheurs tels que Michele Bacci de l’université de Fribourg ; Stefano D’Ovidio, Bibliotheca Hertziana, Max-Planck-Institut für Kunstgeschichte ; Daniela Mondini, Università della Svizzera italiana ; Éric Palazzo de l’université de Poitiers.

Ce projet est expérimental et exceptionnel par bien des aspects.

Suivant l’exemple des pèlerins médiévaux, nous allons voyager à pied. Après des semaines de marche, à dormir sans abri et sans l’aide des commodités modernes, nous seront fatigués et auront à surmonter les obstacles physiques et la douleur. En renonçant aux moyens de transport modernes, nous vivrons le ralentissement du temps.

 

Tout cela modifiera notre perception des œuvres d’art.

Bien sûr, nous sommes parfaitement conscients que nous ne pouvons pas revivre les expériences et sentiments d’une personne vivant au Moyen Âge. D’un autre côté, nous pensons qu’il est possible – à travers différents aspects – de se rapprocher de la réception pré-moderne des œuvres d’art. De nos jours, nous sommes habitués à voir les objets rapidement et d’une perspective rapprochée. Le pèlerinage au rythme naturel des pas offre un point de vue nouveau, comme nous l’avons déjà remarqué durant nos marches d’été que nous avons effectuées durant les cinq dernières années.

« Historiens de l’art migrateurs » représente une approche innovatrice des études. Après une préparation théorique, les étudiants vont étudier les objets personnellement in situ, à travers tous les aspects précédemment mentionnés. Leur tâche sera de présenter leurs résultats non seulement au sein du cadre universitaire habituel, mais également au grand public.

Bien qu’expérimental et innovant, le projet « Historiens de l’art migrateurs » est basé sur des expériences déjà acquises. Il est issu de nos observations recueillies sur les routes de pèlerinage françaises et italiennes durant les cinq dernières années. Ces cinq marches estivales ont complètement modifié notre point de vue sur les objets médiévaux. C’est pourquoi un groupe de douze historiens de l’art a décidé d’élargir l’expérience tout en la contextualisant au sein d’un cadre scientifique spécifique et, à l’aide de technologies modernes, de la transmettre au grand public.

 

C’est pour cela que nous avons besoin de vous !

Nous avons invité des spécialistes pour donner des cours et écrire des articles au sein de la monographie conclusive. Nous allons nous-mêmes écrire au sujet des œuvres d’art que nous allons rencontrer au long du chemin. Notre équipe est composée de graphistes habitués à produire des ouvrages, de même que de réalisateurs qui travaillent pour la plateforme e-learning de l’université Masaryk de Brno, habitués à préparer du matériel d’enseignement.

 

Nous avons besoin de supporteurs enthousiastes.

Nous voulons intégralement partager cette expérience avec vous. Afin d’ouvrir le champ apparemment fermé de l’histoire de l’art, nous voulons transmettre nos expériences au grand public.

C’est pour cette raison que nous avons besoin de financement.

 

 

Avec la somme de 6300€ que le département d’histoire de l’art de l’université de Brno offre au projet, nous pouvons partiellement couvrir les coûts de l’organisation des conférences dans les monastères. De la part de sponsors privés, nous avons obtenu 3000€ dans le même but.

Afin de pouvoir vous transmettre les résultats de notre voyage, nous avons besoin de votre aide pour couvrir les dépenses liées au tournage et à la post-production. La somme, en incluant les équipements techniques, est estimée à 15 965 €.  La production du second résultat, la monographie finale, est estimée à 6000€.

Malgré le fait nous allons vivre avec des frais limités, nous allons avoir besoin d’un petit soutien pour vivre durant la marche. L’estimation du coût de la vie minimal est de 7€/jour/personne, pour un total de 10 080€.

Certains de nos étudiants gagnent leur vie. Pour cette raison, nous avons besoin de couvrir leurs nécessités durant la marche puisqu’ils vont interrompre leur activité professionnelle entièrement pour se consacrer entièrement au projet.

Puisque nous avons déjà entrepris des marches cinq fois durant les dernières années, nous n’avons pas besoin d’acheter l’équipement de base. En revanche, cette fois nous allons commencer la marche à la fin de l’hiver, et pour cette raison nous aurons besoin de compléter notre équipement. Les coûts estimés par personne sont de 550€, une somme difficile à réunir pour certains étudiants.

 

Nous vous serions très reconnaissant si vous décidez de nous soutenir.

Si vous aimez le projet mais que vous ne pouvez pas nous soutenir financièrement, nous voudrions vous demander de faire passer le message à toute personne qui pourrait être intéressée.

 

L’itinéraire

 

De Lausanne au Mont-Saint-Michel, nous allons parcourir 1500 kilomètres à pied en quatre mois (du premier mars à la fin de juin), en suivant et en croisant trois des principales routes de pèlerinage médiévales (Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis).

Nous allons traverser les villes où se trouvent les monuments importants, sujets de notre étude, telles que Genève, Lyon, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours et Rennes. Nous allons marcher trois semaines, qui seront suivies de pauses de trois semaines au sein des monastères (Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire, Mont-Saint-Michel).

C’est à ces endroits que d’importants chercheurs de la discipline vont nous rejoindre. À travers une série de conférences et de discussions, ces chercheurs vont nous aider à avancer dans nos recherches, qui résulteront en des mémoires de master ainsi qu’en une monographie finale. C’est également à ces endroits que nous allons préparer les films pour vous, et d’où nous allons diffuser en live online les conférences grâce à la plateforme e-learning de l’université Masaryk.

 

Plus à notre sujet

La plupart des étudiants font partie du Center for Early Medieval Studies (Centre d’études sur le Haut Moyen Âge) de l’Université Masaryk de Brno (CZ), fondé en 2012 par Ivan Foletti. Le projet est l’une des nombreuses activités du centre.

Depuis sa fondation, le centre a organisé de nombreuses conférences internationales, invité les chercheurs les plus importants du domaine, fondé le prestigieux périodique international Convivium, et publié plusieurs ouvrages. À travers ses conférences régulières StredoveC JinaX, le centre cherche aussi le contact avec un public non-académique.

Ces activités ont attiré l’attention de l’un des plus importants historiens de l’art, Hans Belting, qui, avec Christa Belting-Ihm, ont offert en don leur collection de livres au sujet de l’art médiéval au centre. Grâce à la qualité de la collection acquise, le centre se hisse au niveau des meilleures institutions européennes.

D’autre membre du projet, responsables de la réalisation et du support technologique, sont membres du team e-learning de la Faculté des Lettres de l’université Masaryk de Brno.

Si vous voulez en savoir plus sur les participants, visitez notre site web.

 

***

 

Experimentální mezinárodní projekt “Migrating Art Historians”

 

 

Projekt Stěhovaví historici umění otevírá nový pohled na středověk. Budeme putovat 1500 km pěšky po poutnických cestách a sbírat materiál, o který bychom se s vámi chtěli podělit. Připravíme pro vás online přednášky, 12 krátkých filmů, kolektivní monografii, desítku kurzů, kvalitní fotografie a mnohem více.

Projektu se zúčastní studenti a profesoři z univerzit ve Francii, Itálii, Německu, Švýcarsku, USA a České republice. Naším cílem je otevřít širokému publiku téma umění a středověkého poutnictví. Chceme ale také přinést nový prvek do univerzitního vzdělávání – univerzita ne pouze jako místo přijímaní teoretických informací, ale jako přímo prožitá zkušenost. Jedná se o jedinečný experiment, který může změnit dějiny umění.

Abychom tento projekt mohli uskutečnit, potřebujeme Vaši pomoc.

Stěhovaví historici umění je jedinečný projekt, který se zaměřuje na studium uměleckých děl skrze fyzickou zkušenost vlastního těla. Opustíme univerzitní učebny a pěšky budeme putovat celý semestr, abychom se přiblížili k uměleckým dílům a studovali je v jejich přirozeném prostředí.

Mezi našimi skalními podporovateli jsou Hans Belting, držitel Balzan prize, Herbert L. Kessler z Johns Hopkins University v Baltimoru nebo Bissera Pentcheva z Univerzity ve Stanfordu. Projekt zaštiťuje Masarykova univerzita, která rovněž pokrývá část nákladů. Univerzita také schválila zvláštní studijní plán pro studenty, kteří se pochodu zúčastní. Přízeň nám vyjádřily i kláštery, které nám během našich zastavení poskytnou přístřeší, abychom mohli zpracovávat nasbíraný materiál a také si odpočinout.

Na projektu Stěhovavých historiků umění se budou podílet badatelé jako Michele Bacci z univerzity ve Friburgu, Daniela Mondini z univerzity ve švýcarském Luganu, Eric Palazzo z univerzity v Poitiers a další.

Projekt je experimentální a výjimečný v mnoha ohledech. Stejně jako středověcí poutníci budeme putovat pěšky. Po týdnech chůze, spaní bez střechy nad hlavou a bez pomoci většiny vymožeností civilizace, budeme unavení a budeme muset překonávat různorodé překážky i bolest. Tím, že se vzdáme moderních dopravních prostředků, zažijeme zpomalení času.

Toto všechno změní naše vnímání uměleckých děl. Jsme si samozřejmě vědomi toho, že není možné vrátit se do středověku a zažít pocity člověka jiné epochy. Předpokládáme však, že je možné se v mnoha ohledech přiblížit pre-modernímu vnímání uměleckých děl. V současné době jsme zvyklí dívat se na věci kolem nás rychle a zblízka. Jak jsme ale zjistili během našich pochodů v posledních pěti letech, pouť v rytmu lidské chůze nabízí nový, odlišný pohled na věci kolem nás.

Stěhovaví historici umění tedy chtějí přinést inovativní přístup ke vzdělávání. Po teoretické přípravě budou studenti zkoumat středověké objekty in situ se všemi výše zmíněnými aspekty. Jejich úkolem ale nebude představit výsledky jen v rámci univerzitního programu, chtějí je také předat široké veřejnosti.

I když je projekt Stěhovaví historici umění experimentální a novátorský, vychází ze zkušeností nasbíraných na francouzských a italských středověkých poutních cestách během posledních pěti let. Pět letních pochodů v letech 2011–2016 zcela změnilo náš pohled na středověké objekty. To je důvod, proč se skupina dvanácti historiků umění rozhodla své zkušenosti prohloubit, dát jim specifický vědecký rámec a s pomocí moderních technologií je zprostředkovat i vám.

Pozvali jsme odborníky, kteří povedou přednášky a přispějí svými články do výsledné monografie. Tu zpracují grafici našeho týmu. Filmy připraví skupina z e-learningové platformy Masarykovy univerzity. Potřebujeme však další přátele, příznivce a sponzory, kteří nám pomohou s finančním zajištěním celého projektu.

Seminář dějin umění Masarykovy univerzity v Brně, který náš projekt podporuje, částečně pokryje náklady spojené s organizací přednášek odborníků v klášterech částkou 170 000 Kč. Od soukromých sponzorů jsme na stejný účel doposud získali částku 80 000 Kč.

Abychom vám ale mohli zprostředkovat výsledky naší práce, potřebujeme finanční pomoc, která by pokryla náklady spojené s produkcí a postprodukcí filmů. Předpokládáme částku 430 000 Kč na technické vybavení. Náklady na realizaci našeho druhého výstupu, tedy monografie studovaných středověkých objektů, odhadujeme na částku 162 000 Kč.

I přesto, že během naší pouti budeme žít co nejskromněji, potřebujeme pomoci i s pokrytím nezbytných životních nákladů. Jejich výše je odhadovaná na 190 Kč/os/den, tzn. 272 000 Kč celkem. Vaši podporu k pokrytí těchto nezbytných nákladů potřebujeme i proto, že někteří studenti si na své živobytí vydělávají sami. Během pouti však musí své pracovní aktivity přerušit a zcela se věnovat projektu.

Jelikož jsme během posledních let již pětkrát absolvovali pouť, nepotřebujeme nakoupit základní vybavení. Nicméně tentokrát budeme vyrážet na konci zimy a z tohoto důvodu budeme muset naši výbavu doplnit. Předpokládané výlohy za osobu jsou 15 000 Kč (180 000 Kč celkem), což je částka, která je pro některé studenty jen těžko dostupná.

Budeme velmi vděční, rozhodnete-li se nás podpořit.

Pokud nám nemůžete pomoci finančně, prosíme vás, abyste povědomí o projektu šířili mezi všechny, které by mohl zaujmout.

 

Itinerář

 

1. března 2017 vyrazíme z Lausanne. Za čtyři měsíce ujdeme 1500 kilometrů po třech důležitých středověkých poutních cestách Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis. Budeme procházet městy se středověkými památkami, jako je Ženeva, Lyon, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours či Rennes. Budeme putovat ve třech etapách. Vždy po třech týdnech cesty se na další tři týdny zastavíme v klášterech v Conques, Saint Benoît sur Loire a Mont Saint Michel.

V klášterech se setkáme s významnými historiky umění, kteří budou přednášet a s nimiž budeme diskutovat. Výsledkem bude několik diplomových prací a finální kolektivní monografie. Kláštery budou také místem, odkud budeme vysílat online přednášky pomocí e-learningové platformy Masarykovy univerzity a kde pro vás budeme připravovat filmy.

 

Více o nás

Většina účastníků projektu patří k Centru raně středověkých studií při Masarykově univerzitě v Brně, které bylo založené v roce 2012 Ivanem Folettim. Náš projekt je však jednou z mnoha aktivit Centra.

Od svého založení Centrum zorganizovalo několik mezinárodních konferencí,  pozvalo mnoho důležitých specialistů oboru, založilo prestižní mezinárodní periodikum Convivium a publikovalo několik knih. Svými pravidelnými přednáškami v rámci cyklu StředověC JinaX oslovuje i neakademické publikum.

Tyto aktivity Centra přitáhly pozornost i jednoho z nejdůležitějších historiků umění Hanse Beltinga, který, společně s Christou Belting-Ihm, daroval Centru sbírku literatury o středověkém umění. Kvalitou sbírky tak Centrum získalo zázemí na úrovni nejlepších evropských institucí.

Další členové projektu, kteří budou zodpovědní za realizaci filmů a technickou podporu, pracují v rámci Kanceláře e-learningu na Filozofické fakultě Masarykovy univerzity.

Chcete-li se dozvědět více o všech účastnících pochodu, navštivte naše webové stránky.

 

***

 

Progetto internazionale sperimentale “Storici dell’arte migranti”

 

 

Il progetto “Storici dell’arte migranti” propone un nuovo approccio al medioevo. Cammineremo per 1500 km sulle rotte dei pellegrini medievali e raccoglieremo del materiale che condividremo con voi. Prepareremo corsi online per voi, 12 brevi filmati, monografie collettive e tante conferenze disponibili online, meravigliose fotografie e molto di più...

A questo progetto prendono parte studenti e docenti provenienti da università della Francia, Italia, Germania, Svizzera, Stati Uniti e Repubblica Ceca. Il nostro intento è quello di aprire il dibattito sulle arti e il pellegrinaggio medievale al più vasto pubblico. Vogliamo inoltre cambiare il modo di percepire l’università. Essa infatti non deve più essere solo un’istituzione che offre solo teoria. Deve invece diventare un’esperienza pratica. Il progetto vuole essere dunque un esperimento unico che potrebbe riuscire a cambiare la storia dell’arte.

Per realizzarlo abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto.

“Storici dell’arte migranti” è un progetto unico che coincide con la nostra ambizione di studiare le opera d’arte attraverso l’esperienza fisica del nostro corpo. Lasceremo le aule universitarie per camminare per un intero semestre in modo da approcciare l’opera d’arte di persona e da studiarla nel suo contesto naturale.


Tra i nostri maggiori sostenitori vantiamo, oltre a Hans Belting (premio Balzan), autorevoli figure quali Bissera Pentcheva della Stanford University, Herbert L. Kessler della Johns Hopkins University. Istituzionalmente, siamo sostenuti dalla Masaryk University, la quale copre il progetto e ci finanzia in parte. La Masaryk University ha inoltre approvato un piano di studi speciale per gli studenti che prenderanno parte al progetto. Abbiamo anche degli importanti supporter esterni: i monasteri, che hanno accettato di ospitarci e di permetterci di studiare presso di loro beneficiando delle risorse messe da loro a disposizione. Al nostro progetto parteciperanno prestigiosi studiosi quale Michele Bacci dell’Università di Friburgo; Stefano D'Ovidio, (Bibliotheca Hertziana, Max-Planck-Institut für Kunstgeschichte, Rom), Daniela Mondini (Università della della Svizzera italiana), Eric Palazzo dell’Università di Poitiers.

Il progetto è sperimentale ed eccezionale per molti aspetti. Seguendo l’esempio dei pellegrini medievali, cammineremo a piedi. Dopo settimane di cammino, domendo senza ripari e senza l’aiuto di molte delle comodità cui siamo abituati nella contemporaneità, saremo stanchi e dovremo superare ostacoli fisici e sofferenze. Rinunciando ai oderni mezzi di trasporto, sperimenteremo il rallentamento del tempo.

Tutto questo cambierà la nostra percezione dell’opera d’arte. Certo, siamo consapevoli che non ci è possibile riportare in vita le esperienze e i sentimenti degli uomini del medioevo. Nonostante ciò siamo convinti che sia possibile, per molti versi, avvicinarci di più alla concezione pre-moderna dell’opera d’arte. Nell’epoca attuale, ci siamo abitutai a guardare all’opera d’arte in maniera frettolosa e con una prospetiva limitata. Il pellegrinaggio al ritmo del respiro umano offre un nuovo modo di osservazione, lo stesso che abbiamo già sperimentato nelle nostre camminate estive degli ultimi cinque anni.

In questo modo, “Storici dell’arte migranti” presenta un innovativo approccio alla formazione. Dopo la preparazione teorica, gli studenti esamineranno le opere in situ con tutti i presupposti che abbiamo descritto. Il loro obiettivo sarà quello di presentare i propri elaborati non solo nel quadro dei programmi universitari ma anche di fare comunicazione in direzione del più vasto pubblico.

Sebbene sperimentale e innovativo, il progetto “Storici dell’arte migranti” è basato su esperienze giò acquisite. Ha avuto origine dalle nostre osservazioni condotte sulle rotte del pellegrinaggio medievale in Italia e in Francia negli ultimi cinque anni. È per questo che un gruppo di dodici storici dell’arte hanno deciso di ampliare le proprie esperienze, di porle entro uno specifico contesto scientifico e di trasmetterle – con l’aiuto delle moderne tecnologie – ad un più vasto pubblico.

È per questo che abbiamo bisogno di te!

Abbiamo invitato specialisti a tenere corsi e a scrivere articoli per la monografia conclusiva. Noi stessi scriveremo delle opere d’arte che ci troveremo di fronte. Il nostro team comprende grafici esperti di editing e registi che lavoreranno alla piattaforma di e-learning della Masaryk University, forti della loro esperienza nella preparazione dei materiali di studio.

Abbiamo bisogno di sostenitori entusiasti.

Vogliamo condividere l’intera esperienza con te. Per “aprire” settori della storia dell’arte che sono solo apparentemente “chiusi”, desideriamo trasmettere al nostra esperienza al pubblico.

È questa la ragione per cui abbiamo bisogno di fondi.

 

 

Con l’importo di 6300 Euro il Dipartimento di Storia dell’Arte della Masaryk University, che supporta il progetto, coprirà in parte i costi connessi con l’organizzazione dei delle conferenze nei diversi monasteri. Inoltre, abbiamo già raccolto 3000 Euro da sponsor privati.  

Per poter trasmettere a voi i risultati del nostro viaggio abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per coprire le spese legate alle riprese filmate e alla postproduzione. L’importo totale, comprensivo dell’equipaggiamento tecnologico, è stimato in 15965 Euro. La produzione del nostro secondo elaborato – una monografia dedicata alle opere da noi studiate, avrà il costo di 6000 Euro.

Anche se la nostra vita in cammino sarà “low-cost”, è necessario un determinato sostegno per i costi cui dovremo far fronte nel viaggio. La stima di tali spese vive è stata tenuta il più possibile al ribasso, stabilendo un esborso pro capite di 7 Euro al giorno. Il che equivale a dire un totale di circa 10.080 Euro.

Alcuni dei nostri studenti si guadagnano la vita da soli. Per questa ragione abbiamo bisogno di sostenere le loro necessità di base durante il cammino, dal momento che hanno dovuto interrompere la propria attività lavorativa per consacrarsi interamente al progetto.

Abbiamo già intrapreso il pellegrinaggio a piedi cinque volte negli anni passati. Quindi non abbiamo bisogno di acquistare l’equipaggiamento di base. Questa volta però partiremo in inverno e, per questa ragione, dobbiamo integrare la nostra dotazione. La spesa prevista, a persona, è di 550 Euro, una somma che per alcuni studenti sarebbe difficile da mettere insieme.

Ti saremmo molto grati se decidessi di sostenerci.

Se il nostro progetto ti piace ma non puoi aiutarci finanziariamente, ti chiederemmo di inviare questo messaggio a tutte le persone cui pensi possa interessare.

 

L'itinerario

 

Da Losanna a Mont-Saint-Michel, 1500 chilometri che noi percorreremo a piedi in quattro mesi (dal 1 marzo alla fine di giugno), seguendo o intercettando tre grandi vie medievali di pellegrinaggio (Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis)

Attraverseremo le città dove si trovano i più importanti monumenti oggetto delle nostre ricerche: Ginevra, Lione, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours e Rennes. Cammineremo per tre settimane, seguite da una pausa di tre settimane da trascorrere nei monasteri di Conques, Saint Benoît sur Loire, Mont-Saint-Michel.

Questi sono i luoghi dove i più prestigiosi studiosi del nostro campo ci incontreranno. Con una serie di conferenze e discussioni ci aiuteranno a portare avanti il nostro lavoro di ricerca, che confluirà nelle nostre tesi di Master e nella monografia finale.

Questi sono i luoghi dove prepareremo film per te e dove manderemo in streaming online le conferenze destinate alla piattaforma e-learning della Masaryk University.

 

Chi siamo

Gran parte dei partecipanti al progetto appartiene al Center for Early Medieval Studies della Masaryk University di Brno (Repubblica Ceca), fondato nel 2012 da Ivan Foletti. Il progetto è una delle molte attività del Centro. Fin dal momento della sua fondazione il Centro ha organizzato numerose conferenze internazionali ed ha invitato i più importanti studiosi del settore. Ha inoltre dato vita alla prestigiosa rivista internazionale Convivium e pubblica numerosi libri. Con il suo ciclo regolare di conferenze dal titolo StredoveC JinaX il Centro cerca il contatto anche con un pubblico non accademico.

Le attività del Centro hanno attirato l’attenzione di uno fra i più importanti storici dell’arte, Hans Belting, che, insieme a Christa Belting-Ihm, ha donato al centro la propria collezione di volumi sull’arte medievale. Grazie alla qualità di tale acquisizione, il Centro è pervenuto al livello delle maggiori istituzioni europee.

Gli altri membri del progetto, responsabili per le riprese filmate e per il supporto tecnologico, sono membri del team e-learning della Facoltà di Lettere della Masaryk university.

Se vuoi saperne di più sui partecipanti guarda il nostro sito web.
