↓ ENGLISH   FRANÇAIS   ČESKY   ITALIANO  ↓
  Experimental International Project “Migrating Art Historians”  The project Migrating Art Historians proposes a new look on the Middle Ages. We will walk 1,500 km on medieval pilgrimage routes and collect material which we will then share with you. We will prepare online courses, 12 short films, a collective monograph, dozens of lectures accessible online, wonderful photographs and more.This project joins in students and professors from universities in France, Italy, Germany, Switzerland, the USA and the Czech Republic. They want to open the question of arts and pilgrimage in the Middle Ages to the general public. Our aim is also to change the way the university is perceived. It should no longer be an exclusively theoretical institution, but should become an actual experience. The project is a unique experiment that could change the history of art.To achieve it, we need your support.Migrating Art Historians is a unique project based on our aim to study artworks through the physical experience of a body.We will leave the classrooms of the university to walk for the entire semester, in order to approach artworks personally and study them in their natural environment.Among our biggest supporters are, in addition to Hans Belting, Balzan prize winner, such authorities as Bissera Pentcheva from Stanford University and Herbert L. Kessler from Johns Hopkins University.Institutionally, we are supported by Masaryk University, which covers this project and partially supports us financially. Moreover, the University has also approved a special study plan for the students taking part in the project. Yet, there are still other important supporters - the cloisters, which have agreed to host us and allow us to study and rest within their facilities.This project will also include the participation of scholars such as Michele Bacci from the University of Fribourg; Stefano D'Ovidio, Bibliotheca Hertziana, Max-Planck-Institut für Kunstgeschichte; Daniela Mondini, Università della Svizzera italiana; Éric Palazzo from the University of Poitiers.This project is experimental and exceptional in many aspects. Following the example of medieval pilgrims, we will travel on foot. After weeks of walking, sleeping without shelter and without the help of most modern conveniences, we will be tired and will have to overcome physical obstacles and pain. By renouncing modern means of transport, we will experience a slowing of time.All of this will change our perception of the artworks.That said, we are absolutely aware that we cannot re-live the medieval person’s experience and feelings. On the other hand, we do believe it is possible, in many aspects, to get closer to the pre-modern reception of the art works. In modern times, we are used to looking at the objects quickly and from a close perspective. The pilgrimage, following the rhythm of human pace, offers a new point of view, as we already experienced during our summer walks in the last five years.Thus Migrating Art Historians presents an innovative approach to education. After theoretical preparation, students will study the objects personally in situ with all the above-mentioned aspects. Their task will be to present their results not only within the frame of the university program but also to communicate them to the general public. Although experimental and innovative, the project Migrating Art Historians is grounded on already acquired experiences. It has risen from observations collected on French and Italian medieval pilgrimage routes during the past five years. These five summer walks have completely changed our point of view on medieval objects. That is why a group of twelve art historians decided to broaden their experience as well as to put it into a specific scientific framework and – with the help of modern technology – to transmit it to a wider audience. That is why we need you!We have invited specialists to give courses and write contributions to the final monograph. We will ourselves write about the artworks we encounter. Our team includes graphic designers experienced in producing books as well as filmmakers, well-trained in the preparation of study materials, working for the e-learning platform of Masaryk University. We need enthusiastic supporters.We want to share this whole experience with you. To open the seemingly closed field of art history. We want to transmit our experience to the general public.For this reason, we need funding.  With the amount of €6.300 that the Department of Art History of Masaryk University in Brno has given to the project, the costs involved for the organization of the lectures in the cloisters are partially covered. From private sponsors, we have already collected €3.000 for the same purpose.  To to be able to transmit the results of our journey to you, we need your help to cover the expenses connected to filming and postproduction. That amount, including technical equipment, is estimated at 15 965. The production of our second output – final monograph gathering information on the artworks studied – is estimated at 6000Despite the fact that we will live in a low-cost way, some support to pay living costs during the walk will be necessary. The estimation of living costs has been pushed to its lowest level possible, being €7/day/person, for a total of €10.080.Some of our students are already earning a living. For this reason, we need to support their basic necessities during the walk since they are interrupting their employment activity to dedicate themselves entirely to the project.Since we have already undertaken five walking pilgrimages during the past years, we do not need to buy the basic equipment. However, this time we will start at the end of winter, and for this reason we will need to complete our gear. The estimated expenses per person are €550 – an amount that is difficult to raise for some students.   We would be very grateful if you decide to support us.If you like our project but can not support us financially, please pass this message along to any person who might be interested. The Itinerary From Lausanne to Mont-Saint-Michel, we will travel 1,500 kilometers on foot in 4 months (from 1st March to the end of June), following and crossing three main medieval pilgrimage roads (Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis).We will go through the cities where important monuments, subjects of our research are located, such as Geneva, Lyon, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours and Rennes. We will walk three weeks, which will be followed by three-week breaks spent within the monasteries (Conques, Saint Benoît sur Loire, Mont Saint Michel).These are the places, where significant scholars in our field will meet us. Through a series of lectures and discussions, these scholars will help us to move forward in our research resulting in our master theses as well as in the final monograph. These are also places from where we will prepare movies for you, and from where we will stream the lectures online, on the Masaryk University e-learning platform. More About UsMost of the participants of the project belong to the Center for Early Medieval Studies at Masaryk University in Brno (CZ), founded in 2012 by Ivan Foletti. The project is one of the Center's many activities.Since its foundation, the Center has organized many international conferences, invited the most significant scholars of the field, founded the prestigious international journal Convivium and published several books. With its regular lectures entitled StredoveC JinaX, the Center also seeks contact with a non-academic audience.These activities of the Center have attracted attention of one of the most important living art historians, Hans Belting, who, together with Christa Belting-Ihm, donated their collection of literature on medieval art to the Center. With the quality of the collection acquired, the Center has risen to the level of the best European institutions.Other members of the project responsible for filmmaking and technical support are based at the E-learning Office, Faculty of Arts, Masaryk University.If you want to learn more about the participants see our web site. *** Projet international et expérimental « Historiens de l'art migrateurs » 

 
Le projet « Historiens de l’art migrateur » propose un regard nouveau sur le Moyen Âge. Nous allons marcher 1500 km le long des routes de pèlerinage médiévales et recueillir des expériences que nous allons partager avec vous. Nous allons préparer des cours online pour vous, 12 court-métrages, une monographie collective, des dizaines de conférences accessibles online, des photos merveilleuses et bien plus encore.Au sein du projet des étudiants avec des professeurs d’universités de France, d’Italie, d’Allemagne, de Suisse, des Etats-Unis et de la République tchèque vont participer. Ils souhaitent ouvrir la question des arts et du pèlerinage au Moyen Âge au grand public.Notre but est de changer la manière dont l’université est perçue. Elle ne doit plus être simplement une institution théorique, mais devenir une véritable expérimentation. Le projet est une expérience unique qui pourrait changer l’histoire de l’art.Pour le réaliser nous avons besoin de votre aide.« Historiens de l’art migrateurs » est un projet unique, basé sur notre but d’étudier les œuvres d’art à travers l’expérience physique de notre corps.Nous allons quitter les salles de cours de notre université pour marcher pendant tout un semestre, afin d’approcher les œuvres d’art personnellement et de les étudier dans leur contexte naturel.Parmi nos grands supporteurs il y a, en dehors de Hans Belting, gagnant du prix Balzan ; des autorités telles que Bissera Pentcheva de l’université de Stanford ; Herbert L. Kessler de l’université John Hopkins.Nous sommes soutenus par l’université Masaryk de Brno, qui couvre ce projet et nous supporte en partie financièrement. De plus, l’université a approuvé d’un plan d’étude spécial pour les étudiants qui participeront à ce projet.Mais il y a aussi nos autres supporteurs importants – les monastères, qui ont accepté de nous accueillir et de nous permettre d’étudier et de nous reposer dans leurs complexes.À ce projet vont participer également des chercheurs tels que Michele Bacci de l’université de Fribourg ; Stefano D’Ovidio, Bibliotheca Hertziana, Max-Planck-Institut für Kunstgeschichte ; Daniela Mondini, Università della Svizzera italiana ; Éric Palazzo de l’université de Poitiers.Ce projet est expérimental et exceptionnel par bien des aspects.Suivant l’exemple des pèlerins médiévaux, nous allons voyager à pied. Après des semaines de marche, à dormir sans abri et sans l’aide des commodités modernes, nous seront fatigués et auront à surmonter les obstacles physiques et la douleur. En renonçant aux moyens de transport modernes, nous vivrons le ralentissement du temps. Tout cela modifiera notre perception des œuvres d’art.Bien sûr, nous sommes parfaitement conscients que nous ne pouvons pas revivre les expériences et sentiments d’une personne vivant au Moyen Âge. D’un autre côté, nous pensons qu’il est possible – à travers différents aspects – de se rapprocher de la réception pré-moderne des œuvres d’art. De nos jours, nous sommes habitués à voir les objets rapidement et d’une perspective rapprochée. Le pèlerinage au rythme naturel des pas offre un point de vue nouveau, comme nous l’avons déjà remarqué durant nos marches d’été que nous avons effectuées durant les cinq dernières années.« Historiens de l’art migrateurs » représente une approche innovatrice des études. Après une préparation théorique, les étudiants vont étudier les objets personnellement in situ, à travers tous les aspects précédemment mentionnés. Leur tâche sera de présenter leurs résultats non seulement au sein du cadre universitaire habituel, mais également au grand public.Bien qu’expérimental et innovant, le projet « Historiens de l’art migrateurs » est basé sur des expériences déjà acquises. Il est issu de nos observations recueillies sur les routes de pèlerinage françaises et italiennes durant les cinq dernières années. Ces cinq marches estivales ont complètement modifié notre point de vue sur les objets médiévaux. C’est pourquoi un groupe de douze historiens de l’art a décidé d’élargir l’expérience tout en la contextualisant au sein d’un cadre scientifique spécifique et, à l’aide de technologies modernes, de la transmettre au grand public. C’est pour cela que nous avons besoin de vous !Nous avons invité des spécialistes pour donner des cours et écrire des articles au sein de la monographie conclusive. Nous allons nous-mêmes écrire au sujet des œuvres d’art que nous allons rencontrer au long du chemin. Notre équipe est composée de graphistes habitués à produire des ouvrages, de même que de réalisateurs qui travaillent pour la plateforme e-learning de l’université Masaryk de Brno, habitués à préparer du matériel d’enseignement. Nous avons besoin de supporteurs enthousiastes.Nous voulons intégralement partager cette expérience avec vous. Afin d’ouvrir le champ apparemment fermé de l’histoire de l’art, nous voulons transmettre nos expériences au grand public.C’est pour cette raison que nous avons besoin de financement.  Avec la somme de 6300€ que le département d’histoire de l’art de l’université de Brno offre au projet, nous pouvons partiellement couvrir les coûts de l’organisation des conférences dans les monastères. De la part de sponsors privés, nous avons obtenu 3000€ dans le même but.Afin de pouvoir vous transmettre les résultats de notre voyage, nous avons besoin de votre aide pour couvrir les dépenses liées au tournage et à la post-production. La somme, en incluant les équipements techniques, est estimée à 15 965 €.  La production du second résultat, la monographie finale, est estimée à 6000€.Malgré le fait nous allons vivre avec des frais limités, nous allons avoir besoin d’un petit soutien pour vivre durant la marche. L’estimation du coût de la vie minimal est de 7€/jour/personne, pour un total de 10 080€.Certains de nos étudiants gagnent leur vie. Pour cette raison, nous avons besoin de couvrir leurs nécessités durant la marche puisqu’ils vont interrompre leur activité professionnelle entièrement pour se consacrer entièrement au projet.Puisque nous avons déjà entrepris des marches cinq fois durant les dernières années, nous n’avons pas besoin d’acheter l’équipement de base. En revanche, cette fois nous allons commencer la marche à la fin de l’hiver, et pour cette raison nous aurons besoin de compléter notre équipement. Les coûts estimés par personne sont de 550€, une somme difficile à réunir pour certains étudiants. Nous vous serions très reconnaissant si vous décidez de nous soutenir. Si vous aimez le projet mais que vous ne pouvez pas nous soutenir financièrement, nous voudrions vous demander de faire passer le message à toute personne qui pourrait être intéressée. L’itinéraire De Lausanne au Mont-Saint-Michel, nous allons parcourir 1500 kilomètres à pied en quatre mois (du premier mars à la fin de juin), en suivant et en croisant trois des principales routes de pèlerinage médiévales (Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis).Nous allons traverser les villes où se trouvent les monuments importants, sujets de notre étude, telles que Genève, Lyon, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours et Rennes. Nous allons marcher trois semaines, qui seront suivies de pauses de trois semaines au sein des monastères (Conques, Saint-Benoît-sur-Loire, Mont-Saint-Michel).C’est à ces endroits que d’importants chercheurs de la discipline vont nous rejoindre. À travers une série de conférences et de discussions, ces chercheurs vont nous aider à avancer dans nos recherches, qui résulteront en des mémoires de master ainsi qu’en une monographie finale. C’est également à ces endroits que nous allons préparer les films pour vous, et d’où nous allons diffuser en live online les conférences grâce à la plateforme e-learning de l’université Masaryk. Plus à notre sujetLa plupart des étudiants font partie du Center for Early Medieval Studies (Centre d’études sur le Haut Moyen Âge) de l’Université Masaryk de Brno (CZ), fondé en 2012 par Ivan Foletti. Le projet est l’une des nombreuses activités du centre.Depuis sa fondation, le centre a organisé de nombreuses conférences internationales, invité les chercheurs les plus importants du domaine, fondé le prestigieux périodique international Convivium, et publié plusieurs ouvrages. À travers ses conférences régulières StredoveC JinaX, le centre cherche aussi le contact avec un public non-académique.Ces activités ont attiré l’attention de l’un des plus importants historiens de l’art, Hans Belting, qui, avec Christa Belting-Ihm, ont offert en don leur collection de livres au sujet de l’art médiéval au centre. Grâce à la qualité de la collection acquise, le centre se hisse au niveau des meilleures institutions européennes.D’autre membre du projet, responsables de la réalisation et du support technologique, sont membres du team e-learning de la Faculté des Lettres de l’université Masaryk de Brno.Si vous voulez en savoir plus sur les participants, visitez notre site web. *** Experimentální mezinárodní projekt “Migrating Art Historians” 

 
Projekt Stěhovaví historici umění otevírá nový pohled na středověk. Budeme putovat 1500 km pěšky po poutnických cestách a sbírat materiál, o který bychom se s vámi chtěli podělit. Připravíme pro vás online přednášky, 12 krátkých filmů, kolektivní monografii, desítku kurzů, kvalitní fotografie a mnohem více.Projektu se zúčastní studenti a profesoři z univerzit ve Francii, Itálii, Německu, Švýcarsku, USA a České republice. Naším cílem je otevřít širokému publiku téma umění a středověkého poutnictví. Chceme ale také přinést nový prvek do univerzitního vzdělávání – univerzita ne pouze jako místo přijímaní teoretických informací, ale jako přímo prožitá zkušenost. Jedná se o jedinečný experiment, který může změnit dějiny umění.Abychom tento projekt mohli uskutečnit, potřebujeme Vaši pomoc.Stěhovaví historici umění je jedinečný projekt, který se zaměřuje na studium uměleckých děl skrze fyzickou zkušenost vlastního těla. Opustíme univerzitní učebny a pěšky budeme putovat celý semestr, abychom se přiblížili k uměleckým dílům a studovali je v jejich přirozeném prostředí.Mezi našimi skalními podporovateli jsou Hans Belting, držitel Balzan prize, Herbert L. Kessler z Johns Hopkins University v Baltimoru nebo Bissera Pentcheva z Univerzity ve Stanfordu. Projekt zaštiťuje Masarykova univerzita, která rovněž pokrývá část nákladů. Univerzita také schválila zvláštní studijní plán pro studenty, kteří se pochodu zúčastní. Přízeň nám vyjádřily i kláštery, které nám během našich zastavení poskytnou přístřeší, abychom mohli zpracovávat nasbíraný materiál a také si odpočinout.Na projektu Stěhovavých historiků umění se budou podílet badatelé jako Michele Bacci z univerzity ve Friburgu, Daniela Mondini z univerzity ve švýcarském Luganu, Eric Palazzo z univerzity v Poitiers a další.Projekt je experimentální a výjimečný v mnoha ohledech. Stejně jako středověcí poutníci budeme putovat pěšky. Po týdnech chůze, spaní bez střechy nad hlavou a bez pomoci většiny vymožeností civilizace, budeme unavení a budeme muset překonávat různorodé překážky i bolest. Tím, že se vzdáme moderních dopravních prostředků, zažijeme zpomalení času.Toto všechno změní naše vnímání uměleckých děl. Jsme si samozřejmě vědomi toho, že není možné vrátit se do středověku a zažít pocity člověka jiné epochy. Předpokládáme však, že je možné se v mnoha ohledech přiblížit pre-modernímu vnímání uměleckých děl. V současné době jsme zvyklí dívat se na věci kolem nás rychle a zblízka. Jak jsme ale zjistili během našich pochodů v posledních pěti letech, pouť v rytmu lidské chůze nabízí nový, odlišný pohled na věci kolem nás.Stěhovaví historici umění tedy chtějí přinést inovativní přístup ke vzdělávání. Po teoretické přípravě budou studenti zkoumat středověké objekty in situ se všemi výše zmíněnými aspekty. Jejich úkolem ale nebude představit výsledky jen v rámci univerzitního programu, chtějí je také předat široké veřejnosti.I když je projekt Stěhovaví historici umění experimentální a novátorský, vychází ze zkušeností nasbíraných na francouzských a italských středověkých poutních cestách během posledních pěti let. Pět letních pochodů v letech 2011–2016 zcela změnilo náš pohled na středověké objekty. To je důvod, proč se skupina dvanácti historiků umění rozhodla své zkušenosti prohloubit, dát jim specifický vědecký rámec a s pomocí moderních technologií je zprostředkovat i vám.Pozvali jsme odborníky, kteří povedou přednášky a přispějí svými články do výsledné monografie. Tu zpracují grafici našeho týmu. Filmy připraví skupina z e-learningové platformy Masarykovy univerzity. Potřebujeme však další přátele, příznivce a sponzory, kteří nám pomohou s finančním zajištěním celého projektu.Seminář dějin umění Masarykovy univerzity v Brně, který náš projekt podporuje, částečně pokryje náklady spojené s organizací přednášek odborníků v klášterech částkou 170 000 Kč. Od soukromých sponzorů jsme na stejný účel doposud získali částku 80 000 Kč.Abychom vám ale mohli zprostředkovat výsledky naší práce, potřebujeme finanční pomoc, která by pokryla náklady spojené s produkcí a postprodukcí filmů. Předpokládáme částku 430 000 Kč na technické vybavení. Náklady na realizaci našeho druhého výstupu, tedy monografie studovaných středověkých objektů, odhadujeme na částku 162 000 Kč.I přesto, že během naší pouti budeme žít co nejskromněji, potřebujeme pomoci i s pokrytím nezbytných životních nákladů. Jejich výše je odhadovaná na 190 Kč/os/den, tzn. 272 000 Kč celkem. Vaši podporu k pokrytí těchto nezbytných nákladů potřebujeme i proto, že někteří studenti si na své živobytí vydělávají sami. Během pouti však musí své pracovní aktivity přerušit a zcela se věnovat projektu.Jelikož jsme během posledních let již pětkrát absolvovali pouť, nepotřebujeme nakoupit základní vybavení. Nicméně tentokrát budeme vyrážet na konci zimy a z tohoto důvodu budeme muset naši výbavu doplnit. Předpokládané výlohy za osobu jsou 15 000 Kč (180 000 Kč celkem), což je částka, která je pro některé studenty jen těžko dostupná.Budeme velmi vděční, rozhodnete-li se nás podpořit. Pokud nám nemůžete pomoci finančně, prosíme vás, abyste povědomí o projektu šířili mezi všechny, které by mohl zaujmout. Itinerář 1. března 2017 vyrazíme z Lausanne. Za čtyři měsíce ujdeme 1500 kilometrů po třech důležitých středověkých poutních cestách Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis. Budeme procházet městy se středověkými památkami, jako je Ženeva, Lyon, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours či Rennes. Budeme putovat ve třech etapách. Vždy po třech týdnech cesty se na další tři týdny zastavíme v klášterech v Conques, Saint Benoît sur Loire a Mont Saint Michel.V klášterech se setkáme s významnými historiky umění, kteří budou přednášet a s nimiž budeme diskutovat. Výsledkem bude několik diplomových prací a finální kolektivní monografie. Kláštery budou také místem, odkud budeme vysílat online přednášky pomocí e-learningové platformy Masarykovy univerzity a kde pro vás budeme připravovat filmy. Více o násVětšina účastníků projektu patří k Centru raně středověkých studií při Masarykově univerzitě v Brně, které bylo založené v roce 2012 Ivanem Folettim. Náš projekt je však jednou z mnoha aktivit Centra.Od svého založení Centrum zorganizovalo několik mezinárodních konferencí,  pozvalo mnoho důležitých specialistů oboru, založilo prestižní mezinárodní periodikum Convivium a publikovalo několik knih. Svými pravidelnými přednáškami v rámci cyklu StředověC JinaX oslovuje i neakademické publikum.Tyto aktivity Centra přitáhly pozornost i jednoho z nejdůležitějších historiků umění Hanse Beltinga, který, společně s Christou Belting-Ihm, daroval Centru sbírku literatury o středověkém umění. Kvalitou sbírky tak Centrum získalo zázemí na úrovni nejlepších evropských institucí.Další členové projektu, kteří budou zodpovědní za realizaci filmů a technickou podporu, pracují v rámci Kanceláře e-learningu na Filozofické fakultě Masarykovy univerzity.Chcete-li se dozvědět více o všech účastnících pochodu, navštivte naše webové stránky. *** Progetto internazionale sperimentale “Storici dell’arte migranti”  Il progetto “Storici dell’arte migranti” propone un nuovo approccio al medioevo. Cammineremo per 1500 km sulle rotte dei pellegrini medievali e raccoglieremo del materiale che condividremo con voi. Prepareremo corsi online per voi, 12 brevi filmati, monografie collettive e tante conferenze disponibili online, meravigliose fotografie e molto di più...A questo progetto prendono parte studenti e docenti provenienti da università della Francia, Italia, Germania, Svizzera, Stati Uniti e Repubblica Ceca. Il nostro intento è quello di aprire il dibattito sulle arti e il pellegrinaggio medievale al più vasto pubblico. Vogliamo inoltre cambiare il modo di percepire l’università. Essa infatti non deve più essere solo un’istituzione che offre solo teoria. Deve invece diventare un’esperienza pratica. Il progetto vuole essere dunque un esperimento unico che potrebbe riuscire a cambiare la storia dell’arte.Per realizzarlo abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto.“Storici dell’arte migranti” è un progetto unico che coincide con la nostra ambizione di studiare le opera d’arte attraverso l’esperienza fisica del nostro corpo. Lasceremo le aule universitarie per camminare per un intero semestre in modo da approcciare l’opera d’arte di persona e da studiarla nel suo contesto naturale.Tra i nostri maggiori sostenitori vantiamo, oltre a Hans Belting (premio Balzan), autorevoli figure quali Bissera Pentcheva della Stanford University, Herbert L. Kessler della Johns Hopkins University. Istituzionalmente, siamo sostenuti dalla Masaryk University, la quale copre il progetto e ci finanzia in parte. La Masaryk University ha inoltre approvato un piano di studi speciale per gli studenti che prenderanno parte al progetto. Abbiamo anche degli importanti supporter esterni: i monasteri, che hanno accettato di ospitarci e di permetterci di studiare presso di loro beneficiando delle risorse messe da loro a disposizione. Al nostro progetto parteciperanno prestigiosi studiosi quale Michele Bacci dell’Università di Friburgo; Stefano D'Ovidio, (Bibliotheca Hertziana, Max-Planck-Institut für Kunstgeschichte, Rom), Daniela Mondini (Università della della Svizzera italiana), Eric Palazzo dell’Università di Poitiers.Il progetto è sperimentale ed eccezionale per molti aspetti. Seguendo l’esempio dei pellegrini medievali, cammineremo a piedi. Dopo settimane di cammino, domendo senza ripari e senza l’aiuto di molte delle comodità cui siamo abituati nella contemporaneità, saremo stanchi e dovremo superare ostacoli fisici e sofferenze. Rinunciando ai oderni mezzi di trasporto, sperimenteremo il rallentamento del tempo.Tutto questo cambierà la nostra percezione dell’opera d’arte. Certo, siamo consapevoli che non ci è possibile riportare in vita le esperienze e i sentimenti degli uomini del medioevo. Nonostante ciò siamo convinti che sia possibile, per molti versi, avvicinarci di più alla concezione pre-moderna dell’opera d’arte. Nell’epoca attuale, ci siamo abitutai a guardare all’opera d’arte in maniera frettolosa e con una prospetiva limitata. Il pellegrinaggio al ritmo del respiro umano offre un nuovo modo di osservazione, lo stesso che abbiamo già sperimentato nelle nostre camminate estive degli ultimi cinque anni.In questo modo, “Storici dell’arte migranti” presenta un innovativo approccio alla formazione. Dopo la preparazione teorica, gli studenti esamineranno le opere in situ con tutti i presupposti che abbiamo descritto. Il loro obiettivo sarà quello di presentare i propri elaborati non solo nel quadro dei programmi universitari ma anche di fare comunicazione in direzione del più vasto pubblico.Sebbene sperimentale e innovativo, il progetto “Storici dell’arte migranti” è basato su esperienze giò acquisite. Ha avuto origine dalle nostre osservazioni condotte sulle rotte del pellegrinaggio medievale in Italia e in Francia negli ultimi cinque anni. È per questo che un gruppo di dodici storici dell’arte hanno deciso di ampliare le proprie esperienze, di porle entro uno specifico contesto scientifico e di trasmetterle – con l’aiuto delle moderne tecnologie – ad un più vasto pubblico.È per questo che abbiamo bisogno di te!Abbiamo invitato specialisti a tenere corsi e a scrivere articoli per la monografia conclusiva. Noi stessi scriveremo delle opere d’arte che ci troveremo di fronte. Il nostro team comprende grafici esperti di editing e registi che lavoreranno alla piattaforma di e-learning della Masaryk University, forti della loro esperienza nella preparazione dei materiali di studio.Abbiamo bisogno di sostenitori entusiasti.Vogliamo condividere l’intera esperienza con te. Per “aprire” settori della storia dell’arte che sono solo apparentemente “chiusi”, desideriamo trasmettere al nostra esperienza al pubblico.È questa la ragione per cui abbiamo bisogno di fondi.  Con l’importo di 6300 Euro il Dipartimento di Storia dell’Arte della Masaryk University, che supporta il progetto, coprirà in parte i costi connessi con l’organizzazione dei delle conferenze nei diversi monasteri. Inoltre, abbiamo già raccolto 3000 Euro da sponsor privati.  Per poter trasmettere a voi i risultati del nostro viaggio abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per coprire le spese legate alle riprese filmate e alla postproduzione. L’importo totale, comprensivo dell’equipaggiamento tecnologico, è stimato in 15965 Euro. La produzione del nostro secondo elaborato – una monografia dedicata alle opere da noi studiate, avrà il costo di 6000 Euro.Anche se la nostra vita in cammino sarà “low-cost”, è necessario un determinato sostegno per i costi cui dovremo far fronte nel viaggio. La stima di tali spese vive è stata tenuta il più possibile al ribasso, stabilendo un esborso pro capite di 7 Euro al giorno. Il che equivale a dire un totale di circa 10.080 Euro.Alcuni dei nostri studenti si guadagnano la vita da soli. Per questa ragione abbiamo bisogno di sostenere le loro necessità di base durante il cammino, dal momento che hanno dovuto interrompere la propria attività lavorativa per consacrarsi interamente al progetto.Abbiamo già intrapreso il pellegrinaggio a piedi cinque volte negli anni passati. Quindi non abbiamo bisogno di acquistare l’equipaggiamento di base. Questa volta però partiremo in inverno e, per questa ragione, dobbiamo integrare la nostra dotazione. La spesa prevista, a persona, è di 550 Euro, una somma che per alcuni studenti sarebbe difficile da mettere insieme.Ti saremmo molto grati se decidessi di sostenerci.Se il nostro progetto ti piace ma non puoi aiutarci finanziariamente, ti chiederemmo di inviare questo messaggio a tutte le persone cui pensi possa interessare. L'itinerario Da Losanna a Mont-Saint-Michel, 1500 chilometri che noi percorreremo a piedi in quattro mesi (dal 1 marzo alla fine di giugno), seguendo o intercettando tre grandi vie medievali di pellegrinaggio (Via Turonensis, Via Lemovicensis, Via Podiensis)Attraverseremo le città dove si trovano i più importanti monumenti oggetto delle nostre ricerche: Ginevra, Lione, Conques, Nevers, Fleury, Tours e Rennes. Cammineremo per tre settimane, seguite da una pausa di tre settimane da trascorrere nei monasteri di Conques, Saint Benoît sur Loire, Mont-Saint-Michel.Questi sono i luoghi dove i più prestigiosi studiosi del nostro campo ci incontreranno. Con una serie di conferenze e discussioni ci aiuteranno a portare avanti il nostro lavoro di ricerca, che confluirà nelle nostre tesi di Master e nella monografia finale.Questi sono i luoghi dove prepareremo film per te e dove manderemo in streaming online le conferenze destinate alla piattaforma e-learning della Masaryk University. Chi siamoGran parte dei partecipanti al progetto appartiene al Center for Early Medieval Studies della Masaryk University di Brno (Repubblica Ceca), fondato nel 2012 da Ivan Foletti. Il progetto è una delle molte attività del Centro. Fin dal momento della sua fondazione il Centro ha organizzato numerose conferenze internazionali ed ha invitato i più importanti studiosi del settore. Ha inoltre dato vita alla prestigiosa rivista internazionale Convivium e pubblica numerosi libri. Con il suo ciclo regolare di conferenze dal titolo StredoveC JinaX il Centro cerca il contatto anche con un pubblico non accademico.Le attività del Centro hanno attirato l’attenzione di uno fra i più importanti storici dell’arte, Hans Belting, che, insieme a Christa Belting-Ihm, ha donato al centro la propria collezione di volumi sull’arte medievale. Grazie alla qualità di tale acquisizione, il Centro è pervenuto al livello delle maggiori istituzioni europee.Gli altri membri del progetto, responsabili per le riprese filmate e per il supporto tecnologico, sono membri del team e-learning della Facoltà di Lettere della Masaryk university.Se vuoi saperne di più sui partecipanti guarda il nostro sito web.

story:
What's Newbie Coder Problem Solving School?

Newbie Coder Problem Solving School is an online course for new coders looking to:

  • Strengthen their problem solving skills
  • Learn programmatic thinking
  • Understand how data structures and algorithms work with problem solving
  • Learn to pseudocode (write manually) your solutions before writing code
  • Break down complex problems into smaller problems

You NEED this course if you:

  • Are brand new to coding and already terrified by the concept of coding problems
  • Feel intimidated by choosing data structures, or don't even know what they are
  • Struggle with determining your approaches to even basic coding problems
  • Don't feel confident enough to even ask others for help
  • Can write basic algorithms... but they don't scale enough to pass tests

Newbie Coder Problem Solving School is in a league all its own.

First off, there is no actual code in this entire course. Leaving Coder Problem Solving School code-agnostic makes it extremely valuable to coders from all language communities. Plus, I love challenging myself to bring complex concepts down to a ground level to be easily understood!

I focus on pure conceptualization. What problems do each of these approaches solve? It always comes down to problems and solutions—no matter what we do.

The course is currently in conceptualization phase. The digital content will be created after the pre-sale ends on July 15, 2019, for anticipated delivery in August 2019.

What's included in Newbie Coder Problem Solving School?

First, we'll start out with some basic information and background on problem solving in coding:

  • Why problem solving skills and programmatic thinking are important
  • How programmatic problem solving is different

Then, we'll kick it up a few notches and break down the specific steps of solving a coding problem:

  • Understanding the problem
  • Understanding problem domain
  • Determining your input
  • Determining your output
  • Pseudocoding your approach
  • Identifying edge cases
  • Common patterns in problem solving
  • Optimizing your solution
  • Scaling your solution

I am an experienced online course creator and community organizer. The success of my flagship course, 30 Days to Web Development has given me a deep understanding of the process of planning and creating an online course. Coder Problem Solving School will be video-based at the time of release.

About the creator

Once upon a time, there was a young college student who enrolled in a 4-year Computer Science degree program.

She loved computers, and grew up making, breaking, and fixing things. In her early teens, she had coded her own online journal's template using HTML styles, So, a Computer Science should come naturally—right?

Fast forward to the day at the end of her freshman year. She sat in her major advisor's room, biting down on the inside of her lip to keep from crying, as he suggested that Computer Science may not have been the best fit to her, because she was clearly struggling. Maybe Information Technology would be more along her lines?

That day, she switched majors, and didn't look back.

If you haven't figured it out yet, that girl was me: Nicole Archambault.

Today, I am an educational technology entrepreneur and front-end web developer. I absolutely love what I do!

But, back to college. I was so good with computers. What went wrong?

We aren't taught logical problem solving skills.

Computer Science 101-level classes were great! I was excited to see things happening, and knowing that I made them happen.

When I graduated on to Data Structures and Algorithms, the Computer Science degree began to rapidly increase in difficulty. Problem sets left me panicking, because there were so many abstract steps involved that I couldn't wrap my head around.

I had no idea how to approach a coding problem, and I didn't realize why until I was nearly 30 years old—when I decided once again to learn how to code, and become a developer. An undiagnosed non-verbal learning disability had only amplified my difficulties. (I probably could've gotten more time on those problem sets!)

All of my office hours time was spent asking about actual code, just to try to get something to work. But often, I wasn't even solving the problem I needed to solve. It was like I'd regularly get 2/3 way to a solution... then sputter out.

I needed problem solving skills, y'all. And NOBODY was teaching them, especially not in traditional academic institutions.

Programmatic thinking and problem solving is a VERY different animal.

Programmatic thinking and problem solving is very different from everyday problem solving.

Yes, we follow the same steps as we go through our daily routines; steps that require many little steps. So, they'll look quite familiar early on:

You remove the hair dryer from your cabinet. You get your brush. You style your hair with the brush while drying it. You finish once your hair is completely dried and styled.

But, once the problems begin to get more complex and abstract, it's like doing something you haven't done before, for the first time. You may not know the order of steps, or what sub-steps are involved. You'll get lost fast.

If you've never built a house before, and you only know that the house is the final product—where do you even begin with understanding how to build each part?

Problem solving skills will help your career.

I'm a natural problem solver, as many of us are! But programmatic problem solving tripped me up.

We didn't have problem solving skill resources readily available to coders—particularly new coders.

The overwhelm that can come with being stuck on coding problems, and not getting the help you need, often leads new coders to believe:

  • They're "just not good at coding"
  • They're wasting their time
  • They'll never be able to learn enough to get a job

By solving the problem of the lack of problem solving, we can bring in a fresh wave of problem solvers, ready to take on the world!

I am creating Coder Problem Solving School as a solution to the hundreds of responses I've heard from students over the years. Their feedback clearly tells me that people learning to code are not confident in their ability to approach algorithmic problems.

Not sold yet? Got questions?

If the course isn't for you, you'll probably know. These stories of fear and frustration simply won't resonate with you. The course itself will have a 30-day guarantee, and I'll personally refund you if you're not happy with it. (But you will be! ?)

Once upon a time, there was a young college student who enrolled in a 4-year Computer Science degree program.
She loved computers, and grew up making, breaking, and fixing things. In her early teens, she had coded her own online journal's template using HTML styles, So, a Computer Science should come naturally—right?
Fast forward to the day at the end of her freshman year. She sat in her major advisor's room, biting down on the inside of her lip to keep from crying, as he suggested that Computer Science may not have been the best fit to her, because she was clearly struggling. Maybe Information Technology would be more along her lines?
That day, she switched majors, and didn't look back.
If you haven't figured it out yet, that girl was me: Nicole Archambault.
Today, I am an educational technology entrepreneur and front-end web developer. I absolutely love what I do!
But, back to college. I was so good with computers. What went wrong?
We aren't taught logical problem solving skills.
Computer Science 101-level classes were great! I was excited to see things happening, and knowing that I made them happen.
When I graduated on to Data Structures and Algorithms, the Computer Science degree began to rapidly increase in difficulty. Problem sets left me panicking, because there were so many abstract steps involved that I couldn't wrap my head around.
I had no idea how to approach a coding problem, and I didn't realize why until I was nearly 30 years old—when I decided once again to learn how to code, and become a developer. An undiagnosed non-verbal learning disability had only amplified my difficulties. (I probably could've gotten more time on those problem sets!)
All of my office hours time was spent asking about actual code, just to try to get something to work. But often, I wasn't even solving the problem I needed to solve. It was like I'd regularly get 2/3 way to a solution... then sputter out.
I needed problem solving skills, y'all. And NOBODY was teaching them, especially not in traditional academic institutions.
Programmatic thinking and problem solving is a VERY different animal.
Programmatic thinking and problem solving is very different from everyday problem solving.
Yes, we follow the same steps as we go through our daily routines; steps that require many little steps. So, they'll look quite familiar early on:
You remove the hair dryer from your cabinet. You get your brush. You style your hair with the brush while drying it. You finish once your hair is completely dried and styled.
But, once the problems begin to get more complex and abstract, it's like doing something you haven't done before, for the first time. You may not know the order of steps, or what sub-steps are involved. You'll get lost fast.
If you've never built a house before, and you only know that the house is the final product—where do you even begin with understanding how to build each part?

Problem solving skills will help your career.
I'm a natural problem solver, as many of us are! But programmatic problem solving tripped me up.
We didn't have problem solving skill resources readily available to coders—particularly new coders.
The overwhelm that can come with being stuck on coding problems, and not getting the help you need, often leads new coders to believe:

They're "just not good at coding"
They're wasting their time
They'll never be able to learn enough to get a job

By solving the problem of the lack of problem solving, we can bring in a fresh wave of problem solvers, ready to take on the world!
I am creating Coder Problem Solving School as a solution to the hundreds of responses I've heard from students over the years. Their feedback clearly tells me that people learning to code are not confident in their ability to approach algorithmic problems.

Not sold yet? Got questions?
If the course isn't for you, you'll probably know. These stories of fear and frustration simply won't resonate with you. The course itself will have a 30-day guarantee, and I'll personally refund you if you're not happy with it. (But you will be! ?)

story:
Please see our FAQs to learn which kit may be suitable for you or your child:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/snappyxo-a-design-driven-robotics-education-kit#/faq

A bit of background first

2015 an epochal year. A Stony Brook University professor, who is also a member of the U.S. National Academy of Inventors begins teaching a new Freshman Design Robotics class created with support from a Teaching Innovation grant from the NY state. The goal of the class?

To provide students with an authentic exposure to design, coding and circuits through a project oriented approach.  With the use of robotics, students would learn these three core concepts in a hands-on fashion.  It was here that he realized a fundamental problem with his plan: the cost and lack of versatility of a robotics kit.

The professor and his students began to create something that would provide an authentic and affordable design-driven robotics education.

For everyone. Not just college kids.

Meet SnappyXO  - the world's first  STEM/Robotics education product meant for students all the way from elementary to college students.  

http://www.snappyxo.com

Curious to see what his students made from SnappyXO? See this short highlights video from his class project.

Please note that all the robots in the above video use a cheaper grade translucent plastic called Acrylic. That's great for prototyping, but our backers here will get everything made in super strong and durable plastic called Acetal. And, they come in colors too.

Now and Future

Soon, the word got out. Several K-12 schools, STEM camps, after-school STEM/Robotics programs, hackathon, and makerfaire in Long Island where Stony Brook University is located joined the chorus and asked if SnappyXO could work for a larger range of students?

So, Mechanismic Inc. was formed in 2017 to investigate this possibility.

Then, Mechanismic received a highly prestigious and selective grant from the National Science Foundation (NSF) SBIR/STTR program earlier this year to develop this cool Robotics Education product. 

 

2019 is an epochal year.

In the summer of 2019, we created a unified hardware that would work for kids all the way from elementary to high-school and college students.  Makers and hackers would love this too.

So, now we have tiers of kits for everyone. Hurray! 

Problems and Limitations with Existing Robotics Products:

1. Too costly -- $350+. Gasp!

2. Little design experience -- think how to design mechanisms in a robot that can have a specific motion, such as walking, scooping, launching, etc.

3. Coding-focused

4. Lack of Electronics Design and Prototyping -- think the joy of bread-boarding and dealing with the crippling reality of not having enough voltage for your motors. Now, that's fun.

5. Did not allow students to design their own custom robot parts -- want a curved piece? Sure,  do an injection molding run. Wait, that would be $10k+?

6. Lack of openness in choice of electronics parts and programming platform, such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi, etc. -- example: an ultrasonic sensor can be had for less than $2 on amazon.com, but the same capability in a high-end robot kit comes at a steep price of $35+. Ouch!

That class needed a robot kit that provided for significant design experiences rather than just coding. They did not want to follow a manual to create their highly personalized robots. They could not. They asked for something affordable and intuitive. In addition, they wanted to choose their electronics and their programming platform. Again, why? Because...

The goal is education, not cookie-cutter Robotics.

What is SnappyXO?

SnappyXO consists of hardware, which are our own plastic components, such as beams, plates, connectors, gears, wheels, etc. and a mechatronics kit containing sensors, actuators, microcontroller, and misc. electronics.

The mechatronics kit components are open source, inexpensive, and off-the-shelf. Which means that you can rapidly move on to another programming platform or buy more and better electronic components.

1. Hardware

SnappyXO contains a patent-pending hardware kit made from high precision laser-cut parts from flat sheets of Acetal plastic. The hardware is a set of minimalistic pieces, which allows one to create 3D structures and moving systems.

It is completely customizable and works with the off-the-shelf electronics and any open source programming platforms, such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi, and Micro:bit. 

The method of assembly is unique and novel. Yet, it's very intuitive and does not need too many different parts. 

A smattering of SnappyXO hardware parts laid against a green colored sheet

2. Apps

MotionGen: SnappyXO comes with MotionGen, the only Android and iOS app of its kind in the world, is developed on top of the state of the art research in Mechanisms and Robotics done at Stony Brook University. There is a version available on the app stores already, but will be updated soon to allow more functionality. It allows one to design and simulate robot motions. You can design a robot motion in the app and can prototype it using the hardware kit and see it come to life! You can also import images of existing mechanisms and see how they work.

Use MotionGen app to design custom mechanisms for SnappyXO and beyond.

MotionGen is in V1 right now and is constantly being updated.

 

ArduinoBlue: We will also provide an app to control robot motions over Bluetooth called ArduinoBlue, which works with Arduino family of Mircontroller boards and SnappyXO Robot kit. It's currently available on the app stores. 

Control your SnappyXO creation using your smartphone! SnappyXO is designed for easy integration with ArduinoBlue.

SnappyXO provides authentic STEM education and Robot Design experience.

 

 

 

 

So, here we are!

After having tested it in numerous classes, schools, STEM camps, and hackathon, we are super excited to bring this product to the backers at Indiegogo. A successful campaign will help us set up our manufacturing (laser cutter and fume extractor) to create the product and deliver to you in time for the holidays.

Students posing with their robots from different summer Robotics camps in 2019

 

Stony Brook University Freshman Robotics Students' Project

What We Need and What You Get

We have spent a lot of time figuring out the hardware. Now, we are excited to put this in your hands and have you design and build your own creation.

Worry not! We will provide many projects that you can simply start designing, prototyping, and programming with. We are confident that even if you followed our instructions, you will still end up with something different than what we thought. 

We have been operating out of an incubator, but now our challenge at this time is to set up a manufacturing facility where we can laser cut parts and for that we need two primary equipment: a laser cutter and a fume extraction system. We estimate that a starter version of these two pieces of equipment will cost no less than $20k, but a higher powered and bigger laser cutter made and sold in U.S. (not the cheap ones made in China) themselves can cost as much as $35k.

Your backing of this project will allow us to offset the cost of the equipment and also allow us to buy raw material and electronics for the perks.

Perks

So, apart from our gratitude what are we offering you in return?

We have four different tiers of STEM/Robotics kits as well as two special kits focusing on 1) wheeled robots and 2) walking robots built out of unique walking mechanisms, and several add-ons, which you can add to your perks. Add-ons are simple contraption kits, which would be perfect for a younger child at home or to gift a friend or family member. During check-out, you can also add more servos and DC motors.

 

1. SnappyXO Mechanics Kit

This is the most basic kit to get started in the world of SnappyXO! Consisting of only the plastic hardware pieces and rubber bands, this kit is a perfect learning tool for young kids to get started with design and engineering. You can build contraptions that serve as a perfect medium for having fun and learning at the same time! 

Check out some example projects in the video below:

 

 

Intended End-users: elementary and middle-school students
Several projects in this kit are perfect for corporate giveaways, ice-breaker exercises, and STEM gifts.
 

2. SnappyXO Invention Kit 

This is a kit for inventors! It comes with all the parts in the mechanics kit and some more along with two DC motors and electronics to help you build motorized contraptions. No programming required. Just design, invent and bring your projects to life!  

Check out some example projects in the video below:

 

 
Intended End-users: advanced elementary, middle- and high-school students, college students, and makers and hobbyists
 

3. SnappyXO Robotics Kit

SnappyXO Robotics kit consists of our own hardware with a mechatronics kit that has a perfect combination of basic sensors, actuators, and Arduino to get started with robot design and programming and build what you imagine! The best part is that the sensors, actuators, and electronics in the kit are inexpensive off-the-shelf electronics. So, if you need more, you can purchase from pretty much anywhere.  You can use Arduino IDE or any graphical programming interface to program your robot. 

Intended End-users: advanced middle- and high-school students, college students, makers and hobbyists, engineers, and computer scientists 

 

4. SnappyXO Advanced Robotics Kit

SnappyXO's Advanced Robotics kit is our biggest kit offering. It consists of more hardware parts than the Standard Robotics kit and comes with a mechatronics kit that has a wider range of sensors and actuators. A perfect kit for building complex robots with multitasking capabilities. Once again, you can buy more relatively low-cost off-the-shelf motors, sensors, etc. to augment the capabilities of this kit.

Check out some example projects in the video below*:

 

*Some projects, such as quadruped driven by eight servos, may require more components not in the kit.
Intended End-users: advanced middle- and high-school students, college students, makers and hobbyists, engineers, and computer scientists 
 

Comparison of Standard Perks

Special Perks

We are also offering two special robot kits which have distinct focus.

1. SnappyXO Walking Robot Kit

Walking robots are cool! Get this kit and build your own. Not one, but many different types of walking robots using linkage systems. Use our app MotionGen to play with different motions and create your own walking machine. This kit is perfect for someone more interested in learning how to design unique walking motions rather than programming. 

Intended End-users: advanced middle and high school students, college students, teachers and professors, makers and hobbyists, and engineers

Check out some example projects in the video below:

 

2. SnappyXO Wheeled Robot Kit

Calling out all the robotics enthusiasts out there! A kit especially for you. Get started with the basics of programming with our wheeled robot kit. It is the perfect platform to learn and experiment with. Build two wheel, four-wheel drive robots, control them using IR remote, or drive them autonomously. You can drive them using DC motors or Continuous rotation servos.

Check out some example projects in the video below*:

*Some projects may require special components, such as line-tracking sensor, not in the kit.

 

Intended End-users: advanced middle- and high-school students interested in learning programming, college students, makers and hobbyists, engineers, and computer scientists

 

Comparison of Special Perks

Add-Ons

A perfect gift for the holiday season! We are offering interesting add-ons that can be bought with our perks and will be a great gift for yourself, your or a friends' kids.

1. Handheld Catapult

A fun toy to design yourself and then play with! Get two or more of these for a full-fledged ping-pong war.

Teachers can use this to demonstrate the concept of energy storage and conversion, levers, and mechanical advantage.

    

 

2. Extending Gripper

No hands allowed! Extend your reach and grab everything with this gripper.

A great science tool for illustrating the power of levers when combined to achieve a larger range of motion.

 

Children making their own grabber at the Long Island Maritime Explorium

3. Crossbow

Raise your marksmanship with this ancient yet fun device. Load, lock, and release!

Uses an Ingenious locking mechanism using a four-bar linkage system to provide the perfect spark for innovation.

 

4. Catapult

Ready, aim, fire! Build and modify your own catapult to see who launches the farthest!

This is also a teacher's dream science tool as it presents a fun context for discussing simple machines, energy conversion, and projectile motion.

     

The Impact

The impact of your participation in this project has far-reaching consequences. 

Our goal is to make Robotics affordable and fun for everyone without sacrificing the authenticity of design and engineering experience.

We believe that every student deserves to have a robot kit of their own so that they can continue to learn with it without worrying about breaking things. SnappyXO makes that possible. It is low-cost and craft-like feel lowers the barrier for experimentation. 

Your backing will, of course, help us raise some capital for manufacturing. However, we want you to be part of our journey to develop this product and bring to the general market by providing us with your input and feedback. To us, that is of far greater importance.

At this time, STEM education has huge socio-economic implications. Consider following:

1. The U.S. Department of Labor estimated that in 2018, 2.5 million STEM jobs went unfilled,
which at an average pay of $85,000 per year for such jobs translates to $200 billion in lost wages.

2. Robotics education, which brings several STEM topics together, has a great potential to create a workforce that is prepared to tackle the technical challenges of the 21st century.

3. 78% of high school graduates are not prepared to take STEM classes at college level.

SnappyXO could relieve some of those pain points.

Andy from AndysTechGarage saw us at the Eastern Long Island Makerfaire and made this wonderful video, which touches upon some of the problems we have mentioned above.

Arduino Robotics/Snappy XO by AndysTechGarage

Risks and Challenges

We have manufactured hundreds of these kits  and have reduced risks to a large extent. However, we are still reliant on our plastic and electronics suppliers for manufacturing and the mechatronics components. We will need them timely and on a cost-effective basis. Fortunately, we have several suppliers from whom we can purchase raw materials and working with the off-the-shelf electronics means that we have a lot more choices.

Our other challenge is the actual manufacturing as we need to set up a proper laser cutting facility with adequate fume extraction and ventilation set up. A successful campaign will mitigate these challenges to a large extent.

The question is not that whether we can deliver or not, because we can, but how painful it will be for us. 

Timeline

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't back this project yourself financially, although, we sincerely hope that you would, you can still help us by spreading the word about this project. Use your social media connections, influence, and passion to tell others about us. We bet you know at least someone -- a friend, a family member, a teacher, a principal, a camp director, girls scout, museums, informal learning environments -- who would like to know about this project.

And, keep an eye out for us when we launch in the bigger markets.

Our Team

Mechanismic Inc. is being led by young and enthusiastic entrepreneurs, world-class researchers and professors of Stony Brook University, passionate student interns, seasoned business professionals and advisers.

This project team is being led by Agranya Jampala, Barry Chuang, Ninad Jagdale, and Dr. Anurag Purwar and supported by Scientific and Business advisers, and several other Technical team members. The app and software development efforts are being led by Prerna Kothari, Prasad Dixit, and Zhijie Lyu. 

Barry has served as CEO and CTO of technology education companies with experience in project management, manufacturing automation, and business operations, and Agranya has several years of experience in design and manufacturing innovative products and also served as the Entrepreneur lead on the NSF I-Corps project for the SnappyXO. 

Dr. Purwar is an award winning professor, researcher, TEDx speaker, and inventor of several technologies. He has substantial experience inventing devices and bringing them to the market. He is an elected member of the ASME Mechanisms and Robotics Committee and of the National Academy of Inventors (NAI). His Mobility Assist invention is currently being sold by Biodex Medical Systems. See a video by Biodex here:

Our goal is to make Robotics affordable and fun for everyone without sacrificing the authenticity of design and engineering experience.
We believe that every student deserves to have a robot kit of their own so that they can continue to learn with it without worrying about breaking things. SnappyXO makes that possible. It is low-cost and craft-like feel lowers the barrier for experimentation. 
Your backing will, of course, help us raise some capital for manufacturing. However, we want you to be part of our journey to develop this product and bring to the general market by providing us with your input and feedback. To us, that is of far greater importance.
At this time, STEM education has huge socio-economic implications. Consider following:
1. The U.S. Department of Labor estimated that in 2018, 2.5 million STEM jobs went unfilled,which at an average pay of $85,000 per year for such jobs translates to $200 billion in lost wages.
2. Robotics education, which brings several STEM topics together, has a great potential to create a workforce that is prepared to tackle the technical challenges of the 21st century.
3. 78% of high school graduates are not prepared to take STEM classes at college level.
SnappyXO could relieve some of those pain points.
Andy from AndysTechGarage saw us at the Eastern Long Island Makerfaire and made this wonderful video, which touches upon some of the problems we have mentioned above.


Arduino Robotics/Snappy XO by AndysTechGarage



Risks and Challenges
We have manufactured hundreds of these kits  and have reduced risks to a large extent. However, we are still reliant on our plastic and electronics suppliers for manufacturing and the mechatronics components. We will need them timely and on a cost-effective basis. Fortunately, we have several suppliers from whom we can purchase raw materials and working with the off-the-shelf electronics means that we have a lot more choices.
Our other challenge is the actual manufacturing as we need to set up a proper laser cutting facility with adequate fume extraction and ventilation set up. A successful campaign will mitigate these challenges to a large extent.
The question is not that whether we can deliver or not, because we can, but how painful it will be for us. 

Timeline



Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't back this project yourself financially, although, we sincerely hope that you would, you can still help us by spreading the word about this project. Use your social media connections, influence, and passion to tell others about us. We bet you know at least someone -- a friend, a family member, a teacher, a principal, a camp director, girls scout, museums, informal learning environments -- who would like to know about this project.
And, keep an eye out for us when we launch in the bigger markets.
Our TeamMechanismic Inc. is being led by young and enthusiastic entrepreneurs, world-class researchers and professors of Stony Brook University, passionate student interns, seasoned business professionals and advisers.This project team is being led by Agranya Jampala, Barry Chuang, Ninad Jagdale, and Dr. Anurag Purwar and supported by Scientific and Business advisers, and several other Technical team members. The app and software development efforts are being led by Prerna Kothari, Prasad Dixit, and Zhijie Lyu. Barry has served as CEO and CTO of technology education companies with experience in project management, manufacturing automation, and business operations, and Agranya has several years of experience in design and manufacturing innovative products and also served as the Entrepreneur lead on the NSF I-Corps project for the SnappyXO. Dr. Purwar is an award winning professor, researcher, TEDx speaker, and inventor of several technologies. He has substantial experience inventing devices and bringing them to the market. He is an elected member of the ASME Mechanisms and Robotics Committee and of the National Academy of Inventors (NAI). His Mobility Assist invention is currently being sold by Biodex Medical Systems. See a video by Biodex here:

story:
WELCOME TO THE GREATNESS MOVEMENT!

My name is DeAndre Carter and I am an urban kid with global dreams. My passion has driven me to share my message of inspiration in a way that will change lives all over the world!

I am a prime example of the adage "It's not about where you start, but where you finish that counts".  Life did not deal me a 'fair' hand. Growing up in the inner city of Detroit exposed me to poverty, adversity and despair. Being raised in a household without my father presented many unpleasant challenges for me during childhood. Despite the hardships, I found a way to motivate myself and others along the way. This 'Cody Boy' grew up to become a "Spartan Man", but it was not an easy process.

As a graduate from Michigan State University's business school, I became the first person in my family to earn a degree from a major 4-year university. Growing up on the streets of Detroit taught me many things. One of the most valuable lessons I learned was the need to believe in yourself at all times. Life will challenge you with adversity to test the level of your desire. I have passed the test and now I want to help you do the same. Another valuable life lesson was the amazing feeling I would get when I helped others to become their best. This was an early clue that it is my purpose to inspire people to achieve greatness.

This brings me to the heart of this campaign. My purpose is to inspire this generation to pursue and achieve greatness. I have written a book called "Demand Greatness: 4 Keys to Unleash Your Potential".  My book will touch hearts, inspire minds and motivate each reader to become the best version of themselves. This is important to me because I have spent the past 18 years speaking to audiences across the country and the response has been the same every where I go... DEANDRE, WE WANT MORE!



THIS IS MORE THAN A BOOK; IT'S A MOVEMENT!

Demand Greatness is more than a book, this is a movement because your life cannot stay in the same place after you get this message in you. You will be motivated to be on the MOVE! This is the game changer you've been waiting for. This is your moment. This is your time. If you believe in greatness, then I believe in you!

"Demand Greatness" is the next step creating a Greatness Movement that will help people change their lives from the inside out. My mission is to instill a 'culture of positive belief' in the hearts of youth, educators, and entrepreneurs across the globe.  Your donation today will bring the Greatness Movement one step closer to changing lives everywhere . 

(Display: This is not the actual book cover)

DONATE TODAY AND GREATNESS WILL BE ON THE WAY!




YOUR SUPPORT IS NEEDED

My selection of a publisher was a tedious process that eventually led me to a company with a track record of integrity, excellence and success. Spirit Reign Communications & Publishing is known for publishing works by many authors including Eric Thomas ("ET The Hip Hop Preacher"), author of "The Secrets to Success" and "Greatness Is Upon You". They have a firm understanding of what it takes to support, promote and partner with an author like myself. I am committed to changing the world with a message of hope, resilience and grit. Spirit Reign Communications & Publishing has proven that they are capable of providing the literary support needed to accomplish greatness. 

Your support can help to create the next life changing success story!


HOW WILL DONATIONS BE USED?

Now that you know why I am excited to publish this book, let me explain where funds will be allocated:

*Funding from this campaign will cover costs for the following:

*Printing, production and shipping costs for 3000 high quality hard cover books

*Book cover design, layout, editing services

*E-book creation and official listing with online book providers

*Marketing services and materials needed to successfully promote the book upon release

*Hiring marketing interns to assist with the successful promotional launch for the book

*Fees and costs associated with managing this fundraising campaign


PERKS:

One of the most exciting parts of this campaign for me is the ability to provide perks to my supporters.

During the past 18 years of my speaking career I have met some of the most amazing, kind-hearted and generous people along the way. This portion of the campaign allows me to show thanks and appreciation for their support while also giving me the opportunity to welcome new supporters. If you have not heard any of my messages I guarantee that you are in for a direction changing shift in your life.

To my loyal supporters: This is the day that we have been waiting for! This book campaign and publishing process has been long anticipated. Your support has inspired me to write this book and now your support will help to get it published.

To my new supporters: I am excited for you to join me on this journey of greatness. Your introduction my work will be an amazing experience that is sure to deliver a major dose of motivation.

The donation packages listed on the right side of your screen explains all the perks you will get in exchange for your donation. My favorite set of packages are the Demand Greatness Bronze-Diamond kits. They include the exclusive success coaching sessions (valued at $197) that will help you to create the specific results you are looking for in your life.  Starting as low as $100, these packages allow me to connect and coach you on a more personal level while also offering additional unique perks.

The Demand Greatness Starter Kit is packed with awesome value. You will get both a hard copy ($24.99 value) and electronic version of my book while also being entered into a raffle for a cool dining experience as well.

WHAT IF FUNDING FALLS SHORT?

Every IndieGoGo campaign does not reach it's desired goal. In such cases the fees and costs for managing the campaign are approximately 5% higher than instances where the campaign does reach the funding goal. You can rest assured that if my campaign does not reach it's goal then I will commit myself to find the additional funds needed to make this book a reality.

HOWEVER, I must state that I am 100% confident that my supporters will help us to achieve this goal. I take nothing for granted, but I know that people who believe in The Greatness Movement will come through on this campaign in a big way!

THIS IS HISTORY IN THE MAKING!


    BECOME A DIFFERENCE MAKER TODAY!

    This campaign is a true game changer. When you make a contribution, your dollars are making a difference.  When you share this mission with others, you are spreading a message of hope that will inspire people to act on their dreams. When you promote the idea of creating a Greatness Movement, YOU are truly impacting lives. "A rising tide lifts all ships"; that is symbolic of what is happening with the Greatness Movement. One by one entrepreneurs, business professionals, educators, college students, community leaders and youth all over the country are seeing their lives go to the next level through the messages shared within this book. Publishing and distributing this powerful material will only multiply the number of people who will be inspired to achieve greatness.


      CAN YOU SEE THE POTENTIAL?

      A successful fundraising campaign for The Greatness Movement will result in the book being published December 2014!  We will enter 2015 equipped with excitement and a message that will inspire every person who we connect with. Looking toward the future, I would love to start a scholarship program that gives support to those who need it most. We are also preparing seminars (live and online) to inspire, education and empower the next generation of achievers to be their best in all they do. As you see this vision is coming to pass. Be a part of this history making movement. We need your support!


        Other Ways You Can Help The Greatness Movement

        Making a donation is only one way that you can help this campaign.  You can also do any or all of the following:

        Tell your 5 closest friends about this awesome campaign! (within the next 24hrs)

        Share this campaign with people in your network! (share links on social media)

        Follow DeAndre on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram!

        Subscribe to The Greatness Movement YouTube page!

        TELL EVERYBODY YOU KNOW ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN!


        WATCH THIS VIDEO...IT WILL INSPIRE YOU!

story:
UPDATE:
This Campaign was recently run on Kickstarter, and failed due to an unreachable goal. We are now running this almost identical campaign. The IndeGoGo flexible funding option better suits our needs. Sorry for any confusion, and thanks for the support! 

What is BEHS Tech? 

Brookfield East High School Technology Club is an extracurricular initiative to inspire, educate, and support students interested in STEAM (STEM + Art). We provide a wide range of opportunities for students of any skill level to jump-start their STEAM education, or even simply discover if their interests lie in any of the STEAM fields. These opportunities include:

  • Brainstorming and think tanks
  • Skill building (metalworking to PCB design) 
  • Team projects (electric go-kart, autonomous quadcopter) 
  • Career exploration (through hands-on experience and introductions to employees in STEAM fields) 
  • Internships

What is this Fundraiser for? (And why should I back it?)

School funding is often limited or unavailable for extracurricular activities. In addition we have seen an explosion in the number of students interested in what we have to offer in the past couple of years especially. Because of this, we have decided to utilize crowd-sourced funding to help support our activities. We need your assistance to support our growing number of students, and each pledge will make us more successful. Spread the word! The more we raise the larger the number of students we can begin to support, and the more skilled and productive they will become.

Our club fills a major gap in technology education. Many summer camps, science fairs, and school activities boast about “getting kids interested in technology and engineering.” However, this is never followed up with real world, engineering education until college or in the workplace. As a result, many students start their college engineering studies without any useful experience. This club is able to bridge the gap by providing the resources and experience for self-directed education.

The funding goal for this project is low by IndeGoGo standards. We picked this goal because we wanted to give ourselves the best possible chances of success. $500 would let us reward our backers and help to budget for the coming year. But by no means is our project goal a cap on the money we could make use of. We hope, that with the support of the community, we can support our club throughout the coming years.

Past Student Achievements 

This club has helped to enable students to turn their dreams into real world projects. Some of these projects are visible in video above. These projects are ongoing and are often tools that aid other students projects. A few examples include: 

  • Quadcopter 
  • Electric Go-Kart 
  • Keypad/Solenoid Door locking system
  • RC Airplane Drone (work in progress) 
  • PirateBox WiFi HotSpot
  • Rockets for Schools Champions (2013) and 2nd Place (2014)
  • Arduino Rocket Launcher 
  • Taught 7th Grade Class on Embedded Electronics and Arduino

Budget

Students control most functions of this club. They will decide (with adult guidance) what projects and ideas they wish to pursue. But their decision will likely include: 

  • Some type of 3D printer (or printer upgrade) 
  • Further development of our 3D-Robotics Quadcopter 

And may include:

  • Raspberry Pi’s
  • Upgraded revision of the electric go-kart 
  • Build a DIY Laptop (from desktop parts) 
  • Laser Death Ray Jet Car (can’t go wrong with lasers)

Voting Reward: Every backer gets one vote per dollar they back in deciding a project (from a list assembled from your suggestions).

Risks and challenges

As you might have noticed, the rewards for this campaign are limited mostly to our appreciation and advertising space on our projects. Education and learning rarely has physical up-front rewards. Keep in mind that with your help, our students have the opportunity to pioneer a new generation of technology. 
As far as risks go, there’s not much to discuss. If you backed high enough to get advertising space (for which we thank you again!), there is the highly unlikely chance that each and every one of our projects spontaneously combusts, meaning we wont have anywhere to put your advertisements. It’s doubtful. 
The real risk that we will be worrying about is that no matter how hard we try, we can never thank our backers enough for their donations!
