story:
Donate to our FREE afterschool theater program for kids!

Who We Are

Arts in Education engages a network of passionate and dedicated artists to teach after-school theater classes to underserved middle school students in the Lower East Side and East Village, filling the critical void left by underfunded or nonexistent drama programs.

Arts in Education is offered after-school, completely free! two days a week from 3:30 to 5:30pm for 9 weeks.  Throughout the program kids engage in ensemble building games, improvisation exercises, text analysis, physical theater exercises, writing exercises, original choreography, character creation, playwriting and clowning and mask making workshops. The students show off their skills and perform their self-written playlets and scenes as well as their own dance at our Culminating Event for friends and family.

We have also recently started our Saturday Morning Workshops in Lighting/Sound and Set Design.  Concerned with all things behind-the-scenes, kids work one on one with technicians and designers to create their own sets, complete with props, and design and implement their own lighting and sound cues.  The students in our Saturday Tech Class create the set for our Culminating Event, allowing them an incredible opportunity to see their creations come alive on stage.

Why We Do What We Do

We believe that the dramatic arts encourage individuality, creativity, and a deep sense of fulfillment in young people and, as such, should be an essential part of our education system.   Middle school is a vulnerable time for students and arts after-school programs give them a holistic foundation for high school and beyond. 

According to the NYC department of Education 2012-2013 Annual Arts Report only 14% of middle schools offer theater in school and since 2008 the number of middle schools providing theater arts to any grade from 6 to 8 declined by 17%.  The New York Times also reported that two-thirds of public elementary schools have no art or music teachers what so ever.

That’s where we come in!

Through the dramatic arts we engage kids through theater to foster self-confidence, leadership and community building, freedom of expression, and increased language facility and reading comprehension, accomplishments we have seen first hand.

What never ceases to amaze us is the dedication and excitement our students have for learning these theater skills that allow them to better not only themselves but their community as well.  It is an incredible thing to watch them grow not only as individuals but also as a theater family, and you can help!

How You Can Help

Arts in Education is particularly unique because we have at our disposal a 4-theater complex at Theater for the New City which provides our students with a range of theaters to work in and a number of different lighting and sound boards to learn and program.  However despite our free home the bills keep piling up so, of the $10,300 you’re helping us raise, here’s how the budget breaks down:

With the ever-growing demand for our program, our teaching artists and volunteers hope to reach more children in our community.  Your support today could change the outcome of a child’s life in the future.  

Give us a shout out!

Supporting our campaign is just one of the ways you can help grow and sustain our creative movement.  Give us a shout out on Facebook and Twitter, Like our page! Share our campaign with your fabulous friends, Check out our website, Use your creative energy and encourage those around you to do the same!

particularly unique because we have at our disposal a 4-theater complex at
Theater for the New City which provides our students with a range of theaters
to work in and a number of different lighting and sound boards to learn and
program.  However despite our free
home the bills keep piling up so, of the $10,300 you’re helping us raise,
here’s how the budget breaks down:
With
the ever-growing demand for our program, our teaching artists and volunteers hope
to reach more children in our community.  Your support today could change the outcome of a child’s life
in the future.  Give us a shout out!
Supporting
our campaign is just one of the ways you can help grow and sustain our creative
movement.  Give us a shout out on Facebook and Twitter, Like our page! Share our campaign with your fabulous friends, Check out our website, Use your creative energy and encourage those around you to do the same!

story:
My name is Karly Grace. I am 15 years old and a current sophomore. I heard about the London Theatre Trip through school and was completely ecstatic. I have wanted to go to another country since I was in third grade. I love the concept of an entire different place with a completely different social and economical system than the US. I have a particular fondness with the UK, having done about 3 reports on it through the years. I am also addicted to the theatre. I think its beautiful how actors tell a story through dance and powerful statements. I have also memorized at least 3 soundtracks. 

If I get enough money, I have a chance to go on a trip to London with my school. We get to travel to Stratford, Salisbury, Bath, Stonehenge, as well as London. We get to follow Shakespeare's footsteps, go to a theatre workshop, meet some of the actors ( :O) and do regular touristy stuff, such as the Tower of London and Changing of the Guard. 

When I heard about the trip, I was super excited and wanted to go but didn't tell my mom because I knew it would be a lot for our family. Then my mom found out on her own and decided that she would do anything so I had the chance to go. Being a single mom, she's already got a lot on her plate so I decided to get the funds myself. The trip cost $5,000 and I want to raise as much as I possibly can. But being a full time student, getting a traditional job is pretty hard, especially since I can't drive. So I am hoping that selling stuff on eBay and donations will cover it. The more, the better!

In today's society, we need more kids getting out into the world and seeing what there is out there. To explore and not just follow as their parents did, but branch out. It is a really big world out there and I have only seen a small part of it. Help me see more!

story:
This is an opportunity for members and allies of LGBTQ student groups from across the country to step up and support the GLBT National Help Center and our two national toll-free hotlines, and make a donation in support of both youth and adults who are struggling with coming-out issues, school bullying, relationship problems and a lot more. 


Help us continue to help those in need:

For the past 18 years, the GLBT National Help Center has provided support to over 200,000 people on our two toll-free hotlines, the GLBT National Hotline and the GLBT National Youth Talkline.  

We provide peer-support, enabling youth and adults to speak with a trained peer-counselor about coming-out issues, relationship concerns, safer-sex information, school bullying and so much more.

We are the oldest and most comprensive national organization of its type and scope in the US, providing this critically needed service regardless of age or geographic location.  

In spite of the progress our community has made in the courts, so many people that reach out to us face such terrible isolation from the very people who should be there to support them the most.

The people who turn to us for help everyday often live in rural and conservative parts of the country and are frequently feeling severely isolated, closeted, and despairing, with literally no one else safe to talk to. 

This video gives you a real-life example of exactly how we helped a 15 year old boy form a small Texas town.  His story says it better then we ever could.


The need for our services have far outgrown our small budget, that's why we're asking for your help.  Please help us continue to be there for so many people who are in need. 


      Rewards: 

      Because most of our budget goes to answering our calls, we can't offer big shiny rewards.  However what we can offer is the knowledge that your donation will adopt a specific number of calls, and personally pay all the costs associated with assisting those callers in need.  


      $8 - ADOPT 2 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 2 people in need!  And receive one of our brand-new stickers in red, the first color of the rainbow flag.  Collect all six!


      $16 - ADOPT 4 CALLERS 

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 4 people in need!  And receive TWO of our brand-new stickers, one in red and the other in orange, the first two colors of the rainbow flag.  Collect all six!


      $24 - ADOPT 6 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 6 people in need!  And receive THREE of our brand-new stickers, one in red, one in orange and one in yellow, the first three colors of the rainbow flag.  Collect all six!


      $40 - ADOPT 10 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 10 people in need!  And receive FOUR of our brand-new stickers, one in red, one in orange, one in yellow and one in green, the first four colors of the rainbow flag.  Collect all six!


      $60 - ADOPT 15 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 15 people in need!  And receive FIVE of our brand-new stickers, one in red, one in orange, one in yellow, one in green and one in blue, the first five colors of the rainbow flag.  Collect all six!  And a personal note of thanks hand-written by our Executive Director.  Fancy Shmancy!


      $100 - ADOPT 25 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 25 people in need!  And receive all SIX of our brand-new stickers, one in each color of the rainbow flag!  And a personal note of thanks hand-written by our Executive Director.  Very fancy shmancy!!



      $140 - ADOPT 35 CALLERS 

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 35 people in need!  And receive SEVEN of our brand-new stickers, one in each color of the rainbow flag and a bonus combined rainbow sticker too.  Wow!  And don’t forget, you also get that personal note of thanks hand-written by our Executive Director.  Exceedingly fancy shmancy!!



      $200 - ADOPT 50 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 50 people in need!  And receive SEVEN of our brand-new stickers, one in each color of the rainbow flag and a bonus combined rainbow sticker too.  And a personal note of thanks hand-written by our Executive Director.  But wait, there’s more!  If you act now, you also get our super-duper Rainbow Rice Crispy Treats recipe.  Can you believe it!?! 


      $300 - ADOPT 75 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 75 people in need!  And receive SEVEN of our brand-new stickers, one in each color of the rainbow flag and a bonus combined rainbow sticker too.  And a full hand-written thank-you letter written by our Executive Director.  And our super-duper Rainbow Rice Crispy Treats recipe.  And (yes, another AND) you also get one of our mother’s Date-less Raisin and Walnut Loaf for date-night!  Trust us, it’s delicious!


      $500 - ADOPT 125 CALLERS

      Pay all the costs for us to assist a total of 125 people in need!  And receive SEVEN of our brand-new stickers, one in each color of the rainbow flag and a bonus combined rainbow sticker too.  And a full hand-written thank-you letter written by our Executive Director.  And our super-duper Rainbow Rice Crispy Treats recipe.  And (yes, another AND) you also get one of our mother’s Date-less Raisin and Walnut Loaf for date-night!  Trust us, it’s delicious!  And finally, a personal phone call from our Executive Director thanking you for enabling us to help so many teens and adults in need.



      Other Ways You Can Help

      We realize not everyone can support us financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help out.  

      If you would like to create your own event, like having a bake sale,  and not go through indiegogo, donations can be sent to:

      GLBT National Help Center

      2261 Market Street, #296

      San Francisco, CA 94114

      or donate directly at: www.GLBThotline.org/donate


      SPREAD THE WORD!

      Let your friends and family know,  post a video, send a letter, tweet, post.  Get everyone you know talking about the  GSA's Do It For Good campaign via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Youtube, google+, blog, or whatever you have.

      Or get out into the outside world and hold an event!

      You can be the voice of the GLBT National Help Center to those who can financially help us continue do to the work that we do.

story:
About Me and My Campaign

Hello, my name is Bradley Krueger. I'm also a conductor. After finishing my Master's degree in Choral Conducting at Andrews University, I have served as Director of Music at First Presbyterian Church of South Bend, Indiana since 2009. With a BA in Vocal Performance from Union College (NE), I also attended the Aspen Music Festival and School in Vocal Concert studies. I also have the distinction of being a Foundationer (charter member) of the first Tallis Scholars Summer School in England where I studied and performed a cappella choral music of the Renaissance. I also attended conducting workshops at the Lucerne Festival Academy with Pierre Boulez and Rider University’s Choral Music Institute at Oxford with James Jordan and James Whitbourn. 

Quite recently, I was accepted to participate in the 4th International Sasha Mäkilä Conducting Masterclass in Mikkeli, Finland with the St. Michel Strings.

This tremendous opportunity, in Mikkeli, has the potential to raise my conducting skills to a high level while working with Finland's third oldest professional orchestra under the insightful guidance of Maestro Mäkilä. In addition to the ample podium time conducting the St. Michel Strings, the workshop takes place concurrently with the XXII Gergiev Festival Mikkeli. As participants, we will be able to observe all the rehearsals of Valery Gergiev and the Mariinsky Theatre Orchestra. Maestro Gergiev is arguably one of the world's foremost conductors working today.

The Masterclass' repertoire includes:

Barber: Adagio for Strings

Dvořák: Serenade for Strings

Mendelssohn: Concerto for Violin and Strings in D minor

Sibelius: Presto from String Quartet op. 4

Stravinsky: Concerto in D (Study Only)

Tchaikovsky: Elegy for Ivan Samarin

Turina: Oracion del Torero


To learn more about the program follow this link: 

http://www.mikkelinkaupunginorkesteri.fi/Masterclass/mikkeli.html


What I Need & What You Get

As the US Dollar is weak against the Euro, tuition is high - about $1700 - depending on the currency exchange.  To keep the budget to a minimum I have made arrangements to stay in a private home rather than a hotel and will prepare my own meals as often as possible. My traveling expenses from the United States to Europe have been taken care of and I have already purchased my music scores.

Expenses are as follows:

• Tuition: $1,700

• Train from Helsinki to Mikkeli and back: $65

• One-Way flight to Helsinki from Berlin: $165

•Subtotal = $1930

•Final Goal = $2000 (rounded down after factoring in Indiegogo fees which are 4% of the goal if the goal is met)

This workshop doesn't accept credit cards so tuition has to be paid in full with cash or wire transfer. And if my goal isn’t reached, Indiegogo takes 9% of the donations as opposed to 4% if the goal is met.  Nevertheless, any contribution would be greatly appreciated and would be helpful.

Also, please notice that your donation has a featured perk incentive, which can be selected from the column at the right!

The Impact of your donation

This is a tremendous opportunity for me to make significant strides as a conductor. Past participants have expressed how this masterclass has taught them to envision the orchestra's  palette of colors, encourage musicians through dialogue and technique and most of all, showcase the music.  This masterclass will hold a prominent distinction in my Curriculum Vitae as I apply for future musical and academic advancement. I will also establish working relationships with several outstanding world-class musicians, in the orchestra and among the participating conductors. 

This program, out of all the workshops I’ve attended, will enable me to further my career and project me one step further in fulfilling my dreams as a conductor to spread joy, hope and love through music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate and you would still like to help, you may do so by promoting my campaign by posting this link on various social networking websites like Facebook, Google +, LinkedIn, Twitter, and email.

Because I encountered Indiegogo rather late in the game, I have about 14 days to reach my goal, as it takes about three weeks for the funds to be processed and transferred and ultimately wired to Finland by June 27. Anything you can do to help will be deeply appreciated.

story:
About Me

My name is Laura Vingoe-Cram and I'm a young theatre artist from Halifax, Nova Scotia. I'm so excited to have been one of only three people accepted to the Royal Scottish Conservatoire MA in Theatre Directing program. As an international student, my fees are very high--so high, in fact, that I need to reach out for help so that I can accept this incredible opportunity.

During this one-year intensive program, I will be working with established Scottish playwrights, participating in an internship at the Globe Theatre in London, studying and directing a variety of texts, and developing valuable skills in voice and movement. I might even learn to understand the Glaswegian accent! 

You can learn more about the program here:

http://www.rcs.ac.uk/postgraduate/ma-classical-contemporary-text.


Your donation to my campaign will help me to study and make connections with some of the greatest theatrical minds in the United Kingdom, and help me become an international theatre director. 

 What I Need
I am asking for $7,000 Canadian dollars which works out to be a little over  3500 pounds sterling. This money will help me pay about a quarter of my tuition costs of $31,000 (not including living expenses).  I've already been awarded a scholarship of $5,000 from the Conservatoire and I'll be applying for a student loan from the Nova Scotia government and grants from various sources, and getting some family help.

What You Get

Premium Donation

What could be interesting about giving a director money? Why, having something directed for you of course! If you donate $500.00 or more, you will receive in your Dropbox a short theatrical film that uses a text of your choice. This could be your favorite poem, a scene from a novel or play, a scholarly article, you name it!

Incredibly Helpful Donation

Every donation of $10 or more gets you a bi-monthly newsletter about everything I am up to in Glasgow (including pictures!). Don't worry, I'll keep things short and sweet.

Every little bit helps.

A Bit More About Me. 
I have been involved in theatre my whole life and I have been directing productions for the last four years. During my undergrad years at the University of King's College in Halifax, I had the opportunity to direct large scale productions as well as to produce and perform. After graduating, I continued to make theatre by starting a theatre company and directing for the Atlantic Fringe festival in Halifax. A few months ago, I decided to pursue my dream of moving to the United Kingdom and studying theatre. For the last five months I have been living and working in London and seeing theatre productions every chance I get.

Currently, I am directing Gill Clark's play Understudy for two nights of one-acts at the Courtyard Theatre in Hoxton, North London. Dates: July 25th, 26th, 2014.

If you are interested in seeing my directing resume and portfolio, please check out my linkedin profile at the link below.

https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=280965342&trk=nav_responsive_tab_profile_pic

I'm Broke So How Can I Help?

Please share this Campaign with your friends and family and help me spread the word!

story:
AIESEC Miami is an FIU-based student organization which is a local committee working under AIESEC, the world's largest student-run non-profit. Present in 126 countries, we provide opportunities for students around the world to develop professionally and as leaders. We do this through our exchange programs that we offer to students from all majors from any university which can truly make an impact on their lives and give them an experience abroad unlike any other, be it through an internship or volunteering.

In order for AIESEC Miami to do this, however, our local committee must have the best executive board leading it. From December 30, 2014 to January 5, 2015, AIESEC United States will be hosting our Winter National Conference in Dallas, TX, where members from all over the US will gather to share their knowledge and ideas and where all the new incoming eboards will gain the knowledge and learn about the tools which will allow our local committees to perform as efficiently as possible for the  2015 year.

We need your help in order to cover the individual costs for our eboard members to be able to go to this very important conference. Your contribution would go towards financing the delegate fee that each member attending must pay, which is $350, and the average cost of a round-trip flight to Dallas, TX, which is around $200, making it $550 per eboard member, though $450 per member is the least we ask for. Multiply $450 by 9, which is the amount of people that conform our eboard, and it totals to around $4000. If we reach this goal, we will all be able to afford to attend this very important conference from which our eboard will gain the experience to lead our local committee reach unprecedented levels of success for the 2015 year, allowing us to provide more life-changing experiences to our student community, both within and outside the US. Thank you!

story:
#30Days of ThanksgivingLO  

You may not know this about me, but I had the AMAZING opportunity to go through a program called Legal Outreach in high school. Legal Outreach works with students from underserved neighborhoods around NYC and prepares them to succeed in high school, college, and beyond.  

I'm fundraising this November to make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach.  

My Story  

My name is Janel Ridley and I grew up in an underserved neighborhood in New York City.

Because of Legal Outreach, I was encouraged to apply to colleges and attended Brandeis University. LO supported me beginning in 8th grade, and I left LO four years later inspired and equipped for college. 

Your support can change the lives of more students like me!

Your Support Will... 

Make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach for four years of free programming, including a debate program, SAT prep, writing classes, mentoring, college application workshops, and much more! 

Of the students LO supports: 

  • 100% graduated HS on time (only 66% of NYC public school students do) 
  • 99% went on to colleges and universities 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Donate to my campaign before December 2nd, 2014 
  • Share my campaign on social media 
  • Encourage your networks to support my campaign 

I'm thankful for LO and I'm thankful for your support!  

#30DaysofThanksgivingLO
www.legaloutreach.org
www.facebook.com/legaloutreach
@legaloutreach

story:
Why Bosnia? Why the youth of Mostar?

Dilia Zwart, Freya Nowell, and Sho Igawa have volunteered with youth projects in Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH) for a number of years. Their experiences with young people in BiH have inspired them to give back and develop an innovative model of youth empowerment.

BiH has an overall unemployment rate of over 40%. The youth unemployment rate is even higher, at 60%, one of the most severe in the world. Furthermore, the education system remains outdated and does not stimulate critical and creative thinking. This harmful combination means that BiH suffers from acute brain drain. Who will stay to rebuild and revitalize the country, when people struggle to make a basic living?

In 2014, with vital support from Our Kids (Naša Djeca) Foundation*, the team launched the Mostar Summer Youth Programme (MSYP) to empower the youth of Mostar and the surrounding areas. It was a resounding success in its inaugural year. (View photos from MSYP 2014 here.)

The programme offers English language courses as well as workshops and activities for the youth to connect with leaders of local organizations and businesses. MSYP also enables social opportunities for youth from all corners of the city to form friendships.

In 2014, MSYP was generously supported by Davis Projects for Peace, but this initial grant is not sufficient to increase the impact of the programme in 2015. Moreover, with international funding priorities no longer including BiH, MSYP needs your help via this campaign. You are helping a social initiative develop in a place where capital is extremely hard to obtain.

Last but not least, MSYP is staffed entirely by local and international volunteers, so by donating you are contributing directly to the programming for students.

What We Need & What You Get

How your money will be well-spent

In 2014, MSYP needed more than $5,000 to operate.

With $3,000 in donations, MSYP can run basic operations in 2015 without scaling up from 2014.

With $5,000, MSYP can scale up from 40 students in 2014 to 80+ students in 2015.

With $10,000, MSYP can plan ahead and plan bigger, with even more diverse workshops, activities, and educational/volunteer trips. Half of these funds will be put aside for MSYP 2016, achieving increased sustainability for the programme.

Rewards

$10 - Receive a detailed update email in spring 2014 about how MSYP 2015 is shaping up.

$50 - The above, plus receive a certificate of appreciation to remind you of the impact you helped deliver.

$100 - The above, plus be included in a “Photo Collage of Donors” centrally displayed for all the students to see during MSYP 2015. 

$250  - The above, plus be listed on the MSYP website as a donor. (You may also remain anonymous if you wish.)

$500 - The above, plus be mentioned as a large donor during the MSYP 2015 closing ceremony formal address.

Please note: If the smallest crowdfunding goal of $3,000 is not reached, MSYP can still benefit from your support, but will scale down its plans for summer 2015. In such a case, MSYP will still conduct English language courses, but with much smaller-scale workshops and activities.

The Impact A programme in Mostar like no other

MSYP creates a unique and friendly environment in which young people from the Mostar area can enjoy integrated educational and social experiences. The programme aspires to have a long-term impact by demonstrating a successful, alternative model of education to young people in BiH; one based on multiculturalism, creativity, discussion, debate, critical thinking, and leadership.

The programme also stimulates young people to think about their future careers and personal development through informative and engaging workshops conducted in conjunction with MSYP's organizational partners (see below).

Ultimately, MSYP hopes that it will inspire similar programs in other parts of BiH and the Balkans. More opportunities for young people are key to the stability and prosperity of the country and region.

Risks & Challenges

In 2014, MSYP was graciously supported by the facilities of many organizational partners in Mostar for no charge. While most partners are willing to support MSYP as much as they can in 2015, their needs are subject to change. If some partners are forced to circumscribe their support, MSYP's low operational costs may be affected. In such a scenario, MSYP will work hard to look for other free or inexpensive facilities to realize the programme at low cost.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate yourself, it would still be so helpful if you could spread the word via email, social media, word of mouth, etc. The more awareness MSYP receives, the higher chance of it becoming financially sustainable!

Please let the team know if you have any questions about this campaign. They will be sure to answer them in a timely manner.

*In fall 2014, the Mostar Summer Youth Programme was incorporated as an educational initiative of Our Kids (Naša Djeca) Foundation, a grassroots nonprofit in BiH.

story:
Volunteer Work in Costa Rica

I will be spending eight weeks volunteering in Costa Rica, collaborating with a local community to promote environmental stewardship in national parks and rural areas of Costa Rica. 

The project in Costa Rica is program of Amigos de las Américas (AMIGOS), a non-profit organization that trains high-school and college age participants to carry out youth leadership, public health, and community development projects.

AMIGOS is partnered with Casa de la Juventud (CASA), who have organized youth in Perez Zeledon through informal and formal educational activities for over 20 years.  They began collaborating with AMIGOS in 2004 and in 2012 co-launched the national park program, piloting the model as it currently stands. This project is truly co-led by Amigos and CASA staff - the level of integration and unity of the two organizations is inspiring and and unparalleled!


Where the Money Goes 

The funding goes directly to AMIGOS to support community projects like the one I will be working on.  It is a non-profit donation and is tax-deductible in the United States. The support that AMIGOS can provide is entirely based on the funds they receive.  To give an idea of the financial impact of your donation:

$45 provides one water storage tank to ensure a family has safe drinking water $100 purchases cement and other necessary supplies, to construct four latrines $150 buys 100 fruit trees for family nutrition and reforestation 
$300 supports 100 family gardens
$350 provides a Leadership Workshop for Latin American and AMIGOS volunteers $500 buys training materials for 20 volunteers, or a playground for one community

story:
August 3, 2015

Dear friend of RMCS,

Red Mountain Community School  is getting a little too big for its britches and needs to “let out a few seams.”  Will you help? While “thinking little” is part of our DNA and we love the coziness of having each other near,  we are only a few students away from our ideal of a 70 member learning community and our growing high school (10 this fall!) means a few alterations are in order! 

We delight in being a frugal school. We like to think we can “stretch a dollar" as well as we can stretch a child’s life.  We hope our unassuming and careful ways of running a school within a very modest overhead and without onerous fundraising for our families has hopeful and restorative repercussions. As RMCS enters its 11thyear in Avondale we feel quite confident that we are well on our way to becoming this local sign and symbol of Charlotte Mason’s claim that “all important things are simple.”

And a rather simple solution to our tightness comes in the discovery of some unloved space very, very close to us. This space is attached to our current space and would allow us to stay closely knit together while adding some breathing room.  We would be so happy to rent it.  Just think of the things we could do with these rooms……

1.  Practice School could have their own space.  (Practice School is our one day a week immersion for neighborhood homeschoolers.)

2.  Art classes could have their own studio and students could leave their projects out from week to week.  And maybe we could open a Homecraft Studio as well?!  Sewing machines, woodworking, a kiln, a loom?!

3.  After school care would have a new place to roam.

4.  People who have some after school classes to offer could have some private rooms for lessons.

5.  And most importantly,  our High Schoolers could enjoy a sense of being ‘set apart’ just a titch and have room to spread their wings and fly.  Each of our three high school teachers could have their own classrooms instead of sharing space.

 If  100 of our friends, past, present and future(?!) contribute $40 through this “fund us” project,  we could be living this dream this coming year.  If we exceed this amount the additional funds will be used to update/furnish the space or put in reserve for next year’s rent line.

We love being a part of the living and learning in this little corner of the world.  Thank you for helping us make room to grow!

Warmly,

Melanie Walker-Malone for all of us at RMCS


P. S.  All contributions to RMCS are tax-deductible!

story:
In breve

Il nostro progetto prevede l'apertura di un Centro Scientifico Culturale a Verona (vicino al casello autostradale di Verona Sud e agli svincoli della tangenziale) dove poter proporre le nostre attività:
  • attività per le scuole: con lezioni frontali, laboratori didattici, presentazioni nel planetario e osservazione del Sole con telescopi dedicati
  • attività dopo scuola: studio assistito, ripetizioni e attività ludico didattiche
  • attività per il pubblico: eventi a tema, presentazioni nel planetario, corsi, conferenze, mostre, laboratori, serate osservative con telescopi.
  • attività a distanza: creazione di corsi online su piattaforma di elearning, consulenza su varie materie, tutoring

Il centro sarà costituito da:

  • sala conferenze da 90 posti
  • sala laboratorio / studio assistito /corsi
  • area per mostre ed attività estemporanee
  • area planetario con cupola da 8.66 metri di diametro e 60 posti a sedere all'interno


Cosa abbiamo e di cosa abbiamo bisogno

In nostro possesso abbiamo già l'attrezzatura per lavorare:

  • cupola da 8.66 metri e sistema di proiezione
  • telescopi
  • proiettore per la sala conferenze
  • materiale didattico
  • sistemi di ripresa per video corsi e streaming
  • la struttura in cui aprire il centro (verrà presa in affitto)

Per rendere questo sogno realtà abbiamo però bisogno dell'ultima spinta:

  • arredamento
  • pareti di cartongesso e scala
  • materiale pubblicitario
  • impianto di riscaldamento
  • materiale di consumo

Secondo le stime, l'importo da raccogliere è di circa 50.000€.


Sogno nel cassetto

Oltre alla cupola da 8.66 metri che rimarrà in pianta semi-permanente all'interno del centro, abbiamo anche una cupola più piccola da 5 metri di diametro che utilizziamo e continueremo ad utilizzare per andare direttamente nelle scuole. Se dovessimo superare l'importo stimato, andremo ad investire l'eventuale rimanenza nell'acquisto di un ulteriore strumento da utilizzare con una di queste cupole, in modo da avere la possibilità sempre di utilizzare i planetari in contemporanea.

Per ulteriori dettagli potete visitare il nostro sito relativo al progetto:
progetti.empiricamente.info, scrivere a progetti@empiricamente.info o contattarci al numero +39 3894474389

story:
KIDS CLIMB FOR NEPAL

The climbing kids in Albury, NSW want to help the people of Nepal, so I have set them a climbing challenge. I am hoping that you can support them as they scale the great heights of Albury Indoor Climbing Centre to help those in need.

The scale of the devastation following the Nepal earthquakes is enormous and the people need our ongoing support. People have lost their loved ones, with the death toll over 8500 and some 20,000 injured, houses reduced to rubble with entire villages flattened and 100,000’s made homeless. With ongoing aftershocks, the heavy monsoon rain, lack of shelter and the threat of further landslides and disease, people are living in fear and uncertainty about what the future will bring. It is impossible to imagine the deep psychological effects these devastating events are having on those affected and how this has impacted their mental health.

The spirit of Nepal and its air of mysticism captures your heart like nowhere else. It may be one of the world’s poorest countries, but within the people, their culture, the mountains… there lies a richness that no amount of money can rival. I have never encountered such truly happy, infectious smiles amongst a nation. I want to give something back to a country that has given so much to me & many others.

My name is Lisa Exley. My desire to help and support Nepal in their time of great need is strong and the kids at my local indoor climbing centre in Albury, NSW also want to help.  So with the support of Chris Brown at Albury Climbing Centre I have set the kids an exciting challenge.  On Saturday 13th June I have challenged the kids to climb as many indoor routes as possible within a 3 hour time period. This is a test of their resilience, endurance, determination, perseverance, courage……traits which reflect those of our Nepalese neighbours.  These traits, along with our help will enable the people of Nepal to rebuild their lives.

Through this Indiegogo campaign I hope to raise funds for the Australian Himalayan Foundation (AHF), a well respected, not for profit charitable organisation who for a number of years have had ongoing projects in Nepal focusing on health, education and conservation. The AHF sent a disaster recovery team into the area it works, and the team provided relief & medical aid, delivery of tarps, and assistance to those who were most in need, particularly in the communities where they have been assisting for many years. They have also reported damage to many of the schools they support in the lower Solu Khumbu region. Temporary classrooms are being used to make sure the education they support is ongoing. Getting the children back to learning can be one powerful means of helping to heal their emotional scars. Children in crisis benefit from the sense of normalcy provided by continued education. The process of rebuilding will be a long term project. Any excess funds that remain after the immediate emergency response period will go into the long term restoration of the communities in which the AHF work. Your donation will go towards helping children, families and schools in hundreds of communities.

I am asking everyone who sees this campaign to please give. Give by donating what you would normally spend on a cuppa this morning. I appreciate that not everyone is in a position to give and many people have already generously donated. If you can’t, then please give by sharing this campaign. Share it on facebook, twitter, email, word of mouth, at schools, community centres etc

Awareness is vital to make change happen.

THANK YOU so much for supporting our awesome kids in their “Climb for Nepal”. Every donation, no matter how small, makes a difference. Let us help to bring back those happy, infectious smiles of the beautiful Nepalese people.
story_txt:
KIDS CLIMB FOR NEPAL

The climbing kids in
Albury, NSW want to help the people of Nepal, so I have set them a climbing
challenge. I am hoping that you can support them as they scale the great
heights of Albury Indoor Climbing Centre to help those in need.

The scale of
the devastation following the Nepal earthquakes is enormous and the people need
our ongoing support. People have lost
their loved ones, with the death toll over 8500 and some 20,000 injured, houses
reduced to rubble with entire villages flattened and 100,000’s made homeless. With
ongoing aftershocks, the heavy monsoon rain, lack of shelter and the threat of
further landslides and disease, people are living in fear and uncertainty about
what the future will bring. It is impossible to imagine the deep psychological
effects these devastating events are having on those affected and how this has
impacted their mental health.
The spirit of Nepal and its air of mysticism
captures your heart like nowhere else. It may be one of the world’s poorest countries,
but within the people, their culture, the mountains… there lies a richness that
no amount of money can rival. I have never encountered such truly happy,
infectious smiles amongst a nation. I want to give something back to a country
that has given so much to me & many others.
My name is
Lisa Exley. My desire to help and
support Nepal in their time of great need is strong and the kids at my local
indoor climbing centre in Albury, NSW also want to help.  So with the support of Chris Brown at Albury
Climbing Centre I have set the kids an exciting challenge.  On Saturday 13th June I have
challenged the kids to climb as many indoor routes as possible within a 3 hour
time period. This is a test of their
resilience, endurance, determination, perseverance, courage……traits which
reflect those of our Nepalese neighbours. 
These traits, along with our help will enable the people of Nepal to
rebuild their lives.
Through this
Indiegogo campaign I hope to raise funds for the Australian Himalayan
Foundation (AHF), a well respected, not for profit charitable organisation who
for a number of years have had ongoing projects in Nepal focusing on health,
education and conservation. The AHF sent a disaster recovery team into the area
it works, and the team provided relief & medical aid, delivery of tarps,
and assistance to those who were most in need, particularly in the communities
where they have been assisting for many years. They have also reported damage
to many of the schools they support in the lower Solu Khumbu region. Temporary
classrooms are being used to make sure the education they support is ongoing. Getting
the children back to learning can be one powerful means of helping to heal
their emotional scars. Children in crisis benefit from the sense of normalcy provided
by continued education. The process of rebuilding will be a long term project.
Any excess funds that remain after the immediate emergency response period will
go into the long term restoration of the communities in which the AHF work.
Your donation will go towards helping children, families and schools in
hundreds of communities.
I am asking
everyone who sees this campaign to please give. Give by donating what you would
normally spend on a cuppa this morning. I appreciate that not everyone is in a
position to give and many people have already generously donated. If you can’t,
then please give by sharing this campaign. Share it on facebook, twitter,
email, word of mouth, at schools, community centres etc
Awareness is
vital to make change happen.
THANK YOU so
much for supporting our awesome kids in their “Climb for Nepal”. Every
donation, no matter how small, makes a difference. Let us help to bring back
those happy, infectious smiles of the beautiful Nepalese people.

story:
Help us so that more children, youth and rural communities join through art to protect the rivers, moors, and water sources.

In the town of Mongua in celebration of the first Festival Art - Water and Earth more than 600 children especially in rural areas, with farmers' organizations, raised their voices to express the effects of mining and involvement in the moors and sources water generated in recent times. In neighboring municipalities the social and environmental impacts due to the exploitation of oil, coal, lime, sand are incalculable.

The festival Art - Water and Earth is designed as an educational space for integration and participation artistic - cultural serves as esccenario for the children, youth and peasant communities are responsible for their own social and environmental transformation.

With your support, you will be contributing:

1). To raise their voices in favor of saving the moors and water sources and mitigate the environmental damage caused by the exploitation of minerals, using art as a means of expression that generates awareness of the impact of social policies and the conflicts generated because of these.

2). Promote art as dance, song, the story, the local history, cuisine with contents that make visible their lifestyles around water and land conflicts and sustainable alternatives in resistance to the actions and policies of expansionist governments.

3). Given the problems of displacement and migration of the young, it will promote leadership and empowerments of children, youth and peasant communities in defense of natural resources and water sources. And spread environmental awareness in communities with the greatest extent of moorland in the country.

4) · You can help to transform the vision of a child or young person which future is predestined to a coal mine risking their lives and health to the detriment of the environment and culture, _ contribute with it is priceless. For the festival we can help guide their talent through art or healthy and productive activities _ leveraging in diferent ways the natural resources of their environment.

5) · With your support, you are helping to strengthen projects micro business and productive to contribute to food security of families and serve as a model for others in such a way that a socially and environmentally sustainable culture is promoted and reduce poverty gaps and food insecurity in rural communities.

brief review

We are a non-profit foundation that develops initiatives of human and environmental development in Boyacá Department of Colombia.

Boyacá is a department has the largest moorland of the country; worried about the growing problems of deterioration in the moors and pollution of rivers and water sources that affects the access to drinking water for both domestic consumption and for food production in several municipalities in the last year started an educational campaign to generate environmental awareness in the region.

The development model of recent governments in the country is focused on a policy called "mining engine" and "investor confidence" which seeks to provide grants to entrepreneurs and multinationals to exploit minerals regardless of environmental and social involvement. Boyacá department was farming, and one of the best in food production. Now with these policies nearly 50% of families have problems of food insecurity, and the rates says that the child population suffer from chronic malnutrition. Families no longer produce food and have dedicated themselves to subsist on mineral exploitation to the detriment of their health, culture, environmental degradation and social equity.

With the initiative of Water and Land Art Festival is expected to include a 5 municipalities in the region, which is designed as a pedagogical and popular strategy for environmental education through art that seeks to create an awareness of this reality, where children, youth and adults and various institutions and rural communities to express their views on the various conflicts, as well as an exchange of knowledge and expertise about social experiences and environmentally sustainable.

What we need and what you get

To make the festival in the 5 municipalities we need 61,280 dollars, which are intended to cover the following expenses for the three phases of organzación, promotion and realization of the festival are required:

1. Qualifying organization.

2. Promotion and dissemination phase.

3. Realization phase.

. 1 plans in the organization phase the following activities and costs: Total cost of Phase 1 organization. = 36,281 dollars.

1.1. Organization and general coordination with 3 activists responsible for the 5 municipalities (municipalities Nobsa, Tópaga, Corrales, Mongua and Sogamoso) for 6 months. At a cost of $ 20,256 which will be used for travel expenses (transportation, meals and lodging) and training and support artistic groups or niches - cultural venues:

- Field visits and call aimed at primary schools and high schools, community and farmer organizations, NGOs. Universities.

- Registry of artistic and cultural base groups : children and youth, communities and public and private organizations interested in participating.

- Strengthening and training to groups and initiatives.

Training and capacity ** in artistic instruction to 15 groups or cultural artistic initiatives on children and youth (dances. song, photography and storytelling) / 3 per municipality. The funds will go to strengthen the training and artistic statement with ecological and cultural content. This activity has a cost of 8,974 dollars for the 5 municipalities

** Strengthening technical capacity directed a 15 agri-food and craft sets with peasant / 3 per municipality. The funds will go to strengthen the technical and organizational training and procurement of necessary utensils and logistics. Cost of the activity. 7,051 Dollars.

- Coordination and implementation of local meetings, tests and previous training.

2. PHASE OF PROMOTION AND DISCLOSURE. Which has a total cost of: 7,051.

Advertising through various media at local and regional level. 7,051 Dollars are required.

· Print Advertisement (print ads, brochures, posters) with topics relating to the subject matter Festival.

· Advertising Radial. 20 local and regional radio programs for 6 months with environmental content.

· Production of 6 Television programs related to environmental issues. 6 Local Programs in 6 months.

· Using the Internet and social networks.

3. PHASE OF REALIZATION. Phase 3 of realization has a total cost of: 17,948 Dollars.

3.1. Support transportation and food to rural and farming communities in the 5 Municipalities to participate. Required 6,410 Dollars.

3.2. Conducting contests to strengthen and encourage the participation of artistic groups and agri-food base groups require support to logistics and awards. 7,692 Dollars are Required:

3.3. Academic Day with universities and public and private organizations with issues in ecology and biodiversity, impact of public policies on mining and sustainable alternatives. The funds will be used for logistics and travel and professional fees and personnel specialized in relevant subjects. Cost of this activity 3,846 Dollars.

If we do not reach the goal

if we reach not meet the goal of USD 61,280 to include at least 5 municipalities in the region, we would have to reduce the number of municipalities, therefore, the productive and artisctic groups to participate. With your help we can generate social and environmental transformation we need. Our children, youth, peasant communities and the planet will thank you.

impact

Education is the best way to help transform lives and society in general. We conducted a festival in the town of Mongua - Boyacá with a very positive and favorable impact on communities and the environment in which we integrate about 600 children and young people in rural and urban educational institutions and more than 32 public organizations, private and local and regional farmers.

With your help

· You'll be helping to save the largest area of moorland is at risk in the department of Boyacá. and create greater environmental awareness in society.

. You'll be promoting the talents and artistic skills in our children and youth to demonstrate and utilize for an environmentally sustainable culture in resistance to the policies and actions of governments.

· The festival is an alternative that promotes ecotourism and cultural identity in the locals, which is essential for the empowerment of youth and rural sectors. For this potential has been wasted due to cultural rootlessness in the base communities.

· You can help to transform the vision of a child or young person which future is predestined to a coal mine risking their lives and health to the detriment of the environment, _ contribute with it is priceless. For through the festival we can help guide their talent through art or healthy and productive activities _ leveraging in diferent ways natural resources around them.

· We can generate greater awareness in communities, generations of children, youth and the general public about the need to protect and conserve the moors, rivers and water sources that are at high risk of contamination.

· With your support, you are helping to strengthen projects micro business and productive to contribute to food security of families and serve as a model for promoting a socially and environmentally sustainable culture and reduce gaps in poverty and food insecurity in rural communities.

Other ways you can help

You can also help to spread it through your social networking contacts with which you will be contributing significantly to make this dream a reality.

_____________

Ayudanos para que a través del arte mas niños, niñas,  jovenes y comunidades campesinas se unan a favor del salvaguardar nuestros páramos y fuentes hídricas. 

En el municipio de Mongua en la celebración del primer Festival Arte - Agua y Tierra  más de 600 niños y niñas especialmente del sector rural, junto a organizaciones campesinas, elevaron sus voces para expresar los efectos de la explotación minera y afectación en los páramos y fuentes hídricas generadas en los últimos tiempos.  En los municipios aledaños son incalculables los impactos sociales y ambientales a causa de la explotación de petróleo, carbón, cal, arena.   

El festival Arte - Agua y Tierra está concebido como un espacio pedagógico de integración y participación artístico - cultural que sirve como esccenario para que los  los niños, niñas, jóvenes y comunidades campesinas sean protagonistas de su propia transformación social y ambiental. 

Con tu apoyo estarás contribuyendo: 

1). A elevar sus voces a favor de salvar los páramos y fuentes hídricas y  mitigar los daños ambientales generados por la explotación de minerales, utilizando el arte como medio de expresión que genere conciencia social del impacto de las políticas y los conflictos generados a causa de estas. 

2). Promover el arte como la danza, la copla, el cuento, la historia autóctona, la gastronomía con contenidos que visibilizan sus formas de vida en torno al agua y la tierra, sus conflictos y alternativas sostenibles en resistencia a las acciones y políticas de los gobernos expansionistas.  

3).  Ante los poblemas de desarraigo y migración de los jovenes, se estará fomentando el liderazgo y el empoderamientos de niños, niñas, jóvenes y comunidades campesinas en defensa de los recursos naturales y fuentes hídricas. Y a difundir una conciencia ambiental en las comunidades con mayor extensión de páramos del país.  

4)·  Tu puedes ayudar a transformar la visión de un niño o un joven en el que su futuro está predestinado a una mina de carbón arriesgando su vida y su salud en detrimento del medio ambiente y su cultura, Contribuir con ello no tiene precio. Pues con el festival podemos ayudarlo a orientar su talento a través del arte o actividades saludables y productivas aprovechando de manera diferente los recursos naturales de su entorno.

5)·  Con tu apoyo estarás ayudando a fortalecer proyectos micro empresariales y productivos que aporten a la seguridad alimentaria de las familias y que sirvan como modelo para otros, de tal suerte que se promueva una cultura social y ambientalmente sostenible y a reducir brechas de pobreza e inseguridad alimentaria en las comunidades campesinas.


 Breve reseña

Somos una fundación sin ánimo de lucro que desarrolla iniciativas de desarrollo humano y ambiental  en Departamento de Boyacá Colombia.

Boyacá es el departamento con mayor extensión de páramos del país; preocupados por los crecientes problemas de deterioro en los páramos y contaminación de los ríos y fuentes hídricas que afecta el acceso al agua potable tanto para el consumo doméstico como para la producción de alimentos en varios municipios, durante el último año  iniciamos una campaña pedagógica que genere conciencia ambiental en la región. 

El modelo de desarrollo de los últimos gobiernos en el país se encuentra enfocado a una política denominada “locomotora minera” y “confianza inversionista” que busca entregar concesiones a empresarios y multinacionales para la explotación de minerales sin tener en cuenta la afectación ambiental y social. Boyacá era un departamento de vocación agrícola y uno de los mejores en producción de alimentos.  Ahora con estas políticas cerca del 50 % de las familias presentan problemas de inseguridad alimentaria, y los indicadores señalan que la población infantil presenta desnutrición crónica. Las familias han dejado de producir alimentos y se han dedicado a subsistir de la explotación de minerales en detrimento de su salud, su cultura, el deterioro ambiental y la equidad social.

Con la iniciativa del Festival Arte Agua y Tierra que se espera incluir a 5 municipios de la región, el cual está concebido como una  estrategia pedagógica de educación ambiental y popular, que a través del arte busca generar una conciencia de esta realidad, en donde los niños, niñas, jóvenes y adultos y diferentes instituciones y comunidades campesinas expresen sus miradas sobre los diversos conflictos existentes, así como un intercambio de saberes y conocimientos acerca de experiencias sociales y ambientalmente sostenibles. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Para poder realizar el festival  focalizado en 5 municipios se necesita 61.280 Dólares, los cuales estarán destinados a cubrir los siguientes gastos para las tres fases del proceso de organzación, promoción y realización del festival:

1. Fase de organización.

2. Fase de promoción y divulgación.

3. Fase de realización. 

1. En la FASE DE ORGANIZACIÓN se tiene previsto las siguientes actividades y costos:   Total costo Fase 1 de organización. =  36.281 Dólares.

 1.1.  Organización y coordinación general con 3 activistas a cargo para los 5 municipios (municipios de Nobsa, Tópaga, Corrales, Tota y Sogamoso) durante 6 meses.  Con un costo de 20.256. Dólares los cuales serán utilizados para gastos de viáticos (transportes, alimentación y hospedajes) y fortalecimiento y apoyo a nichos o grupos artístico - culturales  locales: 

- Visitas de campo y convocatoria dirigida a colegios de primaria y bachillerato, organizaciones comunitarias y campesinas, organizaciones gubernamentales. Universidades. 

- Registro de inventarios artístico-culturales y organización de grupos de base: niños, niñas y jovenes.  Comunidades y organizaciones públicas y privadas interesadas en participar. 

- Fortalecimiento y capacitación a grupos e iniciativas locales.  

  **  Capacitación y fortalecimiento en instrucción artística dirigida a 15 Grupos o iniciativas Artístico culturales en niñ@s y jóvenes (danza. copla, fotografía y cuentearía) / 3 por municipio. Los recursos irán destinados a fortalecer  la capacitación e instrucción artística con contenido ecológico y cultural.  Esta actividad tiene un costo de 8.974 Dólares para los 5 municipios

  **  Fortalecimiento de la capacidad técnica dirigida a 15 Grupos agroalimentarios y artesanales con comunidades campesinas / 3 por municipio. Los recursos irán destinados a fortalecer la capacitación técnica y organizativa y la adquisición de utensilios y logística necesarios.  Costo de la actividad. 7.051 Dólares .

- Coordinación y realización de encuentros locales, ensayos y capacitaciones previas.


2. FASE DE PROMOCIÓN Y DIVULGACIÓN. La cual tiene un costo total de: 7.051. 

 Publicidad a través de distintos medios de comunicación a nivel local y regional. Requeridos 7.051 Dólares así.

    · Publicidad Impresa (anuncios en prensa, folletos informativos, afiches) con temáticas referidas al objeto del Festival. 

    · Publicidad Radial. 20 Programas radiales locales y regionales durante 6 meses con contenido ambiental.

    · Producción de 6 programas Televisivos referidos a medio ambientales . 6 Programas locales en 6 meses.

    · A través de Internet y redes sociales. 


3.  FASE DE REALIZACIÓN.  La fase 3 de realización tiene un costo total de: 17.948 Dólares.  

3.1.  Apoyo en transporte y alimentación a sectores rurales y comunidades campesinas de los 5 municipios a participar.    Requeridos  6.410 Dólares.

3.2.  Realización de concursos para fortalecer y motivar la participación de grupos de base artísticos y agroalimentarios requieren apoyo para logística y premiación. Requeridos 7.692 Dólares así: 

3.5.  Jornada Académica a cargo de Organizaciones públicas y privadas y universidades dirigida a comunidades campesinas y juventudes de la región con temáticas en ecología y biodiversidad, la incidencia de políticas públicas de explotación minera y alternativas sostenibles. Los recursos serán destinados a logística y viáticos y honorarios de  personal profesional y especializados en temas pertinentes.  Costo de esta actividad 3.846 Dólares. 


Si no llegamos a la meta

si no alcalzamos a cumplir con la meta de los USD 61.280 para  incluir a mínimo 5 municipios de la región, nos veriamos obligados a disminuir el número de municipios, por tanto grupos de artes y productivos que participarían.  Con tu ayuda podemos generar la transformación social y ambiental que tanto necesitamos.  Nuestro niñ@s, jóvenes, comunidades campesinas y el planeta te lo agradecerán.  

El impacto

La educación es la mejor manera de ayudar a transformar vidas y la sociedad en general.  Hemos realizado un festival en el Municipio de Mongua - Boyacá con un impacto muy positivo y favorable para las comunidades y el medio ambiente, en el que logramos integrar cerca de 600 niñ@s y jóvenes de Instituciones educativas rurales y urbanas y mas de 32 organizaciones públicas, privadas y campesinas locales y regionales. 

Con tu ayuda

· Estarás contribuyendo a salvar la zona de mayor extensión de páramos que se encuentra en riesgo en el departamento de Boyacá. y a crear una mayor conciencia ambiental en la sociedad.   

. Estarás promoviendo los talentos y habilidades artísticas en nuestros niñ@s y jóvenes que utilizaran para manifestarse y a favor de una cultura ambientalmente sostenible en resistencia a las políticas y acciones de los gobiernos expansionistas.

·  El festival es una alternativa que promueve el ecoturismo y la identidad cultural en los lugareños, para lo cual es fundamental el empoderamiento de los sectores juveniles y campesinos. Pues este potencial se ha desperdiciado debido al desarraigo cultural en las comunidades de base.

·  Tu puedes ayudar a transformar la visión de un niño o un joven en el que su futuro está predestinado a una mina de carbón arriesgando su vida y su salud en detrimento del medio ambiente, Contribuir con ello no tiene precio. Pues a través del festival podemos ayudarlo a orientar su talento a través del arte o actividades saludables y productivas aprovechando de manera diferente los recursos naturales de su entorno.

·  Podemos generar una mayor conciencia en las comunidades, las generaciones de niños, jóvenes y la sociedad en general a cerca de la necesidad de proteger y conservar los páramos, los ríos y las fuentes hídricas que se encuentran en alto riesgo de contaminación.

·  Con tu apoyo estarás ayudando a fortalecer proyectos micro empresariales y productivos que aporten a la seguridad alimentaria de las familias y que sirvan como modelo para otros, de tal suerte que se promueva una cultura social y ambientalmente sostenible y a reducir brechas de pobreza e inseguridad alimentaria en las comunidades campesinas.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Tambien puedes ayudarme a difundirlo a través de tus contactos en redes sociales con lo cual estarás aportando significativamente a que este sueño se haga realidad.
