For this potential has been wasted due to cultural rootlessness in the base communities.· You can help to transform the vision of a child or young person which future is predestined to a coal mine risking their lives and health to the detriment of the environment, _ contribute with it is priceless. For through the festival we can help guide their talent through art or healthy and productive activities _ leveraging in diferent ways natural resources around them.· We can generate greater awareness in communities, generations of children, youth and the general public about the need to protect and conserve the moors, rivers and water sources that are at high risk of contamination.· With your support, you are helping to strengthen projects micro business and productive to contribute to food security of families and serve as a model for promoting a socially and environmentally sustainable culture and reduce gaps in poverty and food insecurity in rural communities.Other ways you can helpYou can also help to spread it through your social networking contacts with which you will be contributing significantly to make this dream a reality._____________Ayudanos para que a través del arte mas niños, niñas,  jovenes y comunidades campesinas se unan a favor del salvaguardar nuestros páramos y fuentes hídricas. En el municipio de Mongua en la celebración del primer Festival Arte - Agua y Tierra  más de 600 niños y niñas especialmente del sector rural, junto a organizaciones campesinas, elevaron sus voces para expresar los efectos de la explotación minera y afectación en los páramos y fuentes hídricas generadas en los últimos tiempos.  En los municipios aledaños son incalculables los impactos sociales y ambientales a causa de la explotación de petróleo, carbón, cal, arena.   El festival Arte - Agua y Tierra está concebido como un espacio pedagógico de integración y participación artístico - cultural que sirve como esccenario para que los  los niños, niñas, jóvenes y comunidades campesinas sean protagonistas de su propia transformación social y ambiental. Con tu apoyo estarás contribuyendo: 1). A elevar sus voces a favor de salvar los páramos y fuentes hídricas y  mitigar los daños ambientales generados por la explotación de minerales, utilizando el arte como medio de expresión que genere conciencia social del impacto de las políticas y los conflictos generados a causa de estas. 2). Promover el arte como la danza, la copla, el cuento, la historia autóctona, la gastronomía con contenidos que visibilizan sus formas de vida en torno al agua y la tierra, sus conflictos y alternativas sostenibles en resistencia a las acciones y políticas de los gobernos expansionistas.  3).  Ante los poblemas de desarraigo y migración de los jovenes, se estará fomentando el liderazgo y el empoderamientos de niños, niñas, jóvenes y comunidades campesinas en defensa de los recursos naturales y fuentes hídricas. Y a difundir una conciencia ambiental en las comunidades con mayor extensión de páramos del país.  4)·  Tu puedes ayudar a transformar la visión de un niño o un joven en el que su futuro está predestinado a una mina de carbón arriesgando su vida y su salud en detrimento del medio ambiente y su cultura, Contribuir con ello no tiene precio. Pues con el festival podemos ayudarlo a orientar su talento a través del arte o actividades saludables y productivas aprovechando de manera diferente los recursos naturales de su entorno.5)·  Con tu apoyo estarás ayudando a fortalecer proyectos micro empresariales y productivos que aporten a la seguridad alimentaria de las familias y que sirvan como modelo para otros, de tal suerte que se promueva una cultura social y ambientalmente sostenible y a reducir brechas de pobreza e inseguridad alimentaria en las comunidades campesinas. Breve reseñaSomos una fundación sin ánimo de lucro que desarrolla iniciativas
de desarrollo humano y ambiental  en
Departamento de Boyacá Colombia. 
Boyacá es el departamento con mayor extensión de páramos del país; preocupados por los crecientes problemas de deterioro
en los páramos y contaminación de los ríos y fuentes hídricas que afecta el
acceso al agua potable tanto para el consumo doméstico como para la producción
de alimentos en varios municipios, durante el último año  iniciamos una
campaña pedagógica que genere conciencia ambiental en la región.  
El modelo de desarrollo de los últimos gobiernos
en el país se encuentra enfocado a una política denominada “locomotora minera”
y “confianza inversionista” que busca entregar concesiones a empresarios y multinacionales
para la explotación de minerales sin tener en cuenta la afectación ambiental y
social. Boyacá era un departamento de vocación agrícola y uno de los mejores en
producción de alimentos.  Ahora con estas
políticas cerca del 50 % de las familias presentan problemas de inseguridad
alimentaria, y los indicadores señalan que la población infantil presenta desnutrición
crónica. Las familias han dejado de producir alimentos y se han dedicado a subsistir
de la explotación de minerales en detrimento de su salud, su cultura, el
deterioro ambiental y la equidad social.
Con la iniciativa del Festival Arte Agua y
Tierra que se espera incluir a 5 municipios de la región, el cual está
concebido como una  estrategia pedagógica de educación ambiental y
popular, que a través del arte busca generar una conciencia de esta realidad, en donde los niños,
niñas, jóvenes y adultos y diferentes instituciones y comunidades campesinas expresen
sus miradas sobre los diversos conflictos existentes, así como un intercambio
de saberes y conocimientos acerca de experiencias sociales y ambientalmente
sostenibles. Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienesPara
poder realizar el festival  focalizado en
5 municipios se necesita 61.280 Dólares, los cuales estarán destinados a cubrir los siguientes gastos para las tres fases del proceso de organzación, promoción y realización del festival:1. Fase de organización.2. Fase de promoción y divulgación.3. Fase de realización. 1. En la FASE DE ORGANIZACIÓN se tiene previsto las siguientes actividades y costos:   Total costo Fase 1 de organización. =  36.281 Dólares. 1.1.  Organización y coordinación general con 3 activistas a cargo para los 5 municipios (municipios de Nobsa, Tópaga, Corrales, Tota y Sogamoso) durante 6 meses.  Con un costo de 20.256. Dólares los cuales serán utilizados para gastos de viáticos (transportes, alimentación y hospedajes) y fortalecimiento y apoyo a nichos o grupos artístico - culturales  locales: - Visitas de campo y convocatoria dirigida a colegios de primaria y bachillerato, organizaciones comunitarias y campesinas, organizaciones gubernamentales. Universidades. - Registro de inventarios artístico-culturales y organización de grupos de base: niños, niñas y jovenes.  Comunidades y organizaciones públicas y privadas interesadas en participar. - Fortalecimiento y capacitación a grupos e iniciativas locales.    **  Capacitación y fortalecimiento en instrucción artística dirigida a 15 Grupos o iniciativas Artístico culturales en niñ@s y jóvenes (danza. copla, fotografía y cuentearía) / 3 por municipio. Los recursos irán destinados a fortalecer  la capacitación e instrucción artística con contenido ecológico y cultural.  Esta actividad tiene un costo de 8.974 Dólares para los 5 municipios  **  Fortalecimiento de la capacidad técnica dirigida a 15 Grupos agroalimentarios y artesanales con comunidades campesinas / 3 por municipio. Los recursos irán destinados a fortalecer la capacitación técnica y organizativa y la adquisición de utensilios y logística necesarios.  Costo de la actividad. 7.051 Dólares .- Coordinación y realización de encuentros locales, ensayos y capacitaciones previas.2. FASE DE PROMOCIÓN Y DIVULGACIÓN. La cual tiene un costo total de: 7.051.  Publicidad a través de distintos medios de comunicación a nivel local y regional. Requeridos 7.051 Dólares así.
· Publicidad Impresa (anuncios en prensa, folletos informativos, afiches) con temáticas referidas al objeto del Festival. 
· Publicidad Radial. 20 Programas radiales locales y regionales durante 6 meses con contenido ambiental.
· Producción de 6 programas Televisivos referidos a medio ambientales . 6 Programas locales en 6 meses.
· A través de Internet y redes sociales. 
3.  FASE DE REALIZACIÓN.  La fase 3 de realización tiene un costo total de: 17.948 Dólares.  3.1.  Apoyo en transporte y alimentación a sectores rurales y comunidades campesinas de los 5 municipios a participar.    Requeridos  6.410 Dólares.3.2.  Realización de concursos para fortalecer y
motivar la participación de grupos de base artísticos y agroalimentarios
requieren apoyo para logística y premiación. Requeridos 7.692 Dólares así: 3.5.  Jornada Académica a cargo de Organizaciones públicas y privadas y universidades dirigida a comunidades campesinas y juventudes de la región con temáticas en ecología y biodiversidad, la incidencia de políticas públicas de explotación minera y alternativas
sostenibles. Los recursos serán destinados a logística y viáticos y honorarios de  personal profesional y especializados en temas pertinentes.  Costo de esta actividad 3.846 Dólares. Si no llegamos a la metasi no alcalzamos a cumplir con la meta de los USD 61.280 para  incluir a mínimo 5 municipios de la región, nos veriamos obligados a disminuir el número de municipios, por tanto grupos de artes y productivos que participarían.  Con tu ayuda podemos generar la transformación social y ambiental que tanto necesitamos.  Nuestro niñ@s, jóvenes, comunidades campesinas y el planeta te lo agradecerán.  El impactoLa educación es la mejor manera de ayudar a
transformar vidas y la sociedad en general.  Hemos realizado un festival en el Municipio de Mongua - Boyacá con un impacto muy positivo y favorable para las comunidades y el medio ambiente, en el que logramos integrar cerca de 600 niñ@s y jóvenes de Instituciones educativas rurales y urbanas y mas de 32 organizaciones públicas, privadas y campesinas locales y regionales. 
Con tu ayuda· Estarás contribuyendo a salvar la zona de mayor extensión de páramos que se encuentra en riesgo en el departamento de Boyacá. y a crear una mayor conciencia ambiental en la sociedad.   . Estarás promoviendo los talentos y habilidades artísticas en nuestros niñ@s y jóvenes que utilizaran para manifestarse y a favor de una cultura ambientalmente sostenible en resistencia a las políticas y acciones de los gobiernos expansionistas.
· 
El
festival es una alternativa que promueve el ecoturismo y la identidad cultural
en los lugareños, para lo cual es fundamental el empoderamiento de los sectores
juveniles y campesinos. Pues este potencial se ha desperdiciado debido al desarraigo
cultural en las comunidades de base.
·  Tu puedes ayudar a transformar
la visión de un niño o un joven en el que su futuro está predestinado a una mina
de carbón arriesgando su vida y su salud en detrimento del medio ambiente, Contribuir con ello no tiene precio. Pues a través del festival podemos
ayudarlo a orientar su talento a través del arte o actividades saludables y
productivas aprovechando de manera diferente los recursos naturales de su
entorno. 
· 
Podemos
generar una mayor conciencia en las comunidades, las generaciones de niños, jóvenes
y la sociedad en general a cerca de la necesidad de proteger y conservar los
páramos, los ríos y las fuentes hídricas que se encuentran en alto riesgo de
contaminación.
·  Con tu apoyo estarás
ayudando a fortalecer proyectos micro empresariales y productivos que aporten a
la seguridad alimentaria de las familias y que sirvan como modelo para otros,
de tal suerte que se promueva una cultura social y ambientalmente sostenible y
a reducir brechas de pobreza e inseguridad alimentaria en las comunidades
campesinas.Otras formas en las que puedes ayudarTambien puedes ayudarme a difundirlo a través de tus contactos en redes sociales con lo cual estarás
aportando significativamente a que este sueño se haga realidad.

story:
THANK YOU TO ALL WHO HAVE SUPPORTED THE GED LAB 2014! 


THROUGH OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN WERE ABLE TO RAISE $4,955, AND COMBINED WITH THE SUPPORT OF OTHER OUTSIDE INDIVIDUAL DONORS, WE WERE ABLE TO RAISE A TOTAL OF $15,523 FOR THE LAB DURING THIS PERIOD!


You still have the ability to support this program! Simply make your tax-deductible donation through the Adult Literacy League's website, and include in the comments that you would like your donation to go towards the GED Lab.


All donations made with these notes will be added to a restricted fund for the Lab. You will also receive a mailed receipt for your donation from the Adult Literacy League for your records.


Thank you all again for helping make this program a success!


THE OPPORTUNITY:

Imagine that all that stands between you and a better life for your family is a certificate. Now imagine that the test you need to take to obtain that certificate is being administered on a technology you've never seen before and is in a language you can't understand.

This is the challenge our adult learners face as they work to complete their GED. For these students, many of whom are returning to school for the first time in 10-15 years, they face a double-hurdle: not only do they need to master the subject area content to pass the test, but they must also learn to use the technology as well.

The GED Lab is an intensive and comprehensive model designed to help adult students acquire the technology skills and knowledge they need to continue their education. In turn they will get better jobs, earn a living wage, and improve their lives and the lives of their families.

WHAT IT COSTS:

It costs $30 to take each of the 4 sections of the GED, for a total of $120. We have found that each of our students, after studying for months to learn the content and get used to the technology, will still need several tries for each section – when your whole future was riding on a very expensive test, you’d get nervous, too! From our observation, students average 8 re-takes – which, plus materials like calculators and prep books and support from staff and volunteer instructors – totals approximately $312 per student per session.

To provide this Lab to 8 students per session, for 4 sessions in 2014, our total program budget is $10,000.

WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR:

Students participating in the program will receive:

  • Access to technology based materials and practice tests to help students prepare
  • Computer training
  • Ability to take – and retake- the test as needed (We all get test anxiety!)
  • Small-group instruction
  • Dedicated volunteer teachers who care about the student’s success
  • Support from their peers as they work to teach and support each other

WHAT IT MEANS FOR OUR STUDENTS:

For our students, obtaining their GED is the key to future success:

  • Increased ability to earn a living wage
  • Ability to pursue post-secondary education
  • Improved employability
  • Increased confidence

A Florida high school graduate, on average, earns $7,115 more per year than a high school dropout. Apply that to the 2.4 million Floridians without a diploma, and that adds up to $17.3 billion in lost wages.

Evidence suggests that test-takers who demonstrate fluency with the skills measured in the new assessment will be better prepared for what they plan to do with their lives. A graduate will no longer hold just a high school equivalency credential, but a roadmap for life’s success. It’s a stepping-stone toward a college classroom or a better career and a family sustaining wage.

Success Story: Kenneth, one of our model GED Lab participants, recently graduated with his GED! Having this certificate will allow him to achieve his ultimate goal: a career in substance abuse counseling.

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

  • Donate! Check out our great perks!
  • Help spread the word! Share our project on Facebook or twitter
  • Check out our website for more information about our programs, and why literacy matters to our community.

Click here to visit of GED Lab Donor Wall of Fame! Thank you to all our supporters!

ABOUT THE ADULT LITERACY LEAGUE

The Adult Literacy League is ideally qualified to create this program as we are experts in adult education and literacy. The Adult Literacy League was founded in 1968 with the purpose of serving the 1 in 5 Central Floridians reading at or below the 5th grade level. We have since grown to provide weekly classes and one-on-one volunteer tutoring to over 3000 students. We continually work to support and celebrate our students’ successes.

story:
Help Us Support 15 Students with Autism Who are Going to College this Fall! Your donation will be matched one-to-one up to $5,000 by a generous donor!

This year, 15 young adults with autism receiving services from Quality Services for the Autism Community (QSAC) are going to college! As I’m sure you can imagine, we’re incredibly proud of this group of young men and women -- like all of our participants, they inspire us every day. 

We're looking to launch a scholarship fund to support these 15 students cover costs associated with buying textbooks and other supplies to help ensure that these expenses not a barrier to their going to college and that they're well-equipped for success on the first day of class! Will you help?

Like other young adults heading to college, they have the same concerns about expenses for textbooks and other ancillary expenses associated with being a college student. Many of QSAC’s participants (61%) come from low-income households that’s why we’re launching this Indiegogo campaign to start a scholarship fund to support young adults with autism going to college!

With the average cost of college textbooks for a semester being between $250 - $500, we’re hoping to raise enough funds to offer scholarships to 15 students over the next two semesters and reaching our goal on Indiegogo will be a great first step toward launching this scholarship fund! Your generous support will help to ensure that the cost of textbooks and ancillary expenses is not a barrier to young adults with autism pursuing a college degree.
 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Your donation will be matched dollar-for-dollar up to the first $5,000!
  • We're looking to raise $5,000 or more to support small scholarships to help cover the cost of textbooks and other supplies for 15 college students with autism this fall.
  • As a special thank you for your support, our students will send you a thank you as well as a mid-year update on their progress!
  • If we don't reach out goal, whatever funds are raised will be used to provide scholarships to support the students at a lower level than anticipated.

The Impact of Your Support

  • 100% of the proceeds of this campaign will go directly to funding scholarships for young adults with autism going to college or a vocational training program!
  • Your generosity will help a young adult with autism realize his/her dream of going to college by equipping them with the textbooks and supplies they need to succeed!
  • You'll be helping 15 young adults with autism achieve greater independence! 
  • With your support, 15 young adults with be en route to receiving their college degree and prepared to contribute to their communities in a meaningful way!

About QSAC

QSAC was founded in 1978 by a group of parents confronting limited service options for their children with autism. Today QSAC provides direct services to more than 1,700 children and adults with autism each year throughout New York City and Long Island. 

QSAC is a nonprofit that supports children and adults with autism, together with their families, in achieving greater independence, realizing their future potential, and contributing to their communities in a meaningful way by offering person-centered services. QSAC pursues this mission through direct services that provide a supportive and individualized setting for children and adults with autism to improve their communication, socialization, academic, and functional skills.

QSAC offers programs and services for both children and adults with autism. Programs for children include early intervention, preschool, school, after school, and in-home educational and support services. QSAC’s adult programs include supportive living, skill development programs, and in-home services. All of QSAC’s programs provide supportive and trained staff, high-impact services, and a commitment to quality.

In support of its direct service programs, QSAC works to be an innovator in the field of developmental disability providers by implementing new technologies to best support the children and adults in our programs. In addition, QSAC’s clinical and educational leadership teams regularly embark on research projects that seek to further unlock new and innovative strategies and methodologies for best supporting the learning outcomes of the individuals we serve.

To extend its impact, QSAC offers parent and sibling support groups, trainings, an annual conference for parents, and other programs that expand the community’s awareness regarding autism and access to services.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about this campaign. Please share it with your friends, family, and colleagues via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or any of your other social media outlets.

In addition, feel free to leave a message of support for the young adults heading to college -- we'll be sure to share your messages! Together, we'll encourage them as they prepare for this next chapter in their lives!

You can learn more about QSAC online at www.QSAC.com. You can also follow QSAC on Facebook and Twitter.

In addition, QSAC’s clinical and educational leadership teams regularly embark on research projects that seek to further unlock new and innovative strategies and methodologies for best supporting the learning outcomes of the individuals we serve.To extend its impact, QSAC offers parent and sibling support groups, trainings, an annual conference for parents, and other programs that expand the community’s awareness regarding autism and access to services.




  Other Ways You Can Help Help us spread the word about this campaign. Please share it with your friends, family, and colleagues via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or any of your other social media outlets.In addition, feel free to leave a message of support for the young adults heading to college -- we'll be sure to share your messages! Together, we'll encourage them as they prepare for this next chapter in their lives!You can learn more about QSAC online at www.QSAC.com. You can also follow QSAC on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
Detaining people pre-trial on charges which would not lead to a prison sentence is disproportionate, damaging, and wasteful of public funds.

Rather than serving us by protecting our rights, as charged by the Constitution, the government has goals and objectives of its own, often in conflict with our rights. While we may have all the rights (the Constitution specifically says so), the government has all the power. 


What they say Electric Monitoring is:

Home confinement is a tool that helps U.S. probation and pretrial services officers supervise, or monitor, defendants and offenders in the community. In the federal courts, home confinement is not a sentence in and of itself but may be a condition of either probation, parole, supervised release, or pretrial release.  A person placed under home confinement is confined to his or her residence, usually linked to an electronic monitoring or GPS system, and required to maintain a strict daily activity schedule. When the person is allowed to leave home, and for what reasons, is determined case by case. Home confinement’s purpose depends on the phase of the criminal justice process in which it is used.  In all cases, it is a means to restrict a person’s activity and to protect the public from any threat the person may pose. In pretrial cases were a person has not been tried, home confinement is an alternative to detention used to assist in ensuring community safety. In post-sentence cases, home confinement is used as a punishment, viewed as more punitive than regular supervision but less restrictive than imprisonment. Courts may use home confinement as a sanction for persons who violate the conditions of their supervision. Also, the Bureau of Prisons may use it for inmates released to serve the last part of their sentence under the supervision of U.S. probation officers.  A person placed under home confinement is . . . usually linked to an electronic monitoring or GPS system. Home confinement benefits the courts in that it costs much less than incarceration.  Moreover, courts may order persons placed under home confinement to pay all or part of monitoring costs. Home confinement also enables defendants and offenders to continue to contribute to the support of their families and pay taxes.


What Electric Monitoring is:

In most cases electronic monitoring programs operate under questionable legal frameworks, typically excluding or minimizing any rights or entitlements for the people being monitored.  There are several rights that the condition of Full House Arrest on electronic monitoring violates including:

  • The First Amendment (Amendment I) to the United States Constitution prohibits the making of any law respecting an establishment of religion and/or impeding the free exercise of religion. The State of Texas has violated peoples 1st Amendment Right to exercise their religion by using Full House Arrest with electronic monitoring as a condition of bond release. 
  • The Fifth Amendment (Amendment V) to the United States Constitution is part of the Bill of Rights and protects against unfair treatment in legal processes. Full House Arrest with electronic monitoring is a punishment that is being used as a pre-trial release condition on people who have not been tried in a court. The Amendment also has a Due Process Clause which states, ‘no person shall be deprived of life, liberty, or property, without due process of law (similar to the one in the 14th Amendment).  Full House Arrest with electronic monitoring deprives people of their right to life, liberty, and property without due process of the law.  There is not any precedent case that can be found that prohibits the courts from confining a person to their home while awaiting trial, so judges are able to place this burden upon anyone.    
  • The Sixth Amendment (Amendment VI) to the United States Constitution is the part of the United States Bill of Rights that sets forth rights related to criminal prosecutions.  ‘In all criminal prosecutions, the accused shall enjoy the right to have the Assistance of Counsel for his defense.’  Being on Full House Arrest with electronic monitoring forces people to be indigent.  Indigence limits resources making it nearly impossible for a individual to hire a quality attorney to defend them.  
  • The Eighth Amendment (Amendment VIII) to the United States Constitution is the part of the United States Bill of Rights (ratified December 15, 1791) prohibiting the federal government from imposing excessive bail, excessive fines or cruel and unusual punishments, including torture.  Typically the max bond is given and then Full House Arrest with electronic monitoring condition is added.  The units people are required to wear 24/7 inflicted pain on their ankles and feet.


What the Impact is:

Today some 200,000 people in the United States wear some sort of electronic monitor (EM), typically an ankle bracelet required as a condition of house arrest.  

When your rights and the government's goals are in conflict, we all lose.


What we want to do:

To raise funds to fight for the God given rights that every man in this great nation has. We are seeking $100,000 to pay for a class action suit against the government.

story:
As I child,I was deeply interested in the American Presidency. As the most powerful person in the world, I thought that Presidents can and will change the course of European history for the better.

I have researched the Kennedy Presidency for a decade now.I was involved with the first ever translation of the full Warren Commissions Report to hungarian.

The book is fully financed, but I need a trip to Dallas from Budapest next spring, 2015 March, to meet Gary Mack, the curator of the Sixth Floor Museum in Dallas, to get the final interview I much need, and also to visit first time the site, which I have seen many occasions, but only in books, or on the internet.

The books publish is fully financed, only the trip I am asking for help, which will take place early spring, 2015 from Budapest to Dallas.

Elected in 1960 as the 35th president of the United States, 43-year-old John F. Kennedy became the youngest man and the first Roman Catholic to hold that office. He was born into one of America’s wealthiest families and parlayed an elite education and a reputation as a military hero into a successful run for Congress in 1946 and for the Senate in 1952. As president, Kennedy confronted mounting Cold War tensions in Cuba, Vietnam and elsewhere. He also led a renewed drive for public service and eventually provided federal support for the growing civil rights movement. His assassination on November 22, 1963, in Dallas, Texas, sent shockwaves around the world and turned the all-too-human Kennedy into a larger-than-life heroic figure. To this day, historians continue to rank him among the best-loved presidents in American history.

My book concentrates on his historical importance to European states and his everlasting importance. 

The funding will go to: 

1. Flight to Dallas from Budapest and back:  est.: 800 USD

2.Cost of interview, booking the interview room: 450 USD

3.Accomodation: since I have friends in Dallas: 0 USD

4.Taxes and locally imposed payments : 400 USD

5. Donation to the Sixth Floor Museum: self paid

6. Flight from Dallas to Washingtonand back: 450 USD

7.Interview at the Kennedy Center and Arlington National Cemetery, all taxes and locally imposed payments: 950 USD

The two volumed biography will consist of two parts:

1. Volume is edited through the 1950's, from Joe Kennedy's connections to his decision to elevate his son, John to the highest office. Will follow the presidency until 1963 november 22.

2. Volume is about the assassination and the aftermath.



Both parts its crucially important to have the Gary Mack interview in Dallas, the interview at the Kennedy Center in Washington and the visit to the Arlington National Cemetery. 

The books publishing is already funded.

story:
We need sustainable safe havens

After working successfully as sustainability professionals for over 20 years, we could not help seeing parallels between the transition to a cleaner energy system and solutions for the Middle East refugee crisis. 

Both challenges need a combination of fresh ideas and proven solutions and in both cases the solution cannot (easily) be delivered by the current political system alone. So we need grassroots people like you to push the system in the right direction. 

The good news is that such transitions can succeed. With your help we can create a sustainably safe future for many Middle East refugees as well. 

Millions of people have fled their homes in Middle East conflict zones. Creating safe havens in those regions is a good idea but GreenfieldCities strives to jump to a next level and create safe & prospering havens that offer a real sustainable future. We call them Greenfield cities.

Together we can do it

A crazy idea?  We don’t think so.  Bold? Definitely! But everything we propose and think of has been done before. And with your help we are going to deliver a city size grassroots solution the international community is looking for.  

We aim to  completely stop conflict driven mass migration from the Middle East, by offering displaced people much better opportunities than Europe or other western countries will ever be able to deliver. We also believe that Greenfield cities can foster long term regional stability.

The basic principle is simple: think and act long term and empower people and capital

 -Don’t create safe yet temporary refugee camps,  but switch to the idea of creating real new cities with a long term view and sustainable prosperity in mind. The EU or UN should commit themselves for 50 years or longer to secure universal human rights in those areas.

-When the EU or UN commit to securing safety, universal rights and a special economic status in one or more areas the size of Hong Kong or New York  (roughly 30 by 30 kilometers, 20 by 20 miles) for 50 years or more, then people in pursuit of happiness and prosperity will, with some help, nurse that city into a success story.

-Set aside the colonial taboo! Especially for the Greenfield host country, an international Greenfield partnership will be a once in a lifetime opportunity. The host country will attract a lot of investment and have a positive and prominent seat at the global diplomatic table. Ans since this is a temporary lease, the territory will eventually be under full control of the host country again. 

Now, we are the first to admit that there are significant risks and challenges to overcome. Trying new things is never easy, and doing so near conflict zones makes it even harder. Yes, extraordinary challenges,  but with millions of people looking for solutions and a new future, there are also countless opportunities. By starting small and lining up broad and strong partnerships we think risks are manageable. 

This is what we propose to do

We'll invest the initial funding to:

  1. Invite refugees that are now in the Netherlands to form the core of the GreenfieldCities.org professional team.
  2. Push the European Union, United Nations and Regional Leadership to think long term and commit to securing small safe havens in or near Middle East conflict zones for at least 50 years ahead. 
  3. Develop “Greenfield” cities in the secured areas for at least 250,000 people within 18 months. We will recruit development team members from future citizens. 
  4. Gather funds to invest at least $ 150 million in green infrastructure and support for pioneering Greenfield citizens.

You can make a world of change and get rewarded!

If you believe:

-the only real solution for the Middle East is in the region itself
-that if we can create refugee camps, we also can create new cities
-that certain regional areas can benefit from nurseries of stability and reason
-that you can make a difference helping realizing these goals

Then join the GreenFieldCities idea and help us surprise the world. Together we can help global leaders to unleash their imagination and act. Let’s make them an offer they can’t refuse

Want to learn more about why we are sure we can do this?
Want to learn more about how we make everybody  a winner?
Want to learn more about how you can be a part of this?

Never can your contribution have more impact than now!  Make a contribution at IndieGoGo, have a look at www.GreenFieldCities.org and spread the word to your friends and family!

story:
Hello :) My name is Dakota Dean. I am a senior at Corbin Highschool in Corbin KY.  


Acting is my future. It's my passion. 


Ever since i can remember i've been acting. Iv'e made it my life and want to continue making it my life. My dream is to be in movies or even on broadway. I know it may seem like a far fetched dream, but i truly belive i can make it possible. In order to make it possible, i need the proper training and education. I have been accepted to Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD). A very prestigious performing arts school. Upon completion of my Bachelor of fine arts degree in the performing arts, i will have the training and education needed to pursue my dream career.

The only problem with going is that... I desperately need money! 

The tuition for SCAD is a wopping $31,905! With scholarships and Financial aid i have only been able to get around $19,000 paid for. That leaves me with over $12,000 to pay for the rest of tuition and other fees.

Going to SCAD is my dream, and i know that i'm meant to be there. I just need your help to get me there. 
If you can, i would highly appreiciate any type of donation. from $1 to $100. Anything and everything will help me drastically.

If it comes down to it, i will be selling my car to pay for some of the tuition. I'm becoming extremely desperate and i am practiaclly begging. I need every penny i can get. So please, Help me if you can!
It would mean the world to me, and help me pursue my dream!

If you can, Post this page to your facebook, twitter, instagram, or any other social networking site you may use. Help me get the word out :)

Thank you SOO much.

 

-Dakota Dean

story:
Our Story

Six students from Antelope Trails Elementary and one student from Discovery Canyon Elementary Schools started a Destination ImagiNation team, "The Lightning Bolts" in December of 2010. Only one student had ever participated in the organization previously. None of the children knew each other. Over the next three months the students met at homes on weekends and snow days as well as at school during the week to work on their competitive challenge called "Unidentified Moving Object".

The team competed and successfully won their regional competition with flying colors. They were even awarded a very special award, The Renaissance Award for their technical solution for their problem. This allowed them to move on to the Colorado State Finals, where they competed against other top-rate teams from throughout the state.

The team achieved something none of the members thought possible back on those initial practice days in January and February—they won at state.

Now they are given the very rare opportunity to travel to the University of Tennessee in Knoxville to compete against 90 countries, including the United States at the Destination ImagiNation Global Finals.

The four day event is filled with interactive activities that encourage the students to meet, learn and create with the other finalists from around the world. They will also compete and perform their winning solution against nearly 200 other teams. 

All of this does come with a pretty hefty price tag. One that is very difficult for their families to shoulder all alone.

The Bolts need your gracious assistance.


An Educational Opportunity Of A Lifetime

This is an opportunity these students will remember forever. It will provide educational experience far outside the typical classroom. Interacting with children of the same age from all over the world while creating and sharing together will provide unmeasurable understanding and compassion of different cultures. It will help them to learn to break down stereotypes of others that are different. It will nurture communication, team-building, and leadership skills.

The event also exposes the students to college life, living on campus and being surrounded by the major influences of the educational experience that the University lifestyle provides.

This need to fund-raise in order to attend the Global Finals, in which they have earned, opens a new level of commitment and action the students are taking on wholeheartedly. They are currently working on a video to better explain why this is so very important to them, and why Destination ImagiNation is a great cause. We feel this understanding of financial needs and call to action is building another layer of responsibility and maturity in each one of them. They will be working very hard, both on their problem and on the fund-raising side.


What We Need & Where It Will Go 

We need roughly $1,000 for each member and manager to cover travel and room and board expenses. All other expenses will be out of our families' pocket. We have seven bright third, fourth, and fifth grade students and two team managers. 

Room and board and all competition facilities are provided by the University of Tennessee. 

Our students and parents are determined to find a way to get The Lightning Bolts to Global Finals. Aside from this website, we are also asking local businesses and educational entities in Colorado for donations. We are planning a few local fund-raising events as well. We will keep you posted here.

If we do not reach our goal, each family will need to pay our remaining costs.


Perks

For every donation of $20 or more, the Lightning Bolts team will mail an autographed photograph postcard of the team heading to the Destination ImagiNation Globals. The postcard will be professionally photographed by our kind contributor, Robert Villena - check out his great work at RobertVillena.com . The postcard will be postmarked and sent from the University of Tennessee Post Office. We have been told there is a special Post Office stamp that marks the mailing from "Global Finals".


Can't Donate? Please Share Our Link 

Every penny helps. If you aren't able to donate, but believe that this cause will help these seven children, please share our campaign with a friend or relative that you feel would support this ambitious group of youngsters to achieve their goal.

The event also exposes the students to college life, living on campus and being surrounded by the major influences of the educational experience that the University lifestyle provides.
This need to fund-raise in order to attend the Global Finals, in which they have earned, opens a new level of commitment and action the students are taking on wholeheartedly. They are currently working on a video to better explain why this is so very important to them, and why Destination ImagiNation is a great cause. We feel this understanding of financial needs and call to action is building another layer of responsibility and maturity in each one of them. They will be working very hard, both on their problem and on the fund-raising side.

What We Need & Where It Will Go 

We need roughly $1,000 for each member and manager to cover travel and room and board expenses. All other expenses will be out of our families' pocket. We have seven bright third, fourth, and fifth grade students and two team managers. 
Room and board and all competition facilities are provided by the University of Tennessee. 
Our students and parents are determined to find a way to get The Lightning Bolts to Global Finals. Aside from this website, we are also asking local businesses and educational entities in Colorado for donations. We are planning a few local fund-raising events as well. We will keep you posted here.
If we do not reach our goal, each family will need to pay our remaining costs.

Perks
For every donation of $20 or more, the Lightning Bolts team will mail an autographed photograph postcard of the team heading to the Destination ImagiNation Globals. The postcard will be professionally photographed by our kind contributor, Robert Villena - check out his great work at RobertVillena.com . The postcard will be postmarked and sent from the University of Tennessee Post Office. We have been told there is a special Post Office stamp that marks the mailing from "Global Finals".

Can't Donate? Please Share Our Link 
Every penny helps. If you aren't able to donate, but believe that this cause will help these seven children, please share our campaign with a friend or relative that you feel would support this ambitious group of youngsters to achieve their goal.

Well, the campaign was partially successful, in that I've receieved a lot of letters thanking me for the idea. Sadly, the campaign was never browsable on Indiegogo, so no one saw it except some friends. The good news is that my friends have come together to loan me the money needed to cover tuition. I'm glad to know I'm saving people a ton of money, and this idea will continue to benefit us all!

story:
WE ARE…dynamic and experienced individuals ready to build bridges with the Bocas del Toro region, where the Naso and Afro-Panamanian People are fighting environmental injustices to maintain their quality of life as indigenous people. Through the Rainforest Awakenings program's holistic approach to environmental protection, meditation, trust building activities and the practice of council we will learn to protect nature and build community. We will share the solutions and community organizations skills we learned in Chicago and put into practice the skills we will learn in Panama when we return. We intend to document and share the struggle of the Panamanian people, the beauty of the land and our transformation as community leaders in order to raise awareness and continue global empowerment. Together we can defend our land.

AFTER WINTESSING… not only the struggle but also the power we have as a community we decided we couldn’t let this opportunity to support our Panamanian earth and community. We find their struggles, culture, and community too similar hold back from reaching out our hand. In Chicago one can see the difference in social and economic statuses change from one block to the next. In Little Village we witness that but also are immersed in the culture. The Little Village community is 83% Latino, half being 1st generation immigrants. We are part of that vibrant culture but we are also part of that great struggle. The poverty rate is 27% while Chicago’s overall rate is 20%. We are part of that every day struggle to support ourselves as well as our families, as daughters. We fight to keep our family and community strong. We, as supporters of P.E.R.R.O and LVEJO, have participated in the battles against two main environmental bullies. In Little Village and Pilsen, where we live, we were able to shut down the two of Chicago's biggest coal-fired power plants after 10 years of community protesting. http://abclocal.go.com/wls/story?section=news/local&id=8562866 <http://lvejo.org/current-events/retire2plants>

 WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET... We have had success leading fundraising campaigns in our neighborhood. Now, we are learning about the power of fundraising on-line. We have applied for scholarships and are hosting fundraisers in our schools and community. It is our hope that you will join our efforts to grow as leaders, build stronger global community and protect the planet.

During this campaign, we are requesting funds to contribute to the remainder of our program costs. These costs cover room and board, 2 meals a day, transportation, guides, and service projects for 3 adults and 4 young women.

7 Travelers x $1143 each = $8001

 Check out our unique perks! You will also get information on what is happening in Panama from the Youth perspective and directly from Panamanian people. You can connect with us and follow us on Facebook.

IMPACT... Awareness will be raised about the destruction caused by power plants on a global scale. We will be able to directly connect our local struggles with that of the Panamanian people and understand on a deeper level why the work we do is so important. We will be better informed about root causes of environmental destruction and experience a holistic approach to rainforest preservation. We will be empowered by knowledge and experience and better prepared to speak with other young people about real ways that we can continue to protect the planet. This will be the creation of an alternative model of how to support young leaders as they work to create a healthier planet.

SOCIAL IMPACT... The lives Chicago youth will change forever! They will reap the benefits of your generosity and concern for others. This will have a tremendous positive effect on their self-esteem and will also teach them how to build quality relationships with others and the global community. They will gain heightened leadership skills, advocacy skills, interpersonal and intrapersonal skills, cultural diversity and awareness skills, and have a broadened perspective of the opportunities available to them as they become successful adults. Youth will document there journey and bring that documentary back to their respective communities. Many more young people will be inspired and encouraged by the youth that will benefit from this amazing experience. 

8 More reasons why this project is impactful! -

-     Youth will become stronger leaders that will pass the torch to the next generation, which is also known as rites of passage

-     Youth will gain applicable communication and relational skills for college, jobs and entrepreneurial ventures

 -    Youth will gain global leadership skills, critical thinking skills, and strategizing skills

 -   Youth will experience the healing power of Mother Earth and community

-   Youth will have the opportunity to participate in healing circles to share their experiences and connect with a community that understands and cares

 -   Youth will learn about the importance of relying on natural resources versus industrialized resources 

-    Youth will understand how social injustice impacts the world and their ability to participate in the creation of a healthier planet.

Other Ways You Can Help... Please Make some noise about our project and Share this with everyone you know!!

story:
The Idea

Threatened Animals of East Africa is a publication that aims to educate and encourage secondary school students in East Africa to get involved in animal conservation issues through informative discussion and group projects.  The book focuses on twelve animals: Chimpanzee, Mountain Gorilla, Elephant, Giraffe, Black Rhinoceros, African Hunting Dog, Cheetah, Leopard, Blue Whale, Nile Crocodile, and the Wattled Crane.


Every animal will be represented by a photograph and a 'fast fact' section, followed by detailed information on habitat, diet, mating, as well as other interesting trivia.  Each section will close with a three-part student activity focusing on the animal: multiple choice questions, individual project ideas, and environmental club project suggestions.  A definition of biological terms such as primate, herbivore, and so on will be available at the end of the book.

 

The Impact

East Africa is home to the world's most iconic animals, which feature in this publication.  Many of these animals are poached, maimed, or hunted to the brink of extinction by uninformed individuals trying to make quick money by selling to private collectors, witchdoctors, or the black market.  Other contributing factors include deforestation, human encroachment, and village against animal retaliation due to damaged crops. 


Increased education efforts and awareness can change this.  For example, currently less than 1% of Tanzanians visit a National Park in their lifetime, which are home to a variety of these impressive animals.  Threatened Animals of East Africa hopes to increase understanding of indigenous wildlife, and the threats that face them so that we can encourage the future adults of tomorrow to actively get involved.


What We Need 

Threatened Animals of East Africa is in its final stages of editing, having circulated environmental conservation offices in Tanzania, Uganda, Congo, and the United States.  Each A5 booklet is 30 pages in length.  An initial printing of 5,000 copies is desired.  The book will circulate schools in East African countries through a local Non-Governmental Organization.  The photograph copyrights, writing/editing, and student activities have been granted or created at no cost.  Printing is the only expense.


In addition to the $2,000 I am trying to raise on this site, I am also seeking funding from local embassies and corporations.  If the targeted amount is not reached, as many copies as possible will be printed with the money donated by each individual.  


Other Ways You Can Help

In-kind support is always appreciated!  If you know a publisher, printer, or animal lover that would be interested in generously donating 5,000 copies or a portion of that for free, please forward the link to this site.


Many Thanks To...

Cockburn Building, Antonia Brownlee, Shiobhan Collins, David Cook, John Cover & Family, Harry Crombie, Frances Crombie, Martin Crombie & Family, Stuart Crombie, Elana Daniels, Tana David, Emma Dobbie, Genevieve Edens, April Fairgrieve, Karen Ferguson & Family, Tyson Gaskill, Jonathan Hickey, James & June Hudson, John Kerkering, Angela Kirwin, Sara Montag, Megan Nelson, Steven & Pam Nitsche, Bronson Oliveira, Janet Pope, Katherine Pope, Philip Pope, Shannon Poss, Will Reding, Helen Searl, Sarah Wakeford, Gail Wensley, JoEllen Williamson, Brandon Wise, and anonymous donors

story:
Hi, my name is Taylor Boykin. I am a college student in Kansas working toward my Communications degree. I have cerebral palsy but it doesn't have me! I have set many goals for myself: finish school, get a good job, meet that special lady and have a family. One major goal I have is to learn to drive a vehicle so that I don't have to rely on others or the bus system to get me where I want and need to go.  Because I use a power wheelchair and have limited range of motion I must learn to drive a van that will be equipped with EMC (Electronic Mobility Controls) which is a high tech system designed for people with physical limitations.

Normally Vocation Rehabilitation covers training for individuals with disabilities but because I am a student and not employed they cannot assist me. The training requires a trainer with the EMC technology skills. Currently the closest one to me is in Ballwin, Mo which is about 4 hours east of me. That means the trainer would have to travel to Kansas where I am located in his specially equipped van to provide me the training. The cost is approximately $8,700.00 which covers the driving instruction for 5 days/40 hours, lodging/meals for instructor, and gas for the specialized van. In addition to this cost is $75.00 per hour of travel time. So that is an additional $600.00. This is a huge amount for me and my family.

The impact of your help would allow me to experience the same freedom as my peers. It would provide me another layer of independence that I don't have access to right now. Times are tough right now so any assistance would be greatly appreciated. If you are not in a position to help financially please help me by spreading the word to make others aware of the limited funding there is available for individuals with disabilities.  If I am blessed to raise the money for the driving lessons that would be great! If by some small miracle I was to exceed my goal any additional money would go toward the purchase of a van for me.  Direct contributions can be made to me at P.O. Box 13504, Overland Park, Kansas 66282. Thank you for your time, your prayers, and any contributions.

story:
Our Story

 

Helen Gradstein here. No, this is not the time where you press the back button and keep browsing. This is the time where you hopefully read through this letter, because our program tackles the many difficulties in the education system in third world countries with one unique and efficient program.

 

Exponential Education started two and a half years ago in Ghana, West Africa. Since then, the program has been growing in strength and is currently expanding. The program has run in multiple areas in Ghana, and as you are reading this letter, over 150 students are studying and tutoring twice this week in order to ensure themselves a better future.

 

There are three general problems in education in most underdeveloped nations today:

  1. Junior High School students are unable to pass the basic entrance exams into High School because of poor educational resources and lack of state funding. Therefore, most students are not able to continue further than a Junior High School level education.
  2. Of the students that pass the entrance exam and enroll themselves in High School, many must drop out of school prematurely due to lack of funding to pay their school fees (about $15 a term).
  3. Of the students that are able to graduate High School, most do not have enough funding to continue on to University.

 

Exponential Education tackles these three issues in one unique, multiplying program. We take four or five High School students, pay them a small weekly stipend so that they can stay enrolled in school, and in return, they each tutor five Junior High School students. Therefore, five High School students are providing free tutoring to twenty five Junior High School students, helping to bridge the gap in education and creating a greater High School entrance exam pass rate. At the end of ten weeks, the most accomplished High School student tutor receives a scholarship of $300 USD, which could pay for his or her full first year’s University tuition in either Ghana or India.

 

The crazy thing is that the entire program only costs $500 USD.  This amount provides one High School student a full scholarship for higher education, four High School students receive a weekly stipend to stay enrolled in High School, and twenty five Junior High School students receive free tutoring by older peers in their local area who understand their culture, community and educational needs. In addition, with this sum, Exponential Education provides snacks and materials for every session for those who are unable to afford such basic amenities.

 

Exponential Education has now successfully completed fifteen programs, in ten different schools, and is still running today. Past scholarship winners like Michael Asore, who is now attending University of Ghana and studying Computer Engineering, or Rabiatu Nuhu, who is also attending University of Ghana and studying Anthropology, are continuously making strides to ensure a better future for themselves, their families and their community. Many of the Junior High School students that received extra tutoring from Exponential Education are now enrolled in High School and are the first in their families to receive more advanced education.

 

The Impact

As of December 2012, Exponential Education will have provided education to more than seven hundred children and young adults, ensured High School enrollment for over seventy High School Students, and will have provided University Scholarships to over 20 High School student tutors.

 

Currently, Exponential Education has expanded the program from one location to thirteen locations and have hired Ghanaian community leaders to monitor the programs. We are also trying to further exapnd into the village of Abanase, where an American volunteer ran school, YIST, would like to implement the program as well. Renee Funston and Amber Shevin will be leading these programs, and be helping all the children unable to afford better education in their villages. In addition to our educational goals, Exponential Education creates local employment opportunities and encourages community development primarily through local leaders.


With 14 locations and two paid Ghanaian program monitors, our estimated budget for the year 2013 will be approximately $14,000 dollars. Eighteen programs per year, provides better education for over 500 kids. That includes about 450 children receiving free tutoring, snacks and materials, 90 High School students who stay enrolled in High School and 18 High School students who receive scholarships worth a year’s tuition to University. Our full time Ghanaian program manager will be paid $900 USD each per term, which is a competitive wage for a part-time job in Ghana (Ghana GDP per capita is approximately $2000 USD a year), and any extra funding will be used towards increased program enrollments, more snacks, more materials, higher wages and additional future programs.

What We Need & What You Get

 

I know that there are so many non-profit organizations out there, and many of you contribute regularly, however your donations are individually meaningful when invested in Exponential Education. These kids are desperate for higher education, and I believe that education within the community is the key to solving regional issues all over the world.  Your donation will make a huge difference in these children’s lives, and not only create better educational foundations, but also increase their confidence, their test scores, introduce community discussion, involvement and empowerment, critical thinking, employment opportunities, increase the local economy, and create new community leaders. This program works, has a successful track record, and can be customized to fit any community and its students’ needs.

 

I can assure you that your donation sincerely touches the lives of so many students. I can’t express the proud look on our children’s faces when they improve in their math and reading skills over twelve weeks, or the shock that the High School student tutors have when they win their scholarships. If you are interested in seeing what I mean, take a look at some of our kids who have benefited from Exponential Education, with the website provided.

 

So please, reach into your pockets, or that book that you sometimes hide money in, or even those envelopes with dollars in it that get mailed to you that you are supposed to mail back but never do, and find it in your hearts to donate to this worthy cause. I promise I will not let you down, and I will keep you updated with videos, pictures and statements of how your donations have directly benefited these children through Exponential Education.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can donate, but if you like our page or put it on your status feed it would be a great help. Spreading the word is always needed! Also, have any ideas? We are always collaborating and taking your suggestions, since, you know, that whole two minds are better then one thing...

 

Also, want to intern or come to Ghana? The Exponential Education team will always be taking volunteers or interns. We are open to people coming and helping building, organizing, gaining government support, and helping the students of our programs.

Want to run an Exponential Education program outside of Ghana! Go For it! We will help you fundraise, get all of our materials, and succesfully run a program with our Exponential Education kit. Contact me for more details.

What We Need & What You Get
 
I know that there are so many non-profit organizations out there, and many of you contribute regularly, however your donations are individually meaningful when invested in Exponential Education. These kids are desperate for higher education, and I believe that education within the community is the key to solving regional issues all over the world.  Your donation will make a huge difference in these children’s lives, and not only create better educational foundations, but also increase their confidence, their test scores, introduce community discussion, involvement and empowerment, critical thinking, employment opportunities, increase the local economy, and create new community leaders. This program works, has a successful track record, and can be customized to fit any community and its students’ needs.
 
I can assure you that your donation sincerely touches the lives of so many students. I can’t express the proud look on our children’s faces when they improve in their math and reading skills over twelve weeks, or the shock that the High School student tutors have when they win their scholarships. If you are interested in seeing what I mean, take a look at some of our kids who have benefited from Exponential Education, with the website provided.
 
So please, reach into your pockets, or that book that you sometimes hide money in, or even those envelopes with dollars in it that get mailed to you that you are supposed to mail back but never do, and find it in your hearts to donate to this worthy cause. I promise I will not let you down, and I will keep you updated with videos, pictures and statements of how your donations have directly benefited these children through Exponential Education.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everyone can donate, but if you like our page or put it on your status feed it would be a great help. Spreading the word is always needed! Also, have any ideas? We are always collaborating and taking your suggestions, since, you know, that whole two minds are better then one thing...
 
Also, want to intern or come to Ghana? The Exponential Education team will always be taking volunteers or interns. We are open to people coming and helping building, organizing, gaining government support, and helping the students of our programs.
Want to run an Exponential Education program outside of Ghana! Go For it! We will help you fundraise, get all of our materials, and succesfully run a program with our Exponential Education kit. Contact me for more details.

story:
We are reaching out to all those who would love to see 10 girls have the amazing opportunity to go through this Rites of Passage. 

Through Growing Goddess we focus on the special time when a girl is stepping through the threshold into womanhood. With the support of mentors and a close connection to the earth a culture is created that marks this powerful transition. This Rites of Passage draws out each young woman’s gifts, inner resources and glimmering authenticity. We learn about our amazing bodies, self care, primitive skills, plant medicine, and the wise woman ways, as we root into our bio-region! We sing, we dance, we celebrate and we learn about who we are and how we want to show up for our communities, this earth and our lives.

We will be hosted in a beautiful space in Candler, NC called Sacred Mountain Sanctuary. We will also visit various nature wonders in and around Asheville, NC.

The programs include the following: deep nature connection, sisterhood support, mentors and elders, primitive skills, backpacking, hiking and forest exploration, self confidence building and self care, plant medicine and wild edibles, arts and crafts, and much more! We will flow together as a web of women to create the fertile soil that will nourish each of our blossoming spirits! - See more at: http://earthpatheducation.com/growing-goddess-camp/location-gg/#sthash.SKLUepq4.dpuf

Give 10 girls the gift of being intiated in these sacred ways! 

With Love and Gratitude,

Lena

story:
UPDATE: We have launched a new fundraising campaign to fund Synfig development for next month. Please check it out here.

Short Summary

Hello, my name is Konstantin Dmitriev. I am running this campaign to fund the development of Synfig - the free and opensource animation software.

I am mentoring a full-time developer Ivan Mahonin, who is working on Synfig code. We have funded his work in previous months by running similar fundraising campaigns for October, November, December, January and February.

Thanks to success of those campaigns, Ivan have implemented following features for Synfig:

- Frame-by-Frame animation (bitmap)


- Bones tools


See other demonstrations at our YouTube channel...

The success of this campaign will allow Ivan to work full-time for a whole month in March 2014.

Also, this campaign allows our users to directly influence the Synfig development by choosing development priorities. 

How?

Please read below.


"Choose Priority" perk

For a donation of fixed amount (see the perks on the right)  we offer to the donor an exceptional privilege to choose a priority of development.  So, we will spend next month working on the priority you defined. Of course, we can't promise any thing, so please select from the list below:

  • Frame-by-frame bitmap animation support (continued, see current status)
  • Rendering speed optimization
  • Sound support
  • Improve user interface

NOTE: We don't guarantee the feature from a selected priority to be completely finished within a month. Such promises are not compatible with development realities. What we promise is to dedicate no less than 85% of our working time to developing this priority for a full month. Though, one month is a  significant period and such dedication would lead to significant changes in selected direction. Many our users are aware that we used to publish development snapshots regularly, so you will be able to benefit from development results as soon as possible.

EXAMPLE: As result of our earlier fundraising campaign, we got sold the "Choose priority" perk for October. The priority chosen by donor was "Single-window UI". You can see results in this video.

"Development OS" perk

By default we use Linux operation system (OS) for daily development (because we love Linux). As result, the Linux version of Synfig is the most polished, because it goes through daily proof.

But, for a fixed-amount donation (see the perks on the right) you can make us shift to other OS for next month. So, if we will use the OS of your choice in our daily development, then obviously  the Synfig version will be especially polished to work on it: daily proof => more testing => less bugs => better stability.

No worries, this perk doesn't mean we drop support for other operation systems. It's just a question of choosing the OS for daily development.

At the moment the only OS available for choice is Windows.

Other perks

We understand that there are people who would like to support our efforts by other means. Specially for them we prepared other perks to express our gratitude:

  • Synfig Training Package. You can get our Synfig training course at exclusively low price. Comparing to regular "pay-what-you-want" download, you get a direct assistance from the course instructors and all future updates are also included. We will ship a coupon code for you which you can use to access the training by yourself or present as a gift to someone.  The package is available in English and Russian.
  • Tutorial video. A tutorial video about Synfig for ANY given theme. Length is limited to 5 minutes.  Languages can be English or Russian. Video will be publicly available for everyone. The tutorial video will be produced by Nikolai Mamashev, who was in charge for producing Synfig Training Package.
  • Report sponsor. You can track the progress of the development by reading my weekly reports. If you claim this perk, then one of my weekly reports will be indicated as sponsored by you with an (optional) link to your website. The mention will look as "This report is sponsored by: ..." text at the top of the report text.
  • Sponsor logo. Your logo displayed for one month at the front page of Synfig website.

Who is behind this campaign

Konstantin Dmitriev. This is me. I am the person who is responsible for distributing collected funds and  mentoring the development process. I am an open-source activist with a special profile for animation. The range of my activities include expertize, development and popularization of free software animation solutions.


You can see following my works made as animator purely with free software:

  • Morevna Project: Demo
  • “Persona” Tomato Paste commercial
  • Morevna Project: Production Cuts

Also I have a profile in education by teaching animation to kids using libre and opensource tools. Here are some of the works made by my students:

  • The Adventures of Boris Munchausen
  • Amazing Sentence

The sources for many of the works above are freely available under the Creative Commons license.

Ivan Mahonin. He is a professional C/C++ developer, hired to work on Synfig code. You can track current Ivan's contributions to Synfig on this page.

Nikolai Mamashev. He is a "wizard of Synfig", awesome artist who use free software only. If you are user Synfig, then you know at least one his work - the current splash screen is created by him. He is known as lead artist in Morevna Project: Demo, also it worths to look at his portfolio. Nikolai is in charge for providing artistic support for us, proof testing and tutorials production.

The Impact

With this campaign we would like to provide a way to control the direction of development and support vitality of Synfig development at the same time.  Users can choose the priorities and all collected funds will go to support further sustainable development of Synfig. It's fair and benefit is for everyone - we all get better free animation software.

You can track the results of our work by reading my weekly reports.

Also, we are open to consider other models of funding for Synfig. If you are would like to sponsor the implementation of particular feature - please contact us (see the comments tab at the top).

Other ways you can help

For the people, who would like to give as direct and regular support there is an option to subscribe. Please check out this page for details - http://www.synfig.org/cms/en/news/taking-one-step-away-from-crowdfunding/.

Thank you!

story:
In my years teaching, what has always impressed and excited me most is students' creativity and humor when their imaginations are given free play. 

The student-run animation workshop is designed to foster imaginative play in an environment that also demands precision and teamwork. 

The originality of the kids' animation, and their enthusiasm, are constant inspirations.  Keeping the right energy in a room full of kids pursuing their ideas full tilt is at times challenging, but always energizing. 

                                                           Eliot Widaen, Creative Director and Founder  

    wehearyou.net.

Confident problem-solvers, who can work creatively in teams, are needed to surmount the numerous challenges humans and our planet face.   The skills and confidence nurtured by this collaborative workshop will be invaluable to our young citizens going forward.  

Watching young children teach each other as they play is a source of great hope for the future.  It is also a pleasure being part of their playful discovery.

It is impossible to express how much your contributions have meant to the program and to the children who look forward to participating every week.

 

Last year's small pool of generous contributions allowed the organization to buy two computers, an iPad, four more camera set ups and pay several excellent assistants for their help in the workshop, along with domain name and hosting services.   This year we need to hire a few excellent contractors-- a grant writer, web designer, recruiter, business/marketing adviser, accountant-- to help bring the program to more children.

We have some pretty good perks this year which you can review to the right.  If you've ever wanted a child inscribed Idea Book to carry in your pocket, or a credit at the end of an original animation, please take a look at these unique perks. 

Every dollar contributed goes 100% to advancing the program.   We hope to raise enough funds in the near future to enable us to give scholarships to families and discounts to places that would benefit greatly from the program but who could not otherwise afford the fee for services.

Our ultimate goal is to work with children the system has labeled "at risk" and largely given up on.   We'd like to give these kids the chance to create animation and express ideas that show their playfulness, competence and inventiveness.  

The program could live at a school for years, with skilled children teaching beginners, once it's in place.  A very small investment for equipment (about $1,000) with a huge potential pay off.

The program has worked everywhere it's been done, from a residential home for troubled children, to public elementary schools, to a summer day camp and private parties.  Children begin to create original animation within minutes of the portable workshop's arrival.  A short time later the children are producing all aspects of the animation and posting it on the internet.

The potential of the program has only begun to be tapped.   We need your support to bring it to more children.  Your donations are tax deductible.

We invite everyone who is interested to contact us and arrange to visit a workshop.   There is no substitute for being inside the beehive of children's creativity to understand the unique value of the program

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough, we know that not everyone is in a position to donate money. There are other ways to help the program that we'd appreciate just as much as money.

Help us get the word out, send this page to all your friends.  Share our campaign on facebook, twitter, etc.  There is a "share" link right here on the Indiegogo page that you can use to send the link instantly.

We need creative people interested in working with children, creative people with business expertise and an ability to think outside the box.

We welcome people with imagination, enthusiasm and a desire to help be part of the change they want to see in the world.

We are also always looking for:  used macBooks, iPads, digital cameras, art supplies and musical instruments.

And we thank you, one and all.  Please stop by and visit us at wehearyou.net.
