story:
Hello friends! 

When I moved to Armenia, Colombia to begin my professional teaching career I knew there would be great opportunities to learn about community development from a Colombian cultural perspective. At my school I was fortunate enough to meet several like-minded teachers who are active in the local community. One inspiring fellow teacher was helping to found a grassroots organization called Casa Nuestra.  

Casa Nuestra is currently supporting a new school in the rural community of Barcelona Alta (nearby Circasia, Quindio). The organization has created a youth center that houses international volunteers who bring personal talents and expertise to teach youth new skills and ways of life through experiential learning. This provides youth with structured programming throughout the week that helps broaden minds and engage members of the community.  

To date a group of teachers and I have volunteered in several different projects, here are some examples of what we've done so far:

- Arts and Crafts: creating a community canvas, music classes, devil sticks from reusable materials (bamboo and old bike tubes).

- Culinary Classes: teaching youth about what goes into a recipe and how we get energy from healthy food -- we've cooked pizza from scratch, simple smoothies, and black bean burritos.

- Physical Education: we like to introduce different games and activity to teaching about fundamental movement skills and different ways to stay active (i.e. Tai Chi, Soccer, Ultimate Frisbee, proper posture, etc.) 

- Projects: the latest larger scale project La Casa Nuestra has embarked on is building a playground from sustainable materials such as, bamboo, old tires, tubing, etc. 

They've housed other volunteers that have specialized in areas such as agricultural engineering, fine arts, coding, crocheting and plan to welcome many more!

This year I began training for Medellin Maraton De Flores, my second fundraiser marathon (http://maratonmedellin.com/) while volunteering at Casa Nuestra. I thought to myself, where can I direct the funds? Where can resources be used most efficiently? I thought Casa Nuestra! Check out their mission statement: 

MISSION STATEMENT- Fundacion Futuro con Futuro’s mission is to generate and promote healthy alternatives in vulnerable communities of Colombia.  Based in Barcelona Alta, Quindio the foundation facilitates educational programs that promote sustainable food security, micro-economies, environmental awareness and protection, fitness and team building, natural health care, and community planning. The foundation works directly with the local school system,  and also houses international volunteers that participate in projects. 

The school is currently very small and in need of resources to help develop the programs. After meeting with the founders and main volunteers we generated a list of 42 (one for each kilometer of the race) different packages that can be purchased as a donation to the organization. Here is what we came up with: 

Hygiene Kit - Hand soap, reusable towels (x10 at $8.30) 

School Material Kit - Notebooks, pencils, crayons, posters, scissors, glue (x8 at $12.49)

Art Kit - Paint, brushes, canvas, paper, pencils (x5 at $16.66) 

Drum Sticks (x5 at $8.30)

Guitar (x3 at $41.64)

Percussion Instruments (x5 at $33.31)

White Board (x1 at $49.97)

Construction Grade Work Table ($83.29)

1/2 The Cost of a Baking Oven (x2 at $124.93)

Gas Tank (for oven) (x1 at $41.64)

Stainless Steel Table (x1 at $62.46)

Aside from the 5% that Indiegogo charges on the fundraising platform (that I plan to cover) 100% of funds donated to Casa Nuestra will go towards these resources. 

This will not only have an impact on the children and workers at the school but will provide a foundation for future generations in this great community! I see this program as a safety net of sorts that will teach the youth how to make healthy choices inside and outside the classroom. I truly believe that a strong community helps people create a meaningful sense of belonging and purpose in life. Supporting my campaign will help develop my skills in community building, allowing me to gain invaluable experience, and help others.

I'll leave you with one of my favourite metaphors,  Indra's Jeweled Net. Imagine Casa Nuestra and the community is supported by a beautiful jewel net. At each juncture in the net there lies a member of the community (a jewel themselves). Each jewel reflects the light of all the other jewels in the community. They are intrinsically connected to all of the others. If one jewel is polished their light becomes stronger and amplified throughout the net. When one is strengthened so becomes the net. I see the light in each of these youth in this community, help make them shine brightly!   

Kind Wishes,

Nicholas Ormond

"Help me to be less fearful of the measure of time, and more fully alive in the time that simply is. Help me to live time, not just to simply use it; to breathe it in, and return it in acts of love and presence."

 - AVIS CROWE

1/2 The Cost of a Baking Oven (x2 at $124.93)
Gas Tank (for oven) (x1 at $41.64)
Stainless Steel Table (x1 at $62.46)
Aside from the 5% that Indiegogo charges on the fundraising platform (that I plan to cover) 100% of funds donated to Casa Nuestra will go towards these resources. 
This will not only have an impact on the children and workers at the school but will provide a foundation for future generations in this great community! I see this program as a safety net of sorts that will teach the youth how to make healthy choices inside and outside the classroom. I truly believe that a strong community helps people create a meaningful sense of belonging and purpose in life. Supporting my campaign will help develop my skills in community building, allowing me to gain invaluable experience, and help others.
I'll leave you with one of my favourite metaphors,  Indra's Jeweled Net. Imagine Casa Nuestra and the community is supported by a beautiful jewel net. At each juncture in the net there lies a member of the community (a jewel themselves). Each jewel reflects the light of all the other jewels in the community. They are intrinsically connected to all of the others. If one jewel is polished their light becomes stronger and amplified throughout the net. When one is strengthened so becomes the net. I see the light in each of these youth in this community, help make them shine brightly!   
Kind Wishes,
Nicholas Ormond
"Help me to be less fearful of the measure of time, and more fully alive in the time that simply is. Help me to live time, not just to simply use it; to breathe it in, and return it in acts of love and presence."
 - AVIS CROWE

story:
Short Summary

As a spokesperson for survivors of Complex-PTSD (C-PTSD) it is my passion to be a voice in their darkness. After much contemplation, I have decided, to share my personal battle with Complex-PTSD and my determination to never feel powerless again. Using my story as an example I will be digging deep into the reality of living with this mental illness. I will be sharing how after a victimized childhood, where I suffered overwhelming continuous abuse, I rose from the depths of C-PTSD and rebuilt my life.

Through this book, it is my goal to raise public awareness about the symptoms and complications of C-PTSD and, while it can be a life sentence, it is manageable with help and self-care. I have been on a quest to learn all I can, about how Complex-PTSD took over my life as a child and what can be done to prevent it from happening to others or, at the very least manage its symptoms. It is important to me that I help remove the stigma of mental illness so that the traumatized can feel comfortable to speak freely about their pain.

Included in this book will be an educational component where I will bring together my personal experience with C-PTSD with my background in social work and victimology education as well as my victim services training to include several resources. Some of these resources will include: the signs and symptoms of Complex-PTSD; the Children’s Aid Societies’ Duty to Report; the domestic violence Power and Control Wheel; a list of rooms in your home to stay clear of during domestic violence and why; the symptoms of strangulation and the importance of getting immediate help; and insights into pets as victims of domestic violence. 

By providing these resources and insights, victims, their friends and loved ones, frontline workers, the mainstream public, and whomever would like to be informed, can help and better understand where survivors are coming from. Your generous support will help make this happen.

What I Need & What You Get

My campaign-funding goal is $30,000.00. This amount will cover expenses for me to send the manuscript of this book off to be edited (takes approximately 3-4 months to complete), and afterwards published, marketed, and distributed. This funding amount will also include promotion costs and travel and accommodation when required.

I have done my due diligence and to make sure that this book is taken seriously and receives the credibility it deserves, I have made the decision to have the manuscript of this book professionally edited and published.

Where expenses are concerned: publishers no longer have big budgets to give their new writer’s advances. As such, it is their expectation, that with their guidance, I will do the promotion and marketing of this book on my own time and at my own expense. It is common practice for publishing companies to only start paying out royalties after nine months to one year after the book is published. After that the royalties are paid on a quarterly basis, which means a new writer can wait a long time before they see any financial compensation for their work, especially at the beginning of the promotion and marketing stage. Also, Indiegogo charges a percentage for their Crowdfunding services and the credit card companies do as well for processing the payments.

After I receive the campaign funding, the tax person will eventually cometh and I will be taxed for the funds in the year that I receive them. I will be expected to provide a detailed accounting of where the monies have been spent.

To thank you for backing my campaign, I have put together “Perks” for each of my supporters. To show my gratitude I will be acknowledging each of and every one of you through listing your names as a contributor who has helped me make the reality of this book happen.

The Impact

Your generous contributions will be helping bring insight into the reality of children who have developed Complex-PTSD and the toll it can take on their mental health. And how the symptoms can spill over and haunt their adult years. You will be letting survivors know they are not alone, and there is hope for healing and having the life they wish for. This book will open doors to help me get the message across.

To help make this happen, I will be designing a launch strategy for when the book comes hot off the presses. I will be throwing a book launch networking party (you’re all invited) to create awareness, and generate excitement. So that this book doesn’t end up collecting dust on the bookstore shelves, waiting for someone to show up to purchase it, I will be spending a great deal of my time and effort personally promoting and marketing the book to target audiences who can benefit from it most. I will be keeping the buzz going any way I can, including attending networking events and conferences.

I am committed to making this book about Complex-PTSD a success and will be reaching out to bookstores, front-line workers, colleges and universities, my social media platforms, as well as setting up a website, writing blogs and articles for promotion, and sending out press releases. I will be continuously building networking relationships so that I eventually have a fan base, which will help promote the book on my behalf.

I am committed to raising awareness about Complex-PTSD and helping those who have developed it to find their way to healing and your support can help make this happen.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the challenges I expect to encounter and will work diligently to get past, will be:

  • Branding and marketing myself
  • Knocking down barriers
  • Making myself a household name
  • Becoming the "expert" for those seeking knowledge, assistance, and support
  • Creating and understanding that there is definitely a difference between PTSD (triggered by a one time event) and Complex-PTSD (occurs after long-term chronic, repeated trauma) and the impact it can have on the victim

Since I am completely dedicated to speaking out about the reality of dealing with Complex-PTSD, I am determined to meet the challenges of promoting this book. It is my wish to have this book become the go to choice for anyone wanting to be enlightened about the "complexities" of Complex-PTSD.

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be greatly appreciated, if you would help make some noise about this campaign by getting the word out to your contacts and social media platforms. Thanks a bunch! P.S. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Summary

The NYU Voice Center is a world leader in patient care, education, and research regarding disorders of voice, swallowing, and airway disorders. In this collaboration with our friends at Fit for Broadway, we seek to empower singers to see themselves as vocal athletes, and ultimately, destigmatize vocal recovery. Many singers experience shame or guilt due to injury, or simply symptoms of overuse due to strenuous vocal demand. 

Through this collaboration, we are thrilled to offer a limited edition “I’m on Vocal Rest” shirt created by Fit for Broadway Apparel to support this initiative. Your donation will support the research efforts at the NYU Voice Center, and you get a cool shirt supporting the mission! 

What You Get

Patients frequently ask how they can help support the work of investigators at the NYU Voice Center. In collaboration with our friends at Fit for Broadway, we now offer, "I'm on Vocal Rest” shirts. This message is intended to show your support for the Center as well as the expand the initiative for vocal muscle recovery. In addition, our collaboration mission is intended to reduce the stigma associated with voice disorders, injury or recovery. Can you imagine if a hockey player broke his nose on the rink and was then ashamed to see a doctor? Why should this be the case for vocal athletes?

The Impact

Did you know that cricothyroid approach to in-office vocal fold injection augmentation was first described by Dr. Milan Amin, the Director of the NYU Voice Center. The Center has a long history of innovation and the development of novel approaches to challenging disorders.

In addition to clinical research, laboratories led by Drs. Ryan Branski and Aaron Johnson serve as incubators for scientific discovery with the ultimate goal of translating laboratory findings to patient care.

Your support will directly enhance these efforts. Funds generated by this campaign will be directed to our research initiatives.

To learn more

Please visit www.nyuvoicecenter.org. Also, we would love to hear from you. Please call Center at (646) 754-1207 or send us an email at voicecenter@med.nyu.edu.

The NYU Voice Center now has two locations:

345 East 37th Street, Suite 306            355 West 52nd Street, 8th Floor
New York, NY 10016                    New York, NY 10019

story:
Children deserve to be heard.

What if there was a way we could help children.

What if we can help children to better express themselves? 

And better express their emotional needs?

I’m Tina Bangel and I am a vocal coach, singer/songwriter and founder of One Voice School of Singing. Over the past 2 decades, working closely with the talented and wonderful kids of One Voice, I’ve come to learn and understand the power of singing. It brings confidence to a shy child, it lifts the spirit and taps into their soul.

Singing helps kids deal with everyday situations. It’s also a way to help express themselves and also a way to help deal with their emotions.

And now the students of One Voice have banded together to create Project Be Heard.

Project Be Heard aims to bring awareness that music can be a powerful tool to help change children’s lives.

We need to raise $2000 to fund our project Be Heard film clip with an aim to inspire more children to not be afraid to be expressive and sing out.  We aim to launch the clip world wide and during our 2016 end of year concert.

But really, we want to do more than make our film clip. We want to raise funds to help kids impacted by trauma.

Emotional expression through music can be so beneficial in kids’ lives, but can be really challenging, especially for children who have gone through trauma. 

Childhood trauma can have lifelong impacts. In Australian communities, childhood trauma can be linked to mental illness, homelessness, drug and alcohol dependencies, broken relationships or unemployment.

What if there was a place where kids could be themselves?

What if they could be seen,

be heard….

A place like that exists, it’s called KidsXpress – a non-profit organisation providing therapy programs which use music and the creative arts to give kids facing significant life challenges a place where they can really figure things out, explore their thoughts and feelings and find their own ways to cope.

 

One Voice School and I invite you to help us raise funds for KidsXpress, hopefully enough to fund a child’s place in the KidsXpress program. $3000 pays for one child to access their full 10 week KidsXpress Therapy Program and associated support.

It’s our students way to give back to the community and it is also a way to teach them that they can use their gifts to help change the world.

By giving back to this cause you will not only support be changing the trajectory of a child's life but we will also include a few perks to help YOU feel amazing and expressive.  

Whether it be bringing the gift of song to your own community (playgroup, church choir or school) or even to help you get started with being expressive yourself with some singing lessons, via Skype or privately. There is also a perk where One Voice and I can sing at your next event and put  a smile on your guests faces!

Challenges

We are crossing our fingers to reach our goals but if we don't we will split the funds raised towards our clip and to KidsXpress.

One Voice can change the world

Your contribution will have a ripple effect in not only a child's life but a families life. You can read how KidsXpress has changed so many families lives after going through their Therapy program at this link: http://kidsxpress.org.au/our-story/#success-stories

Other ways to help

If you can't contribute, you can help in other ways:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our Project Be Heard campaign.
  • It's simple to share, just use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share it with someone who believes in the power of the voice.

story:
We’re created a chat bot that uses a reactive script to reach 18-24 year olds in key constituencies. 

The bot does three things:

  1. Give tailored reasons why they should vote tactically for a progressive party in their area 
  2.  Sending them a link to their polling station and reminding them to vote on 8am 8th June
  3. Asking them to recruit their friends.

[WE NOW HAVE ENOUGH £££, ] please help us by recruiting 18-25 year olds who can lend their tinder profiles. They can be based anywhere as our bot will assign them a location in a key marginal. Message yara or charlotte. 

This is a women-led project run by volunteers. We’re not working with any political parties.

Please donate what you can and share.

story:
Website: https://ucdavisgoals.wordpress.com/

 

Our Mission Statement:

GOALS (Girls' Outdoor Adventure in Leadership and Science) seeks to cultivate and embolden the next generation of STEM leaders through a free, immersive, field-based summer science program for high school girls. The program uses an inclusive definition of ‘girls’ and welcomes all trans*, cis, genderqueer, and non-binary youth who may identify with girlhood.

We empower our students to participate in STEM careers and environmental stewardship by teaching a culturally sustaining, place-based curriculum. Girls experience and co-create hands-on lessons that integrate science, outdoors skills, and leadership skills all while tapping into students’ natural curiosity and problem-solving abilities.

Ultimately, GOALS seeks to reduce racial and gender gaps in STEM careers by:

· Minimizing barriers to participation in outdoor education

· Nurturing interest in knowledge production and scientific inquiry

· Supporting and guiding career path exploration

· Teaching tangible skills and frameworks for future scientific learning

· Providing access to tools and resources for college readiness

· Creating peer support networks

· Mentoring by women in the field

These impact areas were strategically selected to positively influence STEM interest, postsecondary STEM enrollment, and STEM retention.

 

Learn More About Our Partners:

Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks: https://www.nps.gov/seki/index.htm

John Muir Institute of the Environment: http://johnmuir.ucdavis.edu/

 

Our Inspiration:

GALS (checkout their website here!) was started by four PhD students at Duke University who led their first trip in the summer of 2017 in North Carolina. Now, they have expanded their program to include trips in multiple states! The GALS folks were invaluable resources to us as we started this UC Davis sister chapter inspired by their program. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread the word! You can access everything you need on our website in English and en Español 

Donate Gear! We will gladly accept gently used gear for our participants to use on their trip!  Contact us at goals.ucdavis at gmail dot com to coordinate. 

Know a Potential Sponsor? Let us know! We'll reach out to them if we haven't already.

Start a Program at Your School! Contact us at goals.ucdavis at gmail dot com and we'll share all the details, tips, and tricks with you!

story:
Khan Academy has been providing free world class education to anyone, anywhere, anytime. It offers over 6000 world-class video lessons and 100,000+ interactive exercises in math, science and other subjects. With Khan Academy, students learn while having fun, and parents and teachers can easily follow their performance. We want to let the children of Bangladesh participate in this global community of 53 Million learners worldwide!

With that goal, we, at Agami are working to translate Khan Academy content into Bangla, create awareness and drive adoption in schools.

Khan Academy Bangla can complement traditional education in Bangladesh by offering the following benefits:

Free access to innovative educational content

  • Students can self-study in absence of trained teachers or easy access to schools
  • Teachers can enrich existing lesson plans

IT based user-friendly, interactive platform

  • Invites students & teachers to explore new IT skills
  • Opens opportunities to enhance IT infrastructure in schools

We have already translated over 2,000 videos and many more exercises resulting in the launching of Khan Academy Bangla at https://bn.khanacademy.org/ in 2016. 

But, we need to do much more – your donation will help us to translate another 1,000 videos, and related exercises and make those available to millions of Bangladeshi children, as a FREE online resource. In addition, we will offer teacher training and implementation support to interested schools, specially in under- privileged communities so they can start using these videos and exercises in classrooms.

   

Resources: 

http://khanacademybangla.org/

https://bn.khanacademy.org/

https://www.youtube.com/user/KhanAcademyBangla

https://www.facebook.com/KABangla/
story_txt:

It offers over 6000 world-class video lessons and 100,000+ interactive exercises in math, science and other subjects. With Khan Academy, students learn while having fun, and parents and teachers can easily follow their performance. We want to let the children of Bangladesh participate in this global community of 53 Million learners worldwide!With that goal, we, at Agami are working to translate Khan Academy content into Bangla, create awareness and drive adoption in schools.Khan Academy Bangla can complement traditional education in Bangladesh by offering the following benefits:Free access to innovative educational content
Students can self-study in absence of trained teachers or easy access to schools
Teachers can enrich existing lesson plans
IT based user-friendly, interactive platform
Invites students & teachers to explore new IT skills
Opens opportunities to enhance IT infrastructure in schools
We have already translated over 2,000 videos and many more exercises resulting in the launching of Khan Academy Bangla at https://bn.khanacademy.org/ in 2016. But, we need to do much more – your donation will help us to translate another 1,000 videos, and related exercises and make those available to millions of Bangladeshi children, as a FREE online resource. In addition, we will offer teacher training and implementation support to interested schools, specially in under- privileged communities so they can start using these videos and exercises in classrooms.   Resources: http://khanacademybangla.org/https://bn.khanacademy.org/https://www.youtube.com/user/KhanAcademyBanglahttps://www.facebook.com/KABangla/

story:
SUPPORT THE ICE LAB

www.zamrize.org/donate.html

 

Hi I’m Joy, Founder of Zamrize. As a technologist with a computer science degree from Georgia Tech, I have a unique opportunity as a Fulbright Fellow to spend seven months in Zambia to establish an Integrative Computational Experience (ICE) Lab to empower Zambian youth to become creators of technology.

In partnership with local organizations, Zamrize will provide support, training and hands-on expertise to help accelerate impact projects and promote social entrepreneurship. 

I would like to extend a global invitation to help us launch this innovative pilot program. 

Through Zamrize, your support of the ICE Lab will ensure diverse participation in the new technology economy by providing a curriculum and hands-on learning lab focused on three foundational elements: Exposure, Education & Entrepreneurship. 

 

 

WHY ZAMBIA?

The prolific adoption of mobile and communications technology across Africa spurred by economic growth on a continent that holds claim to half of the fastest 20 growing economies in the world (including Zambia) —  has not been matched by a labor market equipped to participate in emerging knowledge based economies. 

Zambia is ripe for an entrepreneurial awakening — with a growing population of talented, smart, resourceful innovators in need of additional resources & training. 

YOUR SUPPORT ESTABLISHES ICE LAB 

With your help we will implement the next phase of Zamrize targeting 20 students, who will learn web and mobile development skills along with entrepreneurial thinking through impact projects like WRAPP that address local challenges.

10K GOAL

Your support will provide equipment for the lab, including:

  • Laptops

  • Smartphones

  • Tablets

along with:

  • Curriculum Materials and Development

  • Transportation for Participants

Further funding will help support the integration of impact projects to promote the creation of accessible digital content for education, health and agriculture.

 

REWARDS

Zamrize Perks are about empowering YOU to turn your ideas into reality while supporting the establishment of the ICE Lab.     

 

WHY SUPPORT ZAMRIZE?

SHORT TERM IMPACT

  • Trained entrepreneurial software developers earning money

  • Replicable curriculum for teaching entrepreneurial thinking and web/mobile development
  • Relevant applications/digital content available to Zambians.

LONG TERM IMPACT

  • In country capacity to fulfill currently outsourced software development jobs from local companies

  • Greater visibility of Africans in technology fields

  • Increased female participation in technology fields

  • Establishment of a robust digital distribution platform will deliver content relevant in language and context to growing number of plugged in Zambians

 

IMPACT PROJECT: WRAPP 

 

As the first impact outcome of the ICE Lab Method from March - April 2013, Zamrize facilitated the creation of WRAPP — Zambia's groundbreaking Women's Rights Application.

 

Mobile web version of the application is available here: http://zamrize.org/wrapp

 

 

"Fantastic App, Eye Opening, Empowering" - Merrick Furst

 

 

IMPACT PROJECTS PIPELINE

 

The Zamrize ICE Lab focuses on motivating learning with impact projects that create value for the local community.

 

Current Pipeline

 

  • iSchool: Educational Content

  • iHealth: Essential well-being and medical information

  • iFarm: Local horticulture and animal husbandry methods

  • Tourism: Promoting culture, incredible landscapes, and wildlife for economic growth

     

 

 

iSchool is revolutionizing education in Zambia by:

 

  • digitizing the entire Zambia school curriculum grades 1-7 in 8 languages

  • providing necessary teacher training

  • leveraging lessons learned from a 2.5 year pilot with 2,500 students

  • pioneering the zedupad tablet to deliver content

 

The digitization of lessons is currently being done overseas given a lack of local capacity. iSchool is willing to use local developers if reliable capacity can be established in country and is partnering with Zamrize to use ICE Lab to do a feaibility test. iSchool Integration will build on lessons learned from the WRAPP experience and has been identified as a partner that could also provide a physical home for the Zamrize ICE Lab in a new teacher training facility being planned.  www.ischool.zm 

With your help, Zamrize can be an impact platform for social change through the ICE Lab and community impact projects!

Be a founding supporter and join us — together we rise! 

www.zamrize.org

 

MEDIA

 

About Joy Buolamwini

Joy Buolamwini is a Rhodes Scholar, a Fulbright Fellow, a Stamps Scholar, a two-year recipient of the Astronaut Scholarship, a Google Anita Borg Scholar,  and a Carter Center technical consultant recognized as a distinguished volunteer. At the Carter Center, she created an android-based mobile surveying solution that was used to survey nearly 40,000 people in  Ethiopia  to help eliminate blinding Trachoma for over 17 million people.  She has presented the work internationally and the tools are now used worldwide to combat other neglected tropical diseases. At Georgia Tech she conducted research on health informatics as well as social robotics and autism graduating with highest honors with a bachelor's degree in Computer Science. As a Fulbright Fellow in Zambia, she is working with local organizations and computer science education experts as well as practitioners to empower Zambian youth to become creators of technology as the Executive Director of the Zamrize initiative. To this role she brings 8 years of software development experience in web and mobile platforms.

She was recently appointed to the Georgia Tech OMS CS Board as Ambassador to Africa in order to help increase the number of computer science professionals worldwide.

After starting a freelance development company in high school, Joy has gone on to establish businesses spanning augmented reality and educational technology (founding Chief Technology Officer of Excelegrade).  She recently graduated from Flashpoint, a start-up accelerator program, as a cofounder of Techturized INC, a hair care technology company, that has launched the Madame You platform. A former pole-vaulter and Pepsi Scholar Athlete of the year for the Mid-south region, Joy enjoys playing guitar, drawing, writing and working-out. Joy’s mission is to show compassion through computation and encourage underrepresented groups in computer science to become full participants in the creation of the future.

Contact: joy@zamrize.org

story:
Introduction

 

      In the fall of 2012, working with University of Virginia surgeons Dr.Forrest Calland and Dr. Robin Petroze, Art With a Mission / Charlottesville was founded by artists Renee Balfour and Jim Respess.

The goal of our organization is to facilitate a mutual exchange of education and the arts while connecting diverse international communities.

Art With A Mission provides opportunities in the arts to children who have financial need. Artists, while in residence, will connect with children in their communities to promote communication through artistic expression. Children will work with professional artists in the fields of music, dance and the visual arts. 

 We are currently working with Art With a Mission/ Kigali to establish an ongoing exchange between Kigali, Rwanda and Charlottesville Virginia.


       In October 2012 Rwandan artists Emmanuel Nkuranga and Innocent Nkurunziza , directors of the Inema Art Center in Kigali, traveled to Charlottesville to exhibit work by 8 Rwandan  artists. A one month exhibition was mounted at the McGuffey Art Center, organized by Renee Balfour, Jim Respess, Dr Calland and medical students from the University of Virginia. All proceeds from the exhibition were donated by the McGuffey Art Center to further programming for children at the Inema Art Center in Kigli.

(http://mcguffeyartcenter.com/)

(https://www.facebook.com/pages/Inema-Arts-Center/402598333168213)

.

 The Project


       In May and June of 2013, Renee Balfour and Jim Respess will travel to Kigali and work with the directors of Inema, developing opportunities for aid in the support of an ongoing exchange. While in Kigali, Renee and Jim will  assist in the development of children's art programming at the Inema Art Center. 

      With support from the Global Health Center at the University of Virginia we will work to develop and expand opportunities for arts internships, establishing ongoing international cultural exchange. Through the hands on experiences of these internships, students will have the opportunity to directly assist in ongoing program development.

     In August and September of 2013, Emmanuel and Innocent will travel to Charlottesville to work with children, creating an artistic exchange between the two communities. Their programming in Charlottesvile will reflect the work done by Renee and Jim in Kigali.

     While in Rwanda, Renee and Jim will spend three weeks teaching children in three orphanages in Kigali.  While in Charlottesville, Emmanuel and Innocent will teach classes to children at the McGuffey Art Center. All classes will be funded by Art With A Mission /Charlottesville and be open and free to all students. The completed work, along with photo and video documentation, will be exhibited in October of 2013 at the McGuffey Art Center. A similar exhibition of the children's work will take place at the Inema Art Center in the Spring of 2014. 100% of all proceeds during the exhibitions will support ongoing children’s art programming in both communities.

As part of the exchange, during the exhibition artists will reach out to the community through scheduled talks and presentations at schools and other public venues. 

      Renee will paint with the children in Charlottesville and Kigali to further education through art. The theme of the project will focus on the local and global issues of clean water as seen through the eyes of children. Children will creatively express their views through paintings. Paintings from both communities will be displayed together with additional support material from the project.

       Jim will work with children in Charlottesville and Kigali to address issues surrounding shelter and water through creative problem solving in sculpture. Fabrication will differ from place to place using different available materials. Photographic and video documentation of this process in both communities will be exhibited with the paintings during the course of the exhibition.

       An artistic exchange between communities will develop an ongoing program in education  and the arts while enriching the artistic experience of children while broadening the awareness of cultural diversity as seen through artistic expression.

 

 Funding/What we need 

       We are currently raising funds to support the initial phase of this project. This phase includes travel expenses for the exchange of two US artists to Rwanda as well as two Rwandan artists to the US. Funding will also assist in the purchase of project materials, which will include the cost of paint, canvas and brushes. In addition, the funding will support the initial costs of the exhibition in the United States and Rwanda.

       The broadening of cultural diversity as seen through artistic expression will expand the understanding of cultural differences and similarities in both communities.

 Please be sure to look at the gallery tab at the top of this page.

About the founders of Art With A Mission/Charlottesville

 

            Renee Balfour has a degree in Painting and Printmaking as well as a minor in Art History from the Virginia Commonwealth University. She has been a working artist for over thirty years, exhibiting internationally and receiving numerous awards. She has also taught art to children for 22 years. Ms Balfour founded Art With Heart, which raised money through the arts in the support of the University of Virginia Children’s Hospital. She is co-author of the Virginia Visual Arts Resource Directory and is a past president of the McGuffey Art Center, where she maintains a studio and continues to teach and develop children’s programming in the arts.

 

            Jim Respess has an MFA from the Virginia Commonwealth University Sculpture Department. A Charlottesville native, he has exhibited both regionally and nationally, and has taught sculpture and Art History at several area colleges, additionally working in the public school system as a tutor and activities coordinator. Currently he is a resident artist at the McGuffey Art Center, where he teaches children’s art and is the chair of the Gallery Committee, responsiblefor curating and mounting up to 55 exhibitions a year.

story:
Short Summary

Help us kick start the dreams of 10 teens of the Kingfisher Flight Club by providing them a chance to obtain their pilot license. Help both boys and girls, to become interested in flight and open to them the possibility of becoming pilots! The funds for this particular campaign will be used to provide 10 teens their very own Pilot's License. Any excess funding received will go towards the flight club obtaining aircraft and other tools necessary to help the flight club attain their goals. Future campaigns will call for purchasing small aircraft for these clubs. The more you give, the more that can be accomplished!

What We Need

The cost of obtaining a pilot license averages from $7,000 to $10,000 and is contantly rising. We need $80,000 to help 10 teens fulfill their dreams of flying and kick start their careers; like Amelia Earhart who followed her dream of flying and pioneered the future of flying freedom. The teens selected are established by the Kingfisher Flight Club members themselves in an unbiased and equal opportunity bases.

Plus! Any excess funding will go toward inspiring kids of all ages, both boys and girls, to become interested in flight. 

SHORTAGE OF PILOTS: In the United States there is and will continue to be a shortage of pilots. At times some US airlines have used European and South American pilots to fill the gap. Inspiring kids now to become pilots will help ensure the Future of Flying Freedom for all.

The Impact

Please keep in mind that this program is not just pie in the sky (excuse the pun), but rather a proven method that has become self sustaining through the kids own enthusiasm. The working model of success is proven via the first club of it's kind, the Kingfisher Flight Club, and has a signup roll of over 100 members. We will take this model of success and replicate it in many other communities.

The idea began when the Kingfisher Library in rural Oklahoma sponsored a Flight Simulator for use by kids and teenagers. The idea caught on quickly! So we started a new club and called it the Kingfisher Flight Club. The Library supplied the computers and software needed to keep the club operating. Now over 100 kids have signed up for and benefited from this grass roots program. 

Since then Michael R. Tautkus, Director of the Library has organized two separate flight days in which volunteer pilots from the surrounding areas belonging to the EAA Young Eagles program flew into Kingfisher, Oklahoma and enabled over 70 kids from the community to experience small aircraft flights for the first time.

Recognizing how the club had helped to provide focus in the lives of teens, teaching them to interact with others, become responsible and develop leadership skills along with many technical skills inspired Tautkus to create the same types of programs around the United States and in other lands. Tautkus is planning to promote these types of programs in other libraries and schools.

"Today kids and especially teenagers do not have the focus they need in their lives and many become lost to bad influences.", Tautkus said, "This usually starts when kids are in middle school." Providing funding for this project will help kick start other programs geared toward helping these ones find the focus in their lives that will inspire them to become responsible adults. The scope of this program may extend to kids all over the United States and the World if successful. We will depend upon our contributors to provide the funding needed for 10 pilots licenses but additionally excess and will help us evaluate the prospect of moving this program forward into other areas.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute much financially, please tell your local pilots, educators, veterans and others who would be interested to contribute a dollar, 5 dollars, 10 dollars or more. Make as much noise about this as possible. Remember this is not just "pie in the sky", but rather a proven method with a working club of over 100 members.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to help you get the word out!

OTHER WAYS TO FOLLOW US!

For campaign updates you may also follow us on Twitter and Facebook and the Kingfisher Library website. Please see links below.

story:
Students want clean air for their school: 

When students in the Roosevelt Science Club became aware that the air quality around Roosevelt High School was ranked in the lowest 1% amongst schools in the nation they began studying potential solutions.  They discovered that by combining mechanical science with biological science it is possible to recycle polluted air into clean air.  To test their hypothesis students will place special NASA designed planters containing plants in 3 test rooms. They will collect before and after air samples that will help them determine the effectiveness of their project.

Roosevelt science teacher Kendall Jensen is teaming up with Ron Pate (the director of the Second Stories Good SO2lutions initiative) and Kassie Ridley from Portland State University's Department of Environmental Science to assist students on this project. Each believes that releasing students to apply knowledge to real-world situations multiplies the value of their education and also affirms them as valuable contributors to the well-being of their school and neighborhood. Many of these students and/or their family members struggle with conditions that are caused by bad air quality. Nothing could be more vital to making knowledge count than affording this kind of real world applied education opportunity for students.

The health impacts:

A USA Today study constructed with U.S. EPA data in collaboration with Johns Hopkins University places Roosevelt in the "worst" category for cancer causing pollutants and overall chemical toxicity. Even more alarming is that indoor air is typically  from 10 to 100 times worse than surrounding outdoor air. The EPA reports that poor indoor air quality is one of the top 5 threats to human health. In addition, Roosevelt has no air filtering system.

The USA Today report listed dangerous levels of manganese in the air surrounding Roosevelt. Manganese is known to damage the neurological system and cause behavioral problems. There are other dangerous volatile organic compounds (VOC) that aren’t covered in the report. As such, this project can shed valuable light on what is in the air, as well as inform strategies for improving indoor air quality.

The plant and planter installations that are being used in this study have provided significantly cleaner air in related projects, producing a variety of benefits such as:

  • reduction of eye irritations and headaches
  • reduction of respiratory ailments
  • decrease in stress
  • increase in blood oxygen levels by as much as 1%.
  • enhanced productivity and creativity

When a Sierra Club chapter learned that the FEMA trailers that were used after hurricane Katrina contained dangerous levels of formaldehyde, they placed one of the NASA-designed planters inside to test how well it worked at eradicating the formaldehyde. The lab test revealed that the planter had reduced formaldehyde levels by more than 85% -- a level deemed safe. (Wolverton)

Air Testing: The gold standard and most sensitive (and expensive) testing is done by a lab that performs gas chromatograph mass spectometry analysis of air samples, which is briefly shown in the video.  This testing will provide vital information about the existing air quality, as well as measure the effectiveness of the 3 installations in the 3 test rooms.  This is chapter one of the story of air at Roosevelt -- finding out what the students are up against, and finding out what can be effective in their battle for clean air.  With evidence, students would be able to apply for grants to extend the benefits to the rest of the school -- which would help ensure a good ending to this story.      

We need $12,000 to make this project happen!

  • $6,000 pays for air quality equipment, testing, and analysis reports
  • $1,000 pays for NASA planters, plants and related materials
  • $2,000 pays administration fees and the Indie GoGo campaign
  • The remainder is spread across expenses for: a field trip; refreshments; and a small stipend for project direction

How it works:

The students will place a NASA designed planter with a plant (snake plant) in each of 3 test rooms. where before and after air samples will be compared.

The planter utilizes aqua culture with a porous media and activated carbon. A fan inside the planter pulls air from the room down through the plant media filtering system, where it then propels clean air into the room at a rate of 23 cubic feet a minute. The pollutants are captured by the activated carbon where microbes transform it into plant food, which nourishes the plant that releases additional clean oxygen into the air. The video shows a simple illustration of the planter. The plant, microbes, activated carbon, porous media and fan all work in concert to create an efficient air recycling loop system where the activated carbon never has to be replaced.      

If we come up short of the desired $12,000:

We will scale the project down -- specifically, we will use less expensive means of testing the air quality. Any money exceeding the $12,000 will be put in the Roosevelt Science Club to build on the results of this study, such as placing additional planters in other classrooms.

You can also support our project by:

  • Helping get the word out by sharing this project with friends & organizations!

For more information about plants and air quality go to:

Wolverton, B.C. Plants: Why You Can’t Live Without Them.

http://www.ted.com/talks/kamal_meattle_on_how_t...

Neighbors for Clean Air -- http://www.whatsinourair.org/about/

http://content.usatoday.com/news/nation/environment/smokestack/index

http://content.usatoday.com/news/nation/environment/smokestack/methodology

*While Roosevelt High School is not listed by name in the USA Today Report, the address (6941 N. Central St. Portland, OR) is listed as being in the worst 1% of air nationally as well as being the worst in Portland, OR.

story:
Introductions

My name is Daniel Wheeler. For the past four years I’ve been a high school English teacher at Del Valle High School in Austin, TX. I teach a wide range of classes, from Composition 1 (dual credit) to Basic English III  (Special Ed). Our school does not currently have enough computers to serve every student, and so this campaign is an attempt to change things. The students in the classes I teach are seeking your help to equip and empower them with good technology.

Del Valle High School is Title I school in Central Texas. The majority of our students are economically disadvantaged and don’t have access to computers or the internet at home.  Also, because many students work one, if not two jobs outside of school, the only time they have access to computers is at school.

The Problem

A huge problem we face is that we don't have nearly enough computers for our students, and the computers we do have access to are outdated, slow, and or broken.  My goal here is not to blame anyone for the problem, but to simply be proactive. Unfortunately, for the whole English department (Freshman through Seniors)  we only have two laptop stations (aprx. 20 laptops each). In a school with just under 3,000 students, this is not nearly enough laptops. I was a "lucky" teacher in that I was able to reserve these laptop stations for one week out of the entire Fall semester.

Furthermore, out of these two laptop stations, half of the laptops do not work. My students jokingly call them "Dino Laptops" and often use their phones to conduct research and type papers. To reiterate, many of my students are TYPING THEIR RESEARCH PAPERS ON A CELL PHONE! I know kids these days are great at texting and tweeting, but imagine how difficult it must be to type a 4-5 page paper on a phone!

a dead laptop

  a busted screen

a stack of non-working laptops from one station

My students are discouraged by the lack of access to good technology. To read more about their technological struggles, in their own words, go to: Chromebooks for Wheeler

Last month, as I saw 50 students fighting over the 10 laptops that actually worked, and students attempting to type up papers on their phones, I decided something had to be done. My students deserve the same opportunities as students at more privileged schools, and I could not in good conscience do nothing.

I discussed this problem with all my students and sought their input. Together we decided the best course of action was to raise the money ourselves. Launching a crowd-sourcing fundraiser empowers the students to take ownership of the process, learn to advocate for themselves and raise awareness of the technological deficiencies on campus.  Hence, this Indiegogo project:

What We Need

We need $11,700 to purchase a class set of 30 Google Chromebooks, a charging station, and cloud-ready printer. Money raised from this campaign will be given directly to the school district, which will then purchase the devices specifically for my classroom. My students will then have access to a Chromebook every single day they are in my class.

Here's an itemization of how the $11,700 will be used:

  • 30 Google Chromebooks @ $279 a piece

  • 32 Unit Charging Station @ $1740

  • Cloud-ready Printer @ $400

  • IndieGogo Fees @ $700

  • Promotional Material @ $300

 

Why Chromebooks?

  • Students in an English class have all the tools they need in a Chromebook: a web browser, keypad, and Google Apps for Education
  • They are cheap compared to laptops ($279 per unit)
  • They only run a web-browser, so they are super fast, no software to purchase or maintain
  • They hold a charge for a very long time
  • With the built in management console for educators, instructors can manage multiple devices at once (freeze screens, monitor what students are viewing, etc..)
  • No manual setup for different users. You can easily share devices amongst students/teachers

The Impact

When you donate to this campaign you will be making an immediate, direct, and positive impact in the lives of many underprivileged students. There is no middle man here. You will be giving straight to the source. These Chromebooks will be used by all of my students on a daily basis to conduct research, write papers, participate in online communities, do creative projects, and overall impact:

  • 180 students from my roster will be served on a daily basis
  • When my students are not using the Chromebooks, other English III teachers will have access to them, and in this manner, the laptops will potentially serve up to 700 students.

When this campaign is funded, my classroom will be the only classroom on campus equipped with Chromebooks. I hope it will become a pilot program and the beginning of a movement in which students feel empowered to solve their problems.

They are learning to confront their problems head on, to have imagination, and believe that they can create change.

Here's How We'll Say "Thank You!"

My students came up with four different ways to thank you for your generous donations:

  • $25  donations will receive a personalized thank you note from a student
  • $50 donations will receive a personalized thank you note and a class photograph signed by the students
  • $100 donations will receive a personalized thank you note, a class photograph signed by the students, and a #ChromebooksforWheeler Supporter T-Shirt!

      

  • $300 donations will receive a personalized thank you note from a student, a class photograph signed by the students, a #ChromebooksforWheeler Supporter t-shirt, and photograph of the Chromebook being used in the class once the Chromebooks arrive. 

  ** A $300 donation sponsors one Chromebook**

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask your friends/families/co-workers to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.  
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share this page on facebook, twitter, and other social media sites to spread the word!
  • Use the hashtag #ChromebooksForWheeler on your Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram posts about the campaign.
  • Send out personal emails on behalf of the campaign.

And that’s all there is to it!

On behalf of all my students, I cannot  thank you enough for supporting this cause!

story:
The Southern Oregon Pride Festival is Southern Oregon and Ashland's Newest Tradition.

 

Some 500 people, including local politicians, joined the first SO Pride parade through downtown Ashland last October. Hundreds more cheered from Ashland's sidewalks, including visitors from all parts of the Rogue Valley and as far away as San Francisco, Portland, and Idaho.

 

Hundreds followed the parade into Lithia Park for the SO Pride Concert which featured The Rogue Suspects, Karen Lovely, and The Blue Lightning Dance Band. Other people immediately began Pride Hopping - visiting Ashland's shops and restaurants.

 

All the visitors we spoke with promised to return to Ashland for SO Pride 2011, and we promise to make the next SO Pride even bigger and better.

 

To do this we need your support, which is why we are here at IndieGoGo. As a small town in Southern Oregon, with an all inclusive tradition, we are looking for financial assistance. All donations are welcome and greatly appreciated, and will be used for: posters, flyers, street banners, parade cleanup fees, and everything along the way that it takes to make the Southern Oregon Pride Festival a great success.

 

Additionally - should you choose, your name will be include on our website's [ SOPride.org ] supporters page; and as a listed supporter - you can optionally have any of the following links available - to your: Facebook, Twitter, Website, Email Address, Phone Number, and Physical Address.

 

Other ways you can help - are to get the word out there about Southern Oregon Pride are by tweeting, posting on Facebook, and telling your friends.  The links to us are just below.

story:
Our Story

Our names are Kameron, Simon, Katie, Miriam, Nohea, and Emily. We are an international motley crew who all also happen to be friends and teachers of English in Hyogo, Japan! What else do we have in common? We all have a passion to support cross cultural exchange, education, and good times! These common interests are what led us to sign up for a tour with PEPY, an NPO that works to empower and educate Cambodia.

The Impact

Through training and scholarships, PEPY (Promoting Education, emPowering Youth) works to increase the capacity of local populations in Cambodia in order to further develop their communities.  Working alongside organisations and local government structures, the focus is on the education and empowerment of youth. This isn’t a specific ‘teach English’ charity, but one that seeks to re-affirm the national identity and culture of Cambodia. 


To support these projects financially and to raise awareness of them, PEPY runs a number of tours throughout Cambodia. These tours, which are run through a responsible tourism model, serve as fundraisers for the organization, as well as provide a form of tourism which provides support for local communities, minimizes environmental impacts, and provides favorable interaction and cultural exchange between tourists and locals. All in all, a winner. So, instead of staying in hotels, we'll be staying with families. Instead of riding in cars, we'll be riding bikes!


What We Need & What You Get

We'll cover our trip cost, but we need help covering our donation of $2500 to PEPY to support their programs.  We each need to donate $500 to PEPY to support their training, scholarships, and programs, and we need your support to do this. But, it's not without perks! If you send us $10, we'll send you a postcard with a description of what we learned about the community and projects you'll be supporting to express our thanks and let you know exactly what your money went to support.  If you send us a $100, we'll send you a postcard of thanks, along with some delicious snacks from Cambodia or Japan.  Finally, if decide you want to help by donating $500, we'll make sure to take pictures with your names and post them on our Facebook page for this event. We'll also send you a postcard of thanks and our favorite treats from Cambodia or Japan!


Other Ways You Can Help

Lastly, we'd like to ask you to spread the word! Tell your friends and colleagues about this project, go on a PEPY tour yourself, and help us help this great organization!

story:
Help Put America Back to Work

Help put America back to work is a grassroots organization started by Carolina Aitken to help all Americans obtain jobs without having to rely solely on the government. We are Americans for Americans.

We don't send money overseas; we don't send money to any government organizations. It's not that we don't feel for those around the world who are in need, we just believe that if your own house is on fire you should put it out before you run off to put someone else's fire out. We use our money to help unemployed Americans get back on their feet by helping them get a job. All of our resources are used only to put America back to work.

We strongly believe that everyone should have a fighting chance to get a job, and we help. Anyone can contact us for help from anywhere in the United States. We don't want to only help those locally we want to help everyone.

Once again, it's nice to send money off to another part of the country for people in need and help them, but we want to help everyone in every state. Your gift will not only help Americans in California but also in New York. Everyone can contact us for help, and it's always free. So if you are fortunate enough to have a secure job and you can afford to give little to help someone else out, please give today. We can't do this alone, but we'll do what we can for as long as we can! We don't receive any government funding; this is just one group of Americans helping other Americans in a time of need.

During our fundraiser we have partnered with many talented authors and entertainers who have graciously contributed their resources to help reward those who donate to our cause. Once again we would like to thank each and every one of our sponsors.

Thank you.

 

"Help Put America Back to Work"
(Working hand in hand with Irish Eyes Promotions)
(We turn no one down, who needs help.)
This is a free service.
Call: 1-541-592-6169
M-F 10a.m. to 5p.m. (PST)

 

  1. Help teach people how to write resume's


  2. Help fill out job applications

 
  3. Help teach them how to dress for an interview


  4. Help teach them how to achieve a successful interview


  5. Help them (if needed) get cloths to wear to the interview


  6. Help pay for gas to the interview


  7. Help pay for child care while at the interview


  8. Help match them with an employer, for long term

      employment


  9. Help in "Real Estate" with foreclosures or

      finding housing/Shelter

 

10. Help them find local programs offering

      assistance.

 

Other Ways People Can Help

If you are not able to donate at this time, but would still like to help, you can! We are in need of volunteers. If you can type or answer phones we need you! This is a BIG job and we do need all the help we can get. Not only will you make a difference in your community but you will help our entire country.
story_txt:
Help Put America Back to Work
Help put America back to work is a grassroots organization started by Carolina Aitken to help all Americans obtain jobs without having to rely solely on the government. We are Americans for Americans.
We don't send money overseas; we don't send money to any government organizations. It's not that we don't feel for those around the world who are in need, we just believe that if your own house is on fire you should put it out before you run off to put someone else's fire out. We use our money to help unemployed Americans get back on their feet by helping them get a job. All of our resources are used only to put America back to work.
We strongly believe that everyone should have a fighting chance to get a job, and we help. Anyone can contact us for help from anywhere in the United States. We don't want to only help those locally we want to help everyone.
Once again, it's nice to send money off to another part of the country for people in need and help them, but we want to help everyone in every state. Your gift will not only help Americans in California but also in New York. Everyone can contact us for help, and it's always free. So if you are fortunate enough to have a secure job and you can afford to give little to help someone else out, please give today. We can't do this alone, but we'll do what we can for as long as we can! We don't receive any government funding; this is just one group of Americans helping other Americans in a time of need.
During our fundraiser we have partnered with many talented authors and entertainers who have graciously contributed their resources to help reward those who donate to our cause. Once again we would like to thank each and every one of our sponsors.
Thank you.
 

"Help Put America Back to Work" (Working hand in hand with Irish Eyes Promotions) (We turn no one down, who needs help.) This is a free service. Call: 1-541-592-6169 M-F 10a.m. to 5p.m. (PST)

 
  1. Help teach people how to write resume's
   2. Help fill out job applications
    3. Help teach them how to dress for an interview
   4. Help teach them how to achieve a successful interview
   5. Help them (if needed) get cloths to wear to the interview
   6. Help pay for gas to the interview
   7. Help pay for child care while at the interview
   8. Help match them with an employer, for long term
      employment
   9. Help in "Real Estate" with foreclosures or
      finding housing/Shelter
 
10. Help them find local programs offering
      assistance.
 


Other Ways People Can Help
If you are not able to donate at this time, but would still like to help, you can! We are in need of volunteers. If you can type or answer phones we need you! This is a BIG job and we do need all the help we can get. Not only will you make a difference in your community but you will help our entire country.

story:
Welcome!

Hi there, My name is Carl Bradbrook and I'd like to introduce you to this wonderful Neville campaign.

 

This Campaign is for YOU.

When I first was introduced to Neville, there wasn't much available in the way of lectures or audios or even the pdf lectures. None of his books had been narrated and the lectures that were available were very expensive to buy.

His works, although wonderful, were not well known.

 

My Mission

My mission has been to narrate all of Neville's books, to provide enhanced audio lectures and to value add in a variety of ways, so that we can all benefit more from his "Timeless Wisdom" and "Practical Techniques".

 

The Magnificent Seven New Neville Audio Books.

The “Neville Magnificent Seven” campaign is aimed at raising funds to facilitate the recording, editing and publishing the remaining 7 of Neville's magnificent books.

Having already narrated a number of Neville's audio books this will complete the collection and provide the most comprehensive Neville resource for all of us to In-Joy!

 

And, it is much more than that...

Whilst in the recording studio I will be producing some guided audios with specific processes that will help you to get the most out of Neville's teachings.

 

Here is how you can help:

 

This project will run over approximately a 6 month period as there is a lot of work to do. 

  • I have outlined some approximate time frames below on this page for the recording and editing process.
  • What is required is some new equipment, outlined below and to cover the costs of the recording studio time. 
  • When we exceed the target amount additional funds will be used to record more of the trainings to help you get more out of using your wonderful imagination.

 

Awesome Perks for YOU so you can Benefit Immediately!

Perks by the way are the gifts that you receive when you sponsor a campaign on Indiegogo.

And I wanted to make especially sure that you absolutely love the perks that I have prepared for you.

You can fund this campaign by selecting a perk on the top righthand side of this web page where it says "Perks For YOur Contribution"

 

NEW EQUIPMENT - Here are the details of what your funding will be used for:

 

  • New Audio Recording equipment. This is so that I can make higher quality audios. (Estimate $400)

  • New laptop with good specs for recording the audios and faster editing of the audios and the videos. (Ideally a Mac as they are excellent for multimedia) (Estimate $900)

  • Recording studio time which is less expensive when i use my own recording equipment. What is being paid for here is a "background-noise-free zone" where I can record using this equipment. (Estimate $500)

  • New HD video camera with external mic plug and wireless mic. This will be used for the training videos. (Estimate $400)

  • New external hard drive for backing up the audio files (Estimate $100)

  • ABUNDANCE ADVENTURES. This is THE comprehensive and on-going course that I have been working on for the last year.

 

Recording and Editing Time Estimates

 

Based on previous experience I can record during a 2-3 hours period in a day and can narrate 7 to 10 "A4" pages in each session.  (includes breaks I take to read through the material multiple times before narrating each section.) Allow extra time to and from studio.

Editing time can vary depending on the flow of the actual recording. It usually takes around 1.5 plus hours to go through and edit a 1 hour recording. The time depends on how accurate I was in my narration of each paragraph.

So I estimate the following times for the books:

  • Out of This World 31 pages - (Recorded over over 3 days)

  • Prayer The Art Of Believing 24 - (Recorded over over 3 days)

  • Freedom for All 30 pages - (Recorded over over 3 days)

  • Seedtime and Harvest 41 pages - (Recorded over over 4 days)

  • Awakened Imagination and The Search 53 - (Recorded over over 5 days )

  • The Power of Awareness 27 chapters 60 - (Recorded over over 6 days)

  • Your Faith is Your Fortune 27 chapters 81 pages (Recorded over over 8 days)

A total of 320 A4 Pages - 32 days recording over 3 months time span.

Approximately 75 to 100 hours in the studio, plus Approximately 150 hours editing.

These are estimates. I won't know exactly how long this will take until I am in the flow on the project.

 

The Finished New Neville Recordings

 

  1. As I work through the list of books and narrate and edit them I will make them available to you on MP3.

  2. I will keep you posted via the Indiegogo campaign management.

  3. I will also create a CD version that is available in the perks and later via the web site.

REMEMBER: All of the "current" Neville audio recordings and original lectures are available to you NOW via the "perks" when you fund this wonderful campaign.

 

The Impact Your Funding Will Have

Neville's teachings helps change lives!

 

Over 60% of the visitors to my Neville site are new visitors which means that Neville's works continue to reach and inspire new students.

Your contribution to this campaign helps not only make more of Neville's works available in more media formats but also for me to help share what I have learned over the years in practicing those techniques.

As a a learning medium audio is so powerful and multiple listenings to the books exposes students to a ever deeper understanding of the material.

Audio and video are by far the most popular way that people have for learning these days and anything that helps people to learn more efficiently and enjoyably is certainly a good thing.

I hope that my time invested in creating these audios for you enhances and multiplies your experience when you invest your time into learning.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word in Neville communities and on line so that this campaign reaches as many people as possible.

You can post on facebook or twitter and email your friends. It all helps!

Indiegogo has some share tools! You just need to click the link on this page to use them.

story:
Who Am I? What Am I Doing?

Hello Beautiful People! 

My name is Meg and I am 23 year old Bible college graduate. I currently live in Los Angeles but I grew up in the woods of Maine. I made the 3,000 mile trek from Maine to California to attend Life Pacific College in 2009 and have been here every since. 

My decision to attend Bible college has forever changed the course of my life! At the end of my Sophomore year my college rolled out a brand new opportunity for students, study abroad! I immediately jumped at the opportunity, was the very first to apply for the trip and a few short months later I was on a plane with 11 of my peers heading to Israel where we spent three months exploring the land where Jesus himself walked! To say that the Land and the people of the Middle East captured my heart is an understatement. 

Now, being a graduate and having traveled to the Middle East on two separate occasions I have been given the opportunity to return once again! This time I will be leading a group of 8 students, supervising and coordinating their time in Turkey. 

My life was completely changed when I studied abroad as a student and I now have the privilege to lead students in the same opportunity I had! My passion and desire is two fold; one, to see students hearts and minds transformed by the community of study abroad and two, to see the Middle East won for Jesus. I have a passion for both! I desperately want to lead, disciple, and train a generation to seek after Jesus, living in community, learning what it means to really love Jesus and in turn, loving one another. I also desperately want to see hearts all over the world turn to Jesus, but I have a specific passion for the people of the Middle East, a diverse, colorful, beautiful people, who need to see the love of Jesus! 

What I Need & What You Get

So here is what I need your help with - getting me there! I need money, plain and simple. 

The trip will cost about $5,000 for the entire three months. This includes the cost of 

  • Travel/transportation 
  • Food
  • Housing    

It may seem like a pretty big chunk of change but for three months that's a pretty good deal! What this amount doesn't include are my bills that still need to be accounted and payed for while I am gone such as, phone bill & student loans (recent college grad). So I need all the help I can get! 

So why should you give me money? Well, we are the body of Christ, hand and feet extend all over the world and we have been commissioned to love God, love people, and make disciples. Some people were called to go all over the world (me), some people have been give the amazing ability to support, fund and pray for those who go! So there's one answer! Be the hands and feet! 

Another reason as to why you should help me...each of my contributors will receive a unique gift from the Middle East upon my return along with an update of my time oversees! Who doesn't want a cool gift from half way across the world?!

Every little bit helps and I am so grateful for each of your prayers and support in making my dreams come true and helping me and the body of Christ advance the kingdom by training and discipling a generation to love in its purest form!


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that it's not always possible to contribute finacaially but that doesn't mean you can't help me! Spread the word! Share this link of your Facebook or twitter! 

I would also encourage you to do some research and learn a little bit about what's going on in the Middle East and learn how you can love the people just by being educated! 


You are loved, you are beautiful, and you are a child of the King!

story:
Hello family, friends and potential friends!

I have been given the opportunity to go to India from January 3 to March 1, 2014 in a service learning project with CFHI (Child Family Health International)! The first month will be spent in New Delhi, the capital of India. The second month will be spent in clinical rotations in different hospitals and clinics in Mumbai, focusing on confronting the challenges of tropical diseases. The final 20 days, I will stay in Mumbai and hopefully be able to help out in an orphanage and a home for women who were rescued from human trafficking.

I believe in social justice. There are parts of the world that are extremely underserved and India is one of those parts of the world. I hope to one day be a physician in an underserved community, and this opportunity to learn about the health care system in India will help me be a more effective advocate of global healthcare in the future.

I will be forever grateful for your help, support, and prayers! By helping me raise the funds to go on this service learning project, you are serving the people of India by promoting social justice and equality! :-) 

How much I need to raise

$4500 is needed for this awesome opportunity to volunteer my services in clinics, gain insight on global health, and immerse myself in a different culture. This fee that is paid directly to CFHI is used for the community clinics, medical instruments used in these clinics, community building projects, and my housing and meals for the time I am there.

Please help me to better the world by supporting me on this service learning trip!

Other ways you can help!

If you are unable to contribute at this time but still want to help, here's how!

Help me spread the word about this project and share this page to anyone who is willing to advocate for social justice and health care equality! :)

 

If you have any questions or concerns or just want to drop me a line, e-mail me at chang.sharonm@gmail.com

story:
Sara Curry - The Little Missionary

Founded on the Lower East Side of New York in 1896 by Sara Curry, our school is the oldest continuously-operating nursery school in New York City, possibly the United States.  We are a registered non-profit, and we fulfill the mission of our founder to take care of children of working parents.  

In the building donated to her on St. Marks Place, Sara Curry cared for 200 children a day while their parents worked in factories.  After her death, the school continued but by the 1990s was in danger of closing. The building was in disrepair, and enrollment was down to 8 students by 2001.  In order to keep the building, much of the space was rented out to commercial tenants.

In 2001 the Board was restructured, and the community rallied to keep the school alive. With this new Board's hard work, the school began to grow under the direction of Eileen Johnson.  We began to fulfill Sara Curry's mission once again and take in more and more children.

Now the need is great - many schools in the neighborhood have had to close due to high rents, and working parents are in need of an affordable, safe, nurturing environment for their children - just as they were in Sara Curry's time.

Your help will allow us to:

  • Take back our entire building, upgrade and restore it to its original use
  • Provide more tuition assistance to low income families
  • Pay our teachers a fair wage and provide fully funded health insurance
  • Provide space for community use such as Parent Workshops, Advocacy, Community Meetings, Speakers and special events

We Need $20,000 now, to help us reach our final goal of $200,000 by September.

In order to occupy the entire building by September 2014, we need to restructure the outside fire stairs, reinforce the inside staircase, add a full fire alarm system, redo plumbing, and outfit the new classrooms with materials, furniture and supplies.   We also need funding to provide more tuition subsidies for the additional families. 

We have already raised $50,000 through street fairs, raffles, and generous donors.  We are reaching out to foundations, local politicians and businesses to help us reach our goal.   Sara Curry could not have done her great work without the help of benefactors, small and large, who gave her the funds to buy the building.  We need you to help us now, to take back that building and fulfill Sara's mission.

Become a Little Missionary!

Through this campaign we hope to raise $20,000 - and hopefully more.  

Your contribution will make a real difference in a family's life, early childhood is a formative stage and can shape a child's future.   You, like Sara Curry, can make a real difference in the community.  You can spend your money on a fleeting pleasure, or join us on this historic journey to make a difference in the Lower East Side.

Please spread the word!!

Please consider sharing this fundraising project with your family and friends to help spread the word about our campaign.  Share on Facebook or Twitter
