story:
Short Summary


  • I have joined this year a non profit organization called Become, which does volunteer work in Haiti, Central America, Kenya and other places in Africa. My name is Maya Odeh, 22 years old Palestinian living in Haifa-Israel . currently finishing my bachelor degree in international relations and preparing to travel to Kenya :)

    Become supports children, families and communities in developing countries to overcome poverty and injustice. Become invests in self-sustainable, income-generating strategies to help orphans, vulnerable children and their communities meet their basic needs, reach their potential, and BECOME whatever they want to BE.

    • A delegation of talented volunteers traveled to Kenya last summer with Become, to rebuild a clinic, and facilitate a number of community health awareness raising initiatives facilitated by medical experts from our team and Sylvia, Abba's co-director (another organization we will be working woth in kenya) and resident nurse. Rebuilding the clinic has enabled it to reach the next step in receiving certification with the Kenyan Ministry of Health, a critical step in providing top quality health care to a region with few medical resources, as well as to increase the traffic in the clinic bringing more income into supporting the orphans at Abba

What We Need & What You Get

This year we are aiming to :
1-Build 2 houses for the orphanages and a guest house.
2-developing and working on agricultural projects with the elderly in the village that we will be staying in. projects like: gardening, farming with animals and growing vegetables that will help them in yielding profits. this includes giving micro-loans for starting small businesses.
3-activities with the children after school, and assisting them with their curriculum.
4-providing teachers with new computers. plus guiding them on how to use Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Wikipedia, and Google.
5-building ecological sanitary toilets.

My goal as a volunteer is to reach the amount of 2000 US Dollars. So as to provide for the projects listed above.

The Impact

Our vision is based on reaching a reality in which all children regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender, or socioeconomic circumstances, have access to basic human rights. Children worldwide are entitled to food, health care, education, shelter, and a safe environment in which they can grow up to fulfill their potential.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are not able to donate, please help us in spreading the word and sharing it with your friends and family.
    Thank you very much :)
    You can also visit our website :http://www.become-world.org/
    or follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/become.int?fref=ts

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=omjNAYOYN8I
story_txt:
Short Summary  
I have joined this year a non profit organization called Become, which does volunteer work in Haiti, Central America, Kenya and other places in Africa. My name is Maya Odeh, 22 years old Palestinian living in Haifa-Israel . currently finishing my bachelor degree in international relations and preparing to travel to Kenya :)Become supports children, families and 
communities in developing countries to overcome poverty and injustice. 
Become invests in self-sustainable, income-generating strategies to help
 orphans, vulnerable children and their communities meet their basic 
needs, reach their potential, and BECOME whatever they want to BE.
 A delegation of talented volunteers traveled to Kenya 
last summer with Become, to rebuild a clinic, and facilitate a number 
of community health awareness raising initiatives facilitated by medical
 experts from our team and Sylvia, Abba's co-director (another organization we will be working woth in kenya) and resident 
nurse. Rebuilding the clinic has enabled it to reach the next step in receiving certification with the Kenyan Ministry of Health, a critical 
step in providing top quality health care to a region with few medical 
resources, as well as to increase the traffic in the clinic bringing 
more income into supporting the orphans at Abba
  What We Need & What You Get This year we are aiming to :1-Build 2 houses for the orphanages and a guest house.2-developing and working on agricultural projects with the elderly in the village that we will be staying in. projects like: gardening, farming with animals and growing vegetables that will help them in yielding profits. this includes giving micro-loans for starting small businesses.3-activities with the children after school, and assisting them with their curriculum. 4-providing teachers with new computers. plus guiding them on how to use Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Wikipedia, and Google. 5-building ecological sanitary toilets. My goal as a volunteer is to reach the amount of 2000 US Dollars. So as to provide for the projects listed above.

children regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender, or socioeconomic 
circumstances, have access to basic human rights. Children worldwide are

story:
Bible. Business. Prayer. 

      

January is just around the corner, so open your hearts and let love in! Read on to find out how to help!

Background

I am a businessman who follows Jesus Christ. I have a “regular job” helping businesses grow, but my passion is leading trips of business people to Bukavu in eastern DR Congo.  On each trip, we take French and Swahili Bibles in the form of solar powered MP3 players.  Why?  Because we know from personal experience that the Word of God changes hearts, provides hope and promotes justice. We are gearing up for another trip! 

People in Bukavu need to know the Word of God.  

  They need change.  

Despite abundant natural resources, they live in one of the poorest and most violent regions of the world.  Accordingly, many have a fatalistic worldview.  Fatalism says that there is nothing I can do about my circumstances so there is no reason to try to create change.  It also says that God is irrelevant to my condition.

The Word of God presents a different worldview.

     

What We Need

We ask people to sponsor a French/Swahili Bible (a solar powered MP3 player).

You can sponsor a Bible by doing one or more of the following:

  • agreeing to PRAY for the recipient of the Bible and his/her "listening group"  (just email greg@CongoBlessings.org)
  • contributing $30 to cover the cost of the Bible
  • contributing additional money to cover the other costs of the trip

         

Purpose of Trips

On each trip, the team develops ongoing relationships with Congolese people while

  • distributing Bibles and training the recipients to form groups of friends to listen to and discuss the Bible at least one time per week
  • training Congolese Christians to start and grow businesses that can employ other people
  • training people to pray

You can read more about our business creation initiative and see previous trip reports at www.CongoBlessings.org. Sign up for our email updates here!

What You Get

We personalize a ZipLoc bag that contains the Bible Player with your name and a statement that you are praying for the recipient. Your name on the ziploc bag shows the Congolese people that you hear their cry and believe they can succeed. 

On most of the Indiegogo sites, you can get something now for a certain level of donation.  We are not offering those conventional rewards.  Instead, we remind you of some of God’s promises:

In 2 Corinthians 9:12-13, Paul says that the generosity of the Macedonians toward the impoverished people in Jerusalem brings praise to God from the people in Jerusalem receiving the gifts.  God is certainly worthy of praise.

In Luke 16, Luke recorded Jesus speaking about a business manager who was about to lose his job and decided to use his rich master’s money to gain personal advantage before it was too late.  Jesus commends him for acting shrewdly, but the lesson was really for us.  Our time is limited and Jesus implies that it would be shrewd for us to use money to gain friends for eternity in heaven.  When you sponsor a Bible for someone in the Congo, you will have an opportunity to enjoy that person’s friendship in heaven forever.

In Philippians 4, Paul is thanking the Philippians for their gifts to him.  Then he says in verse 17, “Not that I seek the gift itself, but I seek for the profit which increases to your account.”  Paul knew that giving now produces a reward for the giver in heaven.

The Impact

Our aim is big.  We are asking God to transform the people of Bukavu -- their hearts and minds and ways of life.  We believe that as He transforms the people of Bukavu, the city of Bukavu will be transformed as well -- to the glory of God.  As change happens, we believe there will be less physical poverty and less violence.

   

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray. 

Go with us on our next trip. We are looking for business people, educators and other people who want to help in Bukavu and other cities in Africa.

Share this page, our Facebook page or our CongoBlessings page with your like-minded friends. 

Volunteer - Help us assemble a web-based business curriculum.

Volunteer - Help us build a web-based platform to facilitate the spread of this ministry model to other cities in Africa by other business people.

Email greg@CongoBlessings.org for more information.

story:
Dyani's European Discovery Fundraiser

     Hi! My name is Dyani Boykins and I am 13 years old. I have worked hard on my studies and my chores to enable my parents to allow me on this phenomenal educational trip. I am a tennis player, a cellist, local volunteer and on my way to becoming a global world traveler! 

      This summer I have an exciting opportunity to travel to Europe with People to People Student Ambassador Program and I need to raise funds to help finance expenses associated with my trip to Austria, Italy, France and Switzerland. 

      My dad is deployed and my mother is a full-time student and homemaker; so any contribution will be helpful and greatly appreciated in helping me achieve my once in a life time dream.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need to raise $8,000 for the trip this summer - it will help me to pay for all of the trips expenses including: airfare, taxes, fees, room, board and unique educational experiences abroad.
  • Everyone who donates will get a personal email from me once I return with a picture of the four locations I travel to.
  • All funds will go to my trip; if I am unable to raise all the funds this year I will put the funds in an account in an attempt to make the trip the following year.
  • Any funds over my $8,000 goal will be donated to 2nd Chance Ministries to help their endeavors with the homeless in my community.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a HUGE difference:

  • You will help me to increase my Cultural Intelligence as I will visit with world leaders, government officials and local dignitaries in the places I visit.
  • You will help me gain insight into the lives of others; as I will hear directly from Holocaust survivors in Austria and visit a concentration camp.
  • You will help me gain an academic edge! Did you know 80% of student ambassadors report acceptance to their first choice college?
  • You will help me to become a global citizen - confident, capable, and compassionate.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I appreciate the time you've taken to view my fundraising page. If you cannot donate, it's okay, I'm thankful for your consideration. You can still help by passing this link to your friends, family or co-workers who might be able to help out.
  • THANK YOU!!!!!! Have a Blessed day and remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Sincerely,

Dyani N Boykins

story:
I DON'T usually do this...but, Fatimah really needs your HELP!! All of you!

She's had a lot of ups and down's over the last two years (job loss, her fathers death, ending a relationship etc.) so when the opportunity came to be a Mills Woman and reinvent herself after dropping out of high school, she hopped on it!

Unfortunately, she can't afford her very last semester so she can graduate and needs all of your help. ANYTHING helps at this point!!

Please take a moment to get to know a little bit about Fatimah and her situation:

Short Biography

Fatimah Salahuddin is a promising first-generation African-American undergraduate student at Mills College majoring in Ethnic Studies and Education. As a Bay Area native she is also a former City College of San Francisco (CCSF) transfer student with a long history of social justice activism and equity advocacy within her community. To her professors, she is considered one of the most dynamic members of her cohort and brings an unparallelled level of intellect to any space she inhabits.

During her first semester at Mills College she was one of three students nominated for the Harry S. Truman Scholarship for students who posses a commitment to a career in public service. In addition, she became the first (and only) Half the Sky Movement Campus Ambassador for the PBS documentary series "Half the Sky: Turning Oppression into Opportunity for Women Worldwide" where she organized and hosted over 6 screenings of the documentary throughout the Bay Area while spreading awareness on women's rights. She has also been accepted into the accelerated dual-degree, Bachelors-to-Masters Program in Education with an Emphasis in Teaching at Mills. For the last year she has also acted as a Research Assistant for Black Women Birthing Justice with Dr. Julia C. Oparah. Her research interest involve Black feminist theory, urban education and literacy, socio-cultural constructions of learning and educational equity. Fatimah is also applying to be part of the 2014 corp of Teach for America to help create more representation of African American teachers in low-income schools in order to reflect the faces that fill the seats of these troubled classrooms.                    

What She Need's & What You Get

Every semester is indeed a struggle to settle my account, but with your help I hopefully will be able to graduate and be a part of Mills College’s legacy of successful women who transition into promising careers. Here is the GET DOWN:

  • Remaining out-of-pocket tuition (out of $21,258.98 for this semester) is $3,760.00
  • My books and supplies for this semester cost approx. $495.00.

Her last job as a Personal Banker at Wells Fargo was very demanding so in late November she resigned to maintain her GPA & academic performance which is currently at 3.25. Since than she has been offered the opportunity to co-author and publish an article with her department chair for DataCenter and to play a significant role in organizing the 42nd Annual National Association of Ethnic Studies conference that will be held at Mills College in April 2014. She is doing BIG THANGS and felt that resigning would be best for her future career.

Check out the Facebook page I created & manage to get more info on the conference: https://www.facebook.com/naes2014

Any money collected will go straight to Fatimah's tuition, books etc.so that she can enroll in Summer courses to finish her degree and participate in the commencement exercises this May. As she has stated "I'm just trying to turn my life around" and I know this financial hurdle is huge for her. Without your contributions, Fatimah will be unable to graduate from Mills this coming May, so every donation counts.

Be sure to check out the perks Fatimah is offering at the bottom of the page. Your donations could get you a free credit/debt consolidation counseling, 3 FREE dance classes in either Hip-Hop or Vogue with two of the most innovative choreographers in San Francisco, an individual dedication in Fatimah's Senior Thesis project, even an invitation to her graduation!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help, so:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Share on Twitter and Facebook and she'll be in your debt forever!
  • Say a little prayer and send some good energy my way!!

story:
About Muungano Community International

Our weekly programs are youth focused and provide the knowledge and skills needed for Kenyan youths to create a happy, healthy and purposeful adult life for themselves. We believe in in our new P.E.A.C.E. model and carrying out our programs in an atmosphere of fun, love and hope.

Organization Description

Muungano Community International is a non-profit organization based near Nairobi, Kenya. Muungano was started by Kenyan locals and is supported by the local community and an international network of volunteers. We organize and carry out weekly programs that center around active play, sportsmanship, citizenship, health, and personal as well as community enhancement through the teaching of applicable, real-world skills and knowledge. We provide experiences for youths and adults in the community as well as volunteers from around the globe that will promote the development of self-sufficient, vibrant and compassionate communities throughout central Kenya. Our mission is to promote and develop available, affordable, sustainable and manageable change in the areas of critical knowledge acquisition and information sharing, health, life skills and vocational development. Also, we value creating a learning environment that values personal and community growth along with a deep love and respect for all others of different color, creed and country. Many of our community volunteer projects are focused on improving the lives of displaced children and youths through healthcare, mentoring, community outreach, agricultural, education, sports and service.

Program Mission

To give youths the needed knowledge and abilities that are necessary for their development into happy, healthy and compassionate adults that can be a part of the solution to creating a Kenya that is peaceful, prosperous and adheres to a higher purpose. Our program aligns with and supports projects like the ONE Campaign and UNICEF's goals for world development.

P.E.A.C.E. Model for Development Program

PLAY - On a weekly basis, gather young people who are interested in playing football, active games and other activities as a way of attracting youths in need of critical skills and knowledge. All activities should be delivered in an atmosphere that is enjoyable, compassionate and promotes possibilities. Sportsmanship, fair play and skill development will be central themes during the "play" activities.

EAT - After playing, healthy snacks are to be provided to all participants as the kids cool down in a comfortable location. During this time, participants learn about accessing and creating healthy, tasty snacks and meals for themselves as well as their families.

APPROPRIATE MENTORSHIP - During the "eat" portion of the program, the volunteers take time to connect with the kids. This time provides opportunities for the development of relationships between peers and volunteer role-models from the local community as well as international volunteer mentors. Also, time to just "hang out" is given to further connections between participants and mentors. Mentors/teachers will also reinforce the importance of healthy living as well as pre-assess the days lesson focus.

CRITICAL LIFE SKILLS - Critical life and vocational skills are to be taught in an informal and fun experiential learning environment located inside and outside the classroom. Program participants will be taught and given structured opportunities to apply the life and vocational skills needed to survive and thrive in Kenya.

EDUCATION - Relevant and critically important information is taught to develop applicable knowledge that helps youths make positive choices that are a part of creating and sustaining a happy, healthy and purposeful adult life. Topics will include fitness, nutrition, hygiene, HIV/AIDS prevention, drug and alcohol abuse prevention, moral values, community, citizenship, non-academic learning, formal education support and the development of an attitude of love and respect towards ones self and all others.

Links:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Muungano-Community-International/238435839541362?fref=photo
http://muunganointernational.org/ (the official website)
http://helpx.net/host.asp?hostid=11610&network=9 (volunteering website)
www.one.org/
http://www.unicef.org/mdg/
http://www.unicef.org/post2015/ 

http://www.oneworldfutbol.com/  - We are excited to be supporting this campaign!
